Translate the following classical Chinese into modern Chinese characters: 
(Tang) Emperor Taizong said to his courtiers: "In the past, when the capital was first pacified, the palace had beautiful women and precious treasures, and every palace was full of them. Emperor Yang was still not satisfied, and he never stopped conquering. He also conquered the east and the west, and was warlike. The people could not bear it, and eventually the country was destroyed. I saw all this with my own eyes. So I worked hard day and night, just to make the world peaceful and serene. As a result, corvée labor was eliminated, the harvest was good, and the people were happy. Governing a country is like planting a tree. If the roots are not shaken, the branches and leaves will flourish. If you can be peaceful, why can't the people be happy?"
output: Emperor Taizong of Tang said to his courtiers: "When (Emperor Yang of Sui) had just pacified the capital, there was no courtyard that was not filled with beauties and rare toys in the palace. Emperor Yang of Sui was still not satisfied, and he conquered the east and the west, using up all his military strength to wage wars. The people suffered terribly, which led to the country's demise. I have seen all this with my own eyes. Therefore, I work tirelessly from morning to night, just hoping for peace and tranquility, which will make the world peaceful and without trouble. Then there will be no corvée, grain harvests will be abundant, and the people will live and work in peace. Governing a country is like planting a tree. Only when the roots are not shaken can the branches and leaves flourish. If the emperor can achieve peace and tranquility, how can the people not live and work in peace?"

instruction: Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text: Pei Ji often said: When he was young, his aunt was an official in the court, and he had a good reputation. When Ji went to his aunt's house to see her, he saw her leaving the court and sighed deeply, "Who is Cui Zhao? He is praised by everyone. He must be a briber. How can there not be chaos!" Before he finished speaking, the gatekeeper reported that Cui Shijun of Shouzhou was waiting for him. The aunt angrily scolded the gatekeeper and was about to whip him. After a long time, he tied his belt and forced out. After a while, he ordered tea very quickly, and also ordered wine and food, and also ordered the horses and servants to be fed. The aunt said, "Why were you so arrogant before and why are you so respectful now?" When she entered the door, she looked pleased and bowed to Ji, saying, "Rest in the academy." Before Ji went down the stairs, he took out a piece of paper from his arms, and Zhao gave him a thousand pieces of official silk.
output: Pei Ji, a man from the Tang Dynasty, once told such a story: When Pei Ji was a child, his uncle was an official in the court. He had a good reputation and was considered an honest official. Once, Pei Ji went to his uncle's house and happened to catch up with his uncle returning from the court. He sighed deeply and said to himself: "Who is Cui Zhao? Everyone says he is good. This reputation must be obtained by bribery. If this goes on, how can the country not be in chaos?" Before Pei Ji's uncle finished speaking, the gatekeeper came in and reported: "Shouzhou Governor Cui requests to see the master." Pei Ji's uncle was very angry after hearing this, and scolded the gatekeeper and asked the gatekeeper to use a whip to drive Governor Cui out of the mansion. After a long time, Governor Cui straightened his belt and forced to see Pei Ji's uncle. After a while, Pei Ji's uncle hurriedly ordered his family to give Cui Governor tea. After a while, he ordered to prepare a banquet. After a while, he ordered to give his horse grass and his servants food. After seeing off Governor Cui, Pei Ji's aunt asked his uncle, "Why were you so arrogant at first and so humble later?" Pei Ji's uncle walked into the house with a look of gratitude on his face, waved his hand to let Pei Ji leave, and said, "Go, go to the school to have a rest." Pei Ji had not yet walked down the steps in front of the door when he looked back and saw his uncle taking out a piece of paper from his arms, on which was written: A gift of one thousand pieces of coarse official silk.

instruction: Why does the EU help Ukraine?
output:
1. The EU is dominated by the United States. After World War II, the EU was basically dominated by the United States for security reasons, and in fact, it has long been a "chess piece" of the US "global strategy". As we all know, the real defense force of the EU is the "NATO" controlled by the United States. Therefore, the EU will be controlled by the United States and "NATO" in most areas, and must cooperate with the US strategy.
2. The United States has already controlled Ukraine. Before the Russian-Ukrainian conflict, the United States successfully planned and implemented the "color revolution" in Ukraine. And overthrew the former pro-Russian Ukrainian President Yanukovych. The several governments of Ukraine after the color revolution obeyed the United States and were willing to be vassals. At the instigation of the United States, they began to turn from "pro-Russian" to "anti-Russian".
3. Ukraine itself asked to join "NATO". After Ukraine overthrew the "pro-Russian" regime, its diplomacy leaned towards the West. And it cooperated with the US and the West's strategy to contain Russia everywhere, and actively asked to join "NATO" in order to better integrate into the West, and was willing to let the West be used as a gun to deal with its "mother country" Russia.
4. The West regards Ukraine as having strategic value. Obviously, Ukraine is a big country in Europe and is another powerful "fighter" that the United States and the West are very worthy of "cultivating" to defeat Russia. Because Ukraine has a certain weight that can "fight" with Russia, the EU will spare no effort to help Ukraine in this Russia-Ukraine conflict, with the goal of completely defeating Russia through this battle.

instruction:
Please answer the following questions:

Question:
What is the nervous system, what parts does it consist of and what are its functions?
output:
Answer:
The nervous system is a system responsible for transmitting and processing information. It includes the central nervous system and the peripheral nervous system.

Central nervous system: It is composed of the brain and spinal cord, and is the main part of information processing and controlling body functions.

Brain: It is responsible for advanced functions such as thinking, consciousness, sensation and movement.

Spinal cord: It is responsible for transmitting information and controlling basic movements and reactions of the body.

Peripheral nervous system: It is composed of nerve tissue and neurons, which transmit information and connect the central nervous system with various parts of the body.

Nervous tissue: It includes cranial nerves and spinal nerves, which transmit information to different parts of the body.
Neurons: They are the basic units of the nervous system and are responsible for transmitting electrical signals and information.
The functions of the nervous system include sensing external stimuli, regulating internal functions, controlling movement, maintaining balance and coordination, and realizing thinking and emotions.

Please answer the following questions:
Question: In the late 18th century, which founding father of the United States was hailed as "the author of America"?
output:
Answer: In the late 18th century, Thomas Paine was known as "The Author of the American Revolution". He was an important figure in the American independence movement and was famous for his contribution to the idea of ​​independence. His book Common Sense, published in January 1776, played an important role in inspiring the enthusiasm of American colonists to support independence. This pamphlet was widely circulated at the time and had a profound impact on promoting the independence movement.

In Common Sense, Paine used direct and easy-to-understand language to explain the reasons for opposing British colonial rule and called for the independence of the American colonies. His words expressed the resonance of many Americans at the time, prompting more people to support the independence movement. Therefore, he was honored as "The Author of America" ​​or "The Pen of the American Independence Movement".

instruction: Why does a rainbow appear after rain?
output:
After the summer rain, a semicircular rainbow often appears in the sky. It is caused by the reflection and refraction of sunlight into water droplets in the air.

　　We know that when sunlight passes through a prism, the direction of travel will be deflected, and the original white light will be decomposed into red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, and purple light bands. When it rains or after the rain, the air is filled with countless small water droplets that can deflect sunlight. When sunlight passes through water droplets, it not only changes the direction of travel, but is also decomposed into red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, and purple colors. If the angle is right, it becomes the rainbow we see.

　　The size of the water droplets in the air determines the brightness of the rainbow. The larger the water droplets, the brighter the rainbow, and the smaller the water droplets, the lighter the rainbow. Thunderstorms or showers often occur in summer. These rains are not very widespread. It is often the case that the sun rises over a certain area when it rains here. When the sun shines on the small water droplets that remain in the air after the rain, a beautiful rainbow appears.

Comparatively speaking, the air is dry in winter, and there is less chance of rain. Most of the time, it snows, and snowfall does not form a rainbow, so rainbows are unlikely to appear in winter. However, in rare cases, when the sky has the right conditions for the formation of a rainbow, a rainbow may also appear.

instruction: Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text: Mozi had a great master Fu Lu, who lived in Qin. His son killed someone. King Hui of Qin said, "Master, you are old, and you don't have other sons. I have ordered the officials not to punish him. Master, please listen to me." Fu Lu replied, "The law of Mohism says: 'Those who kill people shall be put to death, and those who injure people shall be punished.' This is why killing and injuring people are prohibited. To prohibit killing and injuring people is the great righteousness of the world. Although the king has granted it, and ordered the officials not to punish, Fu Lu must follow the law of Mohism." He did not agree to King Hui and killed him. A son is a private thing of a person; a great master can be said to be fair if he can endure his private things and practice great righteousness.
output: The Mohist school had a leader named Fu Yu who lived in Qin. His son killed someone. King Hui of Qin said, "Sir, you are old and have no other sons. I have ordered the officials not to kill your son. Sir, please listen to me on this matter." Fu Yu replied, "The law of the Mohist school says: 'Those who kill people shall be put to death, and those who injure people shall be punished.' This is used to prohibit killing and injuring people. The law prohibiting killing and injuring people is the great justice of the world. Although you, the king, have shown mercy to him and ordered the officials not to kill him, I, Fu Yu, cannot act against the law of the Mohist school." Fu Yu did not listen to King Hui and still killed his son. Sons are what everyone loves personally. The leader [Fu Yu] can be said to be fair in enduring personal gain and doing justice.

instruction: What is a zero-trust security strategy?
output: Today’s businesses are interconnected like never before. Your systems, users, and data are always stored and running in different environments. It’s no longer enough to simply secure your operational perimeter, but implementing security controls in every environment adds complexity. Both scenarios invariably lead to a degradation of protection for your most critical assets. A Zero Trust strategy always assumes that a threat exists, so controls are always in place to verify the authenticity and purpose of every user, device, and enterprise connection. To successfully execute a Zero Trust strategy, an enterprise needs a way to combine security information to produce a context of relevant controls (device security, location, etc.) that inform and enforce validation controls.

instruction: Why does red make cows angry?
output:
The vast bullfighting field was bustling with people. The handsome bullfighters were wearing red clothes with gold trims and waving red cloths in their hands. The bulls were charging around like crazy. The bulls, weighing hundreds to thousands of kilograms, seemed to have a grudge against the red cloth and kept charging with all their strength. So, we naturally thought that red was the color that could provoke the bulls to get angry. Is this really the case?

No. Bulls are actually standard color blind. It doesn't matter whether you wave a red cloth or a white cloth in front of them. There are several reasons why bulls get angry. First, this kind of bull is a North African bull with a very aggressive temperament; second, it has been locked in the pen for a long time and has long been impatient; third and most importantly, the bullfighter waving the cloth in front of it makes it very uncomfortable. Bulls are very sensitive to moving things, and the waving cloth makes it think it is an enemy, so it rushes over without thinking, wanting to show off its power. If the opponent does not move, for example, the bullfighter poses in a very elegant manner, the bull will not pay any attention to him.

　　So why do bullfighters use red cloth to fight bulls? That's because red is more stimulating to the human eye, and the spectators in the field are more likely to be excited when they see red. When the audience is excited, the performance will be particularly effective. Therefore, the red cloth is not used to amuse the cow, but to amuse the audience.

instruction:
Translate the following ancient Chinese into modern Chinese characters:
The emperor held a banquet in the Nangong of Luoyang, and the emperor said: "Don't hide the truth from me, all the princes and generals, tell me the truth: Why do I have the world? Why did Xiang lose the world?" Gao Qi and Wang Ling replied: "Your Majesty sent people to capture cities and territories, and then gave them to them, and shared the benefits with the world; Xiang Yu was not like that, he harmed those who had made contributions and doubted the wise, that's why he lost the world." The emperor said: "You know one thing, but not the other. In terms of planning and winning battles thousands of miles away, I am not as good as Zifang (Zhang Liang's courtesy name is Zifang); in terms of stabilizing the country, comforting the people, providing military supplies, and ensuring the supply of food, I am not as good as Xiao He; in terms of leading millions of troops, winning every battle and taking every city, I am not as good as Han Xin. All three are outstanding people, and I can use them, that's why I have conquered the world. Xiang Yu had Fan Zeng but didn't use him, that's why I captured him."
output: Liu Bang held a banquet in the Nangong Palace in Luoyang and said, "My dear princes and generals, please do not hide anything from me. Tell me the truth: Why did I gain the world? Why did Xiang Yu lose the world?" Wang Ling stood up and replied, "Your Majesty allowed people to capture cities and obtain land, so you came to befriend them and shared the interests of the world. But you did not do so with others. You killed people with achievements and doubted people with talents. This is why you lost the world." Liu Bang said, "You only know one aspect, but not the other. For example, in terms of making plans in the big tent and deciding the outcome of a battle thousands of miles away, I am not as good as Zhang Liang; in terms of pacifying the country, comforting the people, providing military pay, and not cutting off the roads for transporting food, I am not as good as Xiao He; in terms of uniting a large number of soldiers, winning a battle, and conquering a place, I am not as good as Han Xin. These three people were all heroes, and I was able to use them. This is why I gained the world. Xiang Yu thought of Fan Zeng but did not use him. This is why I captured him."

instruction:
Please answer the following question:
Question: In 19th century art, the Indian Ocean School was an art movement in which country?
output:
Answer: The Indian School was a French art movement from the late 19th century to the early 20th century, closely related to French Post-Impressionism and Pointillism. Representatives of this art movement include Claude Monet, Pierre-Auguste Renoir, Edgar Degas, etc. The artists of the Indian School are characterized by capturing the changes of light and color at different moments, emphasizing the expression of natural scenery and daily life. The name comes from an art critic who used the term "Indian School" to describe their works when commenting on Monet's paintings.

Although the Indian School was initially coldly received, it gradually gained widespread recognition and had a profound influence on later modern art. The characteristics of this art movement include the theme of natural light and color changes, and the use of pointillism to present more vivid pictures. It is regarded as one of the important preludes to Impressionism and modern art.

instruction:
Translate the following classical Chinese text:
When Ren was fourteen, he had no fixed teacher. He followed his teacher without fear of danger. He always said, "If a person does not learn, how can he succeed?" Sometimes he lived under a tree, weaving thatch into a hut, cutting brambles into pens, and carving tree sap into ink. At night, he read by reflecting the stars and the moon, and tied hemp to light himself in the dark. When he read a book and found something interesting, he wrote on his clothes to record it. His disciples were pleased with his diligence and replaced him with clean clothes. Before his death, he warned, "A lady who loves to learn will live on even after death; a lady who does not learn will be like a walking corpse even after death."
output: When Ren Mo was fourteen years old, he had no fixed teacher. He carried a book box on his back and was not afraid of long and dangerous journeys (to find a teacher). He often said, "If a person does not study, how can he succeed?" Sometimes he leaned against the trees, weaving white grass into a small thatched house, cutting thorns as pens, and squeezing tree sap as ink; at night he read under the moon and stars, and in the dark he lit the bundled hemp to illuminate himself (to read). When he had some experience while reading, he wrote it on his clothes to record those experiences. The students liked his diligence in study and took turns to exchange clean clothes with him. When he was dying, he warned his students, "If a person likes to study, even if he dies, he still lives in people's hearts; if a person who refuses to study is alive, he is just a living dead person."

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
People's talents and conducts are rarely complete since ancient times. If they have strengths, they must have weaknesses. If we record strengths and make up for weaknesses, there will be no useless people in the world; if we blame weaknesses and abandon strengths, there will be no abandoned people in the world. In addition, people have different likes and dislikes, and different interests. Even if saints are like Yi and Zhou, and virtuous people are like Mo and Yang, who can avoid being criticized and blamed? In the past, Zigong asked Confucius, "If all the villagers like it, what should I do?" Confucius said, "Not yet." "If all the villagers hate it, what should I do?" Confucius said, "Not yet. It's better for the good villagers to like it and the bad to hate it." The intentions of gentlemen and villains must be opposite. The villain's hatred of gentlemen is the same as the gentleman's hatred of villains. You should observe their feelings and listen carefully. If you listen to gentlemen, the villain's way will be abandoned, and if you listen to villains, the gentleman's way will disappear.
output: From ancient times to now, few people have all the talents and virtues. If we use the strengths and make up for the shortcomings, then there will be no one who cannot be employed in the world. If we only see the shortcomings and abandon the strengths, then there will be no one who can be employed in the world. In addition, there are love and hate emotions, and different interests. If the wise are like Yi Yin and Zhou Gong, and the virtuous are like Mo Di and Yang Zhu, who can avoid being ridiculed? Zigong once asked Confucius: "If everyone in the village likes me, what should I do?" Confucius said: "I can't be sure." "If everyone in the village hates me, what should I do?" "I can't be sure. I can't think that he is good just because the villagers like him, and I can't think that he is hateful just because he doesn't like him." That's because good people and bad people must act differently, just as villains hate gentlemen and good people hate bad people. We must seriously investigate the facts. If we listen to the words of gentlemen, the villain's way will be abolished, and if we listen to the words of villains, the gentleman's way will disappear.

instruction: What is "One Country, Two Systems"?
output: One country, two systems is a constitutional principle proposed by China's second-generation leader Deng Xiaoping in the 1980s to achieve the goal of unification. It was originally intended to resolve cross-strait relations, and later applied to Hong Kong and Macau, which were once British and Portuguese colonies respectively. One country, two systems means "one country, two systems". In the one country, two systems policy, Hong Kong and Macau are allowed to retain their capitalist economic and social political systems, while the rest of mainland China continues to implement the socialist system with Chinese characteristics. Hong Kong and Macau can continue to have their own political system, legal system, economic policy, financial affairs, governance system and external relations for 50 years.

instruction:
Translate the following article into modern Chinese characters:
Scholar He Yue, also known as Wei Zhai, once found more than 200 liang of silver coins while walking at night. He did not dare to tell his family about it, for fear that they would persuade him to keep the gold. The next morning, he took it to the place where he found the silver coin, and saw a man who came and asked him the number of silver coins and the seal on the seal, and found that they matched, so he returned it. The man wanted to divide the silver coins as a thank you, but Wei Zhai said, "I found gold coins but no one knows about them. They are all mine. What's the point of counting the silver coins?" The man thanked him and left. He once taught in the home of a eunuch. The eunuch had something to do in Beijing, so he sent a box to Wei Zhai, which contained several hundred gold coins. He said, "Come and get it another day." After several years, there was no news from him. He heard that his nephew came to the south for other things, not to pick up the box. So he asked Wei Zhai to send it to him. Husband Wei Zhai was a poor scholar. He found gold coins and returned them, which was acceptable for the time being; but he was not tempted by the money he had sent for several years. This is far beyond ordinary people!
output: Scholar He Yue once found more than 200 taels of silver while walking at night. He did not dare to tell his family about it, fearing that his family would advise him to keep the silver. The next morning he returned to the place where he had found the silver and saw a man coming back to look for it. He Yue asked the man about the amount of the silver and the seal mark. The man answered that they all matched, so he returned the silver to him. The man wanted to give him some of the silver to thank him. He Yue said, "I found the silver and no one else knows about it. All the silver can become my property. Why should I covet the benefits of these few taels of silver?" The man thanked him and left. When He Yue was teaching in the family of an official, the official sometimes had to go to the capital and deposited a box with He Yue, which contained several hundred taels of silver. He told He Yue to come back and get it when he had the chance. He left for several years without any news. When He Yue heard that the official's nephew was going to the south for other business, he gave the box to the official's nephew and asked him to take it back to the official who was going to the capital. He Yue was a poor scholar. He returned the silver he found to others. It was encouraging that he did not become greedy in the short term, but the official kept the silver in his house for many years without being tempted. This noble quality far exceeds that of ordinary people!

instruction: Why is IAM important?
output:
Identity and access management, or IAM for short, is a security discipline that enables the right entities (people or things) to use the right resources (applications or data) when they need them, without interference from the devices they want to use. IAM consists of systems and processes that allow IT administrators to assign a single digital identity to each entity, authenticate them at login, authorize them to access designated resources, and monitor and manage those identities throughout their lifecycle.

IAM is no longer just for employees. Organizations must be able to provide secure access to contractors and business partners, remote and mobile users, and customers. With digital transformation, identities are also being assigned to Internet of Things (IoT) devices, robots, and pieces of code, such as APIs or microservices. Multi-cloud hybrid IT environments and software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions further complicate the IAM landscape.

Because it sits between users and critical corporate assets, identity and access management is a key component of any enterprise security program. It helps prevent user credentials from being compromised and passwords from being easily cracked, which are common network entry points for criminal hackers looking to plant ransomware or steal data.

If implemented properly, IAM helps ensure business productivity and the smooth operation of digital systems. Employees can work seamlessly regardless of where they are, while centralized management ensures they only access the specific resources they need to do their jobs. Opening systems to customers, contractors, and suppliers can increase efficiency and reduce costs.

instruction:

What are the main environmental issues facing South Korea?
output: Answer: South Korea faces several major environmental issues. These include air pollution, water shortage, land degradation and waste management. Air pollution is a serious problem in South Korea, especially in urban areas, with industrial emissions and traffic pollution being the main causes. Water shortage is caused by overuse and improper management, especially during the dry season. Land degradation is mainly caused by excessive agricultural development and urbanization, leading to soil erosion and ecosystem damage. Waste management is an ongoing challenge, especially in the treatment and disposal of solid waste. The South Korean government has taken a number of measures to address these environmental issues, including improving air quality, water management and promoting sustainable development.

instruction: Why is there more ice in Antarctica than in the Arctic?
output:
There is a large landmass in the Antarctic region, known as the world's "seventh continent", with an area of ​​about 14 million square meters. The land has a weak heat storage capacity, and the heat gained in summer is quickly radiated, so there is a lot of ice.

Continental glaciers have also formed many ice barriers and icebergs.

The Arctic Ocean in the Arctic region occupies a large area, about 1,310 square kilometers. The water has a large heat capacity and can absorb more heat and then slowly dissipate it, so there is less ice than in Antarctica.

instruction: Why doesn't the stomach digest itself?
output:
The stomach can secrete gastric acid and pepsin to digest the protein in meat food and turn it into nutrients for the human body. The stomach itself is also made of protein, so why is the stomach itself not digested?

Scientists have discovered that the stomach can also secrete a sticky, jelly-like mucus substance that covers the inner surface of the stomach to prevent corrosion by gastric acid and pepsin. In addition, the epithelial cells of the mucosa on the inner surface of the stomach are a layer of tightly arranged special structures, thus forming a physiological barrier. This barrier can prevent gastric acid from invading. As long as the two "defense lines" of the mucus membrane and the gastric mucosal physiological barrier are sound, they can resist the decomposition of the stomach itself.

instruction:
Give a translation for the following original text:
Duke Ping of Jin asked Qi Huangyang, "Nanyang has no magistrate, who can be the magistrate?" Qi Huangyang replied, "Jie Hu can be the magistrate." Duke Ping said, "Isn't Jie Hu your enemy?" Jie Hu replied, "You are asking if it is possible, not asking about my enemy." Duke Ping said, "Good." So he appointed him. The people of the country praised him. After a while, Duke Ping asked Qi Huangyang again, "There is no Wei in the country, who can be the magistrate?" Jie Hu replied, "Wu can be the magistrate." Duke Ping said, "Isn't Jie Hu your son?" Jie Hu replied, "You are asking if it is possible, not asking about my son." Duke Ping said, "Good." So he appointed him. The people of the country praised him. Confucius heard about it and said, "How good is Qi Huangyang's opinion! He does not avoid his enemies when recommending people from outside, and does not avoid his sons when recommending people from inside. Qi Huangyang can be said to be fair."
output: Duke Ping of Jin asked Qi Huangyang, "Nanyang is short of an official. Who is suitable for the position?" Qi Huangyang replied, "Xie Hu is suitable." Duke Ping said, "Isn't Xie Hu your enemy?" Qi Huangyang replied, "You asked who is suitable, not who is my enemy." Duke Ping said, "Good!" and appointed Xie Hu. The people in the capital praised him. After some time, Duke Ping asked Qi Huangyang again, "The country is short of an official in charge of military affairs. Who is suitable?" Qi Huangyang replied, "Qi Wu is suitable." Duke Ping said, "Isn't Qi Wu your son?" Qi Huangyang replied, "You asked who is suitable, not who is my son." Duke Ping said, "Good!" and appointed Qi Wu again. The people in the capital praised him. When Confucius heard about this, he said, "Qi Huangyang's words are really good! He recommended outsiders without excluding his enemies, and recommended his own family members without avoiding his own son. Qi Huangyang can be said to be impartial."

instruction: Why did the Japanese attack Pearl Harbor?
output:
There are many different opinions about the reasons why Japan attacked Pearl Harbor. Data found after the war show that the Pearl Harbor incident was actually an energy war, or more precisely, it was an extreme measure taken by Japan because of the oil embargo imposed by the United States on it.

The United States hopes to contain Japan by blocking energy supply

As an important strategic material, oil has an inextricable relationship with war. As an island country, Japan is short of resources, and energy shortage has become its fatal weakness in dominating the world. In the late 1930s, 90% of Japan's domestic oil demand came from imports, and 85% of it came from the United States, the most important oil exporter at the time.

Before the attack on Pearl Harbor, Japan had been fighting a four-year war on the Asian continent with the aim of plundering the rich natural resources there.

Japan's aggression against Asian countries obviously posed a threat to the United States' Far East interests. However, isolationism in the United States also put the Roosevelt government in a dilemma. Isolationists believed that on the one hand, military aid could not be provided to countries threatened by war in the world, and on the other hand, economic sanctions could not be imposed on the aggressor countries. Moreover, under pressure from the British government and the US Congress, President Roosevelt was advised not to engage in military conflict with Japan in the Pacific, so as to avoid being unable to provide assistance to the Allies in the future. This would also divert public attention and make it impossible to pay attention to Hitler's invasion plan.

In July 1940, the United States passed the Export Control Act, which gave President Roosevelt an excuse to retaliate against Japan's wanton expansion in Asia. When the Japanese began their invasion of northern Indochina in September 1940, President Roosevelt used the act to impose a ban on the export of scrap iron and steel to Japan. Soon after, he imposed an embargo on aviation fuel and lubricants, claiming that these supplies could only be exported to Britain and other Western Hemisphere countries.

Meanwhile, the Japanese were also thinking and began to reassess their foreign policy. The Japanese military, especially the military leadership, had exerted a lot of adverse influence on foreign policy since the establishment of the pseudo-Manchukuo in northeastern China. At the same time, the military leadership was also the main force supporting an alliance with Germany and Italy. They advocated prolonging the war in China and advancing further into southern Asia to realize their dream of an energy-self-sufficient empire. In the summer of 1940, Duke Konoe Fumimaro became Prime Minister of Japan. The Konoe Cabinet acquiesced to the military's further expansion in Asia while working to reach a reconciliation with the United States. However, the Konoe Cabinet authorized the military to occupy bases in French Indochina and signed the Tripartite Pact with Germany and Italy, which made it impossible for President Roosevelt and Secretary of State Hull to make any concessions in the negotiations.
In the winter of 1940, the United States became increasingly concerned about the development of the situation after the British transatlantic energy supply line was devastated by German submarines. In April 1941, Germany occupied Yugoslavia and Greece and inflicted heavy losses on British forces in Crete and North Africa. President Roosevelt had to order the extension of the neutral zone in the Atlantic Ocean and the extension of the cruise line further east to prevent Hitler's attack. In May, President Roosevelt announced the further strengthening of submarine tracking and escort in the region and dispatched the Pacific Fleet to reinforce the Atlantic Fleet. After a year, the court was dark. Why was that? The king liked them, so the ministers were able to do what they did. What is the difficulty in practicing this kind of universal love? It is just because those in high positions do not use it in politics, and scholars do not use it in practice. "In the past, Duke Wen of Jin liked scholars to wear bad clothes, so Duke Wen's ministers all wore fur coats made of ewe skin, wrapped cowhide belts around their waists to hang swords, and wore hats made of cooked silk on their heads. instruction: Give a translation for the following original text: Ban Chao, courtesy name Zhongsheng, was from Pingling, Fufeng, and was the youngest son of Xu Lingbiao. He was ambitious but not particular about details. However, he was filial and diligent at home, and was not ashamed of hard work and humiliation. He was eloquent and read books and biographies. In the fifth year of Yongping, his brother Gu was summoned to be a proofreader, and Chao followed his mother to Luoyang. His family was poor, so he often worked as a bookkeeper for officials to support himself. After working hard for a long time, he once stopped his work and sighed, "If a man has no other ambitions, he should still emulate Fu Jiezi and Zhang Qian to make achievements in foreign lands and be granted titles. How can he stay in the study for a long time?" Everyone around him laughed at him. Chao said, "How can a boy know the ambition of a warrior!"
output: Ban Chao was a man with great ambitions and did not care about small things. However, he was filial and diligent at home, often worked hard and did not regard labor as a shame. He was eloquent and had read many historical books. In 62 AD (the fifth year of Yongping), his brother Ban Gu was recruited to be a proofreader, and Ban Chao and his mother also went to Luoyang with Ban Gu. Because his family was poor, Ban Chao often copied books for the government to earn money to support his family. He copied for a long time and was exhausted. Once, he stopped his work, threw away his pen and sighed: "If a man does not have better ambitions and strategies, he should also make great contributions in a foreign land like Fu Jiezi in the Zhao Emperor period and Zhang Qian in the Wu Emperor period to get a title. How can he be busy with pens and inkstones for a long time?" People around him laughed at him, and Ban Chao said: "How can a boy understand the ambition of a warrior!"

There are high mountains and steep ridges, lush forests and bamboos in this place; there are also clear and turbulent streams, reflecting the left and right, and we use them as flowing wine cups and winding waters, and sit in the second row. Although there is no grand music of stringed instruments and pipes, a cup of wine and a poem are enough to express my deep feelings.

On this day, the sky is clear and the air is fresh, and the breeze is gentle. Looking up at the vastness of the universe and looking down at the abundance of species, we can enjoy the sight and feel the entertainment of hearing and vision, which is really enjoyable.

The ladies are together, looking up and down for a lifetime, some take what they want and understand the words in a room; some rely on their trust and let go of their bodies. Although their interests are different, and their calmness and restlessness are different, when they are happy with what they encounter and temporarily get what they want, they are happy and content, and they don’t know that old age is coming. When I am tired of what I am doing, my emotions change with the situation, and I feel sad. What I used to enjoy has become a thing of the past, but I still can't help but feel sad. Moreover, life and death are subject to change, and will eventually end. The ancients said: "Life and death are also great." Isn't it painful! (I don't know that old age is coming. Another work is: I never knew that old age is coming)

Whenever I read the reasons for the ancients' emotions, I feel like I have found a soulmate. I always sigh and lament when reading the writings, and I can't express it in words. I know that the death and life are absurd, and the Qi Pengshang is a fabrication. People in the future will look at the present as we look at the past. How sad! Therefore, I list the people of the time and record what they said. Although the times are different and the events are different, the reason for their emotions is the same. People in the future will also be moved by this article.
output:
In the ninth year of Yonghe, in the year of Guichou, in the early March, we gathered at the Lanting in Shanyin City, Kuaiji County, to perform the ritual of purification. Many wise men and capable people gathered here, both old and young. The Lanting has high peaks, dense and lush trees and bamboo groves; there are also clear and turbulent waters, which shine and surround the pavilion on both sides. We diverted the water as a circular channel to float wine cups, and sat in a row beside the winding water. Although there was no grand occasion of orchestral performance, drinking wine and writing poems were enough to express the deep and hidden feelings.

　　On this day, the weather was clear and the breeze was blowing. Looking up at the vast sky and looking down at the numerous things on the earth, it was enough to stretch my eyes and broaden my mind, enough to enjoy the visual and auditory pleasure, and it was really happy.

　　People interact with each other and spend their lives quickly. Some people talk about their ambitions in the room; they place their feelings on the things they like, and live a life without restraint and unfettered. Although they have different hobbies, and their quietness and restlessness are different, when they are happy with the things they touch, they feel contented, happy and satisfied for a while, and they don’t even know that aging is coming. When they get tired of the things they like, their mood changes with the current situation, and they feel sad. The things they liked in the past have become old in a blink of an eye, and they can’t help but feel touched by them. Moreover, the length of life is left to fate, and it will eventually be destroyed. The ancients said: "Life and death are a big thing after all." How can it not make people sad? 

Whenever I see the reasons for the predecessors' emotions and sighs, they match my sighs like a match. I can't help sighing and feeling sad when facing their articles, but I can't explain it clearly in my heart. I know that the saying that equates life and death is untrue, and the saying that equates longevity with sex is false. The future generations will look upon the present people just as the present people look upon the past generations. How sad! So the people who attended the gathering were recorded one by one, and the poems they wrote. Even though the times have changed and the things are different, the reasons that triggered people's emotions and their thoughts and interests are the same. Readers of the future generations will also be moved by the poems and essays of this gathering.

instruction:

Ban Chao, courtesy name Zhongsheng, was from Pingling, Fufeng, and was the youngest son of Xu Lingbiao. He was ambitious but not particular about details. However, he was filial and diligent at home, and was not ashamed of hard work and humiliation. He was eloquent and read books and biographies. His family was poor, so he often worked as a bookkeeper for officials to support himself. How can he stay in the study for a long time?" Everyone around him laughed at him. Chao said, "How can a boy know the ambition of a warrior!":

He was eloquent and had read many historical books. In 62 AD (the fifth year of Yongping), his brother Ban Gu was recruited to be a proofreader, and Ban Chao and his mother also went to Luoyang with Ban Gu. Because his family was poor, Ban Chao often copied books for the government to earn money to support his family. He copied for a long time and was exhausted. Once, he stopped his work, threw away his pen and sighed: "If a man does not have better ambitions and strategies, he should also make great contributions in a foreign land like Fu Jiezi in the Zhao Emperor period and Zhang Qian in the Wu Emperor period to get a title. instruction: Why do only male deer have antlers?
output:
It turns out that male deer show a particularly domineering habit during the mating period in late autumn and early winter, when their antlers have just grown hard. Every morning, male deer will run to the high ground to send out mating signals, and then unmated female deer will come over upon hearing the sound. And when the male deer takes in a female deer, the female deer must follow the male deer everywhere.

　　If they encounter other mating groups on the way, the two male deer will start a duel, and the winner can seize the female deer group of the loser. Therefore, a strong male deer often has dozens of female deer. From this, we can see that antlers are the weapons that male deer use to compete with each other, while female deer do not need such equipment.

instruction: Translate the following ancient Chinese into modern Chinese characters: Duke Huan of Qi went to see the minor official Ji, but he could not see him after three visits a day. Duke Huan of Qi said, "That's not true. Scholars despise the powerful and wealthy, so they must despise their king. If their king despises other kings, he will also despise his citizens. Even if Ji despises the powerful and wealthy, how dare I despise other kings?" After he went there five times, he was finally allowed to meet him. When people all over the world heard about it, they all said, "Even Duke Huan put down his airs to treat common people, how much more should we kings do?" instruction: What are the risks of artificial intelligence?
output:
Artificial intelligence, to put it simply, is machines doing things that humans need intelligence to accomplish, such as understanding language, identifying people or objects in photos, and driving cars. Although artificial intelligence can bring many contributions and benefits to mankind, its potential risks are not something to worry about.

The accuracy of artificial intelligence depends on the accuracy of the data it uses when learning. If there are errors or biases in the data, then its inferences will also lack accuracy and cause unpredictable consequences. If artificial intelligence is widely used, such as in the medical field and legal matters, then these risks should be paid more attention. In addition, if artificial intelligence is abused, it can cause potential risks such as data leakage, loss of control of artificial intelligence, reduction of jobs, and ethical issues.

instruction: What are the differences between bed bug bites and flea bites?
output:
Bed bugs are another tiny creature that feeds on human blood. Unlike fleas, bed bugs are active only at night. They hide in mattresses and carpets and then bite people while they sleep.

Unlike flea bites, which are most common around the feet and ankles, bed bug bites are found on the upper body. You'll see small, dark red spots on the face, neck, arms, and hands. Like flea bites, these spots usually appear in clusters or lines.

Bed bug bites are different from flea bites. Bed bug bites usually form red bumps or blisters instead of small red papules.

Bed bug bites are usually arranged in lines because bed bugs follow blood vessels when they bite. These bites can be very painful and itchy and usually occur on the upper body, such as the neck, waist, arms, and chest.

instruction: Why can the lotus flower “grow out of the mud without being stained”?
output:
Lotus is one of the ten famous flowers in my country. It is a perennial aquatic plant and can be divided into three major systems: lotus, seed lotus and flower lotus. It "emerges from the mud without being stained, washes in the water without being evil".

In people's minds, lotus is a symbol of nobleness and purity. So why can lotus and lotus leaves "emerge from the mud without being stained"? It turns out that their surface is covered with wax and has many nipple-like protrusions. The protrusions are filled with air to prevent the infiltration of muddy water. When their leaf buds and flower buds are pulled out of the mud, because their surface is protected by wax, it is difficult for mud and dirty water to stick to them. Even if a small amount of mud sticks to the leaf buds or flower buds, it will be washed clean by the turbulent waves. When they emerge from the water, they are naturally smooth and lovely.

instruction: Why can malachite be used to find copper mines?
output: It turns out that the chemical composition of malachite is mainly copper carbonate. If hydrochloric acid is dripped on it, it will bubble and make a hissing sound. Malachite is brittle and easy to break, with low hardness. It is generally the product of natural copper and chalcopyrite exposed to the surface and then weathered. Therefore, where there are many malachites, it often means that there are more unweathered copper mines underground.

instruction: Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text: Fanyang Zu Ti, who had great ambitions when he was young, and Liu Kun were both the chief clerks of Sizhou. They slept together. In the middle of the night, he heard the cock crowing, kicked Kun awake and said, "This is not a bad sound!" Then he started to dance. When crossing the Yangtze River, the left prime minister Rui appointed him as the military advisor. Ti lived in Jingkou and gathered brave men. He said to Rui, "The chaos of the Jin Dynasty was not caused by the lack of justice of the emperor and the resentment of the people. It was caused by the struggle for power among the royal family, and the Rongdi took advantage of the opportunity to poison the Central Plains. Now that the remaining people have been brutally attacked, people want to fight for themselves. If the king can really order the generals to go out and let people like Ti lead them to recover the Central Plains, the heroes of the counties and states will surely respond to the call!" Rui had no ambition to fight in the north, so he appointed Ti as the general of strength and the governor of Yuzhou, and gave him food for a thousand people and three thousand pieces of cloth, but no armor and weapons, so that he could recruit himself. Ti led more than a hundred of his followers across the river. When they were in the middle of the river, they struck the oars and swore, "If Zu Ti cannot clear the Central Plains and restore the river, he will be as bad as the Yangtze River!" Then he stationed in Huaiyin, started smelting and casting soldiers, and recruited more than 2,000 people before advancing.
output: At the beginning, Zu Ti, a native of Fanyang, had great ambitions when he was young. He served as the chief clerk of Sizhou with Liu Kun and slept with Liu Kun. When he heard the crowing of a cock in the middle of the night, he kicked Liu Kun awake and said, "Isn't this a disgusting sound?" Then he got up and danced with a sword. After crossing the river, the left prime minister Sima Rui made him the military advisor. Zu Ti lived in Jingkou and gathered strong and brave warriors. He said to Sima Rui, "The turmoil in the Jin Dynasty was not caused by the monarch's unjust behavior, which made the ministers resentful and rebellious, but rather the struggle for power among the royal relatives and the killing of each other. This allowed the Rongdi people to take advantage of the opportunity and spread the scourge throughout the Central Plains. Now that the remnants of the Jin Dynasty have been devastated and harmed, everyone wants to strengthen themselves. Your Majesty can indeed send generals to lead the troops and let people like me lead the army to recover the Central Plains. Heroes from all over the country will surely respond to the call!" Sima Rui had no ambition to march north, and after listening to Zu Ti's words, he appointed Zu Ti as General Fenwei and Governor of Yuzhou, and only allocated him food for a thousand people and three thousand pieces of cloth, but no weapons, allowing Zu Ti to find a way to recruit them himself. Zu Ti led his private army of more than one hundred households across the Yangtze River. While beating the oars in the river, he said, "If Zu Ti cannot bring peace to the Central Plains and succeed in the restoration, he will be like the great river, going there without return!" So he stationed in Huaiyin, built a furnace to smelt and cast weapons, recruited more than 2,000 people, and then continued to move forward.

instruction:
Translate the following ancient Chinese into modern Chinese characters:
(Tang) Emperor Taizong asked Wei Zheng: "Looking at the emperors of recent times, there are those who passed the throne to ten generations, some who passed it to one or two generations, and some who gained and lost their positions. I am always worried, either because I am afraid that I will not be able to raise the people properly, or because I am afraid that I will become arrogant and excessively happy or angry. However, I am not aware of this. You can tell me about it and I will take it as a model." Zheng replied: "Desire, happiness and anger are the same for both the wise and the foolish. The wise can control them and not let them go too far, while the foolish indulge them and often lose their positions. ... I hope that Your Majesty can always control himself to ensure a good end, so that you can rely on him forever."
output: Emperor Taizong of Tang asked Wei Zheng, "Looking at the emperors of recent and ancient times, some inherited the throne for ten generations, some inherited the throne for one or two generations, and some gained the world and lost it themselves. The reason why I am always worried is that I am afraid that I will not be able to find the right way to comfort and educate the people, or I am afraid that I will become proud and lazy, and my joy and anger will exceed the limit without knowing that I have exceeded the limit. Can you explain this to me? I should take your words as a guideline." Wei Zheng replied, "The emotions of love, desire, joy and anger are the same for sages and ordinary people. Sages can restrain them and not let them exceed the limit, while ordinary people indulge them and exceed the appropriate limit... I hope that Your Majesty can always restrain yourself to ensure the virtue of a good end, then the world will always rely on you."

instruction: Why is Kunming warm in winter and cool in summer?

instruction: Which of the two words, dare not do and cannot do, means not doing something out of fear?
output:
Although both the words "dare not do" and "can't do" indicate restrictions on actions, they represent different meanings.
"Dare not do" usually means not willing to do something out of fear or lack of confidence. In this case, people are worried about risks and uncertainties, and may have psychological barriers and obstacles. For example, a person wants to learn a new skill, but is afraid to try to learn it because of concerns about his performance or fear of failure.
In contrast, "can't do" usually means that he cannot do something due to objective conditions or limitations. In this case, people have a certain understanding of their own abilities or resources, so they will clearly know that they cannot do something. For example, a person wants to participate in a job that requires specific skills, but cannot do it because he does not have this skill.
"Don't dare to do" and "can't do" are not absolute classifications, but a relative state. Sometimes, people may be afraid and unable to do something, or they may be afraid because they cannot do something. Therefore, we need to analyze and judge in specific situations to determine the specific reasons and limitations.
Ultimately, solving the problems of "don't dare to do" and "can't do" requires different methods and strategies according to the specific situation. If you don't dare to do it because of fear, you can gradually expand your comfort zone and take some appropriate actions to increase your confidence and courage. If you can't do it because of objective conditions, you can find other ways and methods to achieve your goals. In either case, you need to have the courage to face your own obstacles and difficulties, and actively look for solutions to achieve your goals and values.

instruction:
Please give a simple translation of the following ancient Chinese text:
On Wu Zi day, the emperor said to his courtiers: "I have read the Collection of Emperor Yang of Sui, and I know that he is like Yao and Shun, not Jie and Zhou. However, why did he act in the opposite way?" Wei Zheng replied: "Although a monarch is a sage, he should be humble and open to others, so the wise offer their advice and the brave use their strength. Emperor Yang relied on his talent and was arrogant and self-righteous. Therefore, he recited the words of Yao and Shun but acted like Jie and Zhou. He was unaware of it and ended up falling." The emperor said: "The previous incident was not long ago, and it is a lesson for us!
output: On the day of Xu Zi, the emperor (Tang Taizong) said to the ministers standing beside him: "I read the book "Collected Works of Emperor Yang of Sui" and found that the words in the article are profound and profound. I also know that it affirms Yao and Shun and denies Jie and Zhou, but why does it do the opposite when doing things?" Minister Wei Zheng replied: "Although the monarchs of the people are all wise and sages, they should also humbly accept the advice of others, so that the wise can contribute their talents and the brave can do their best. Emperor Yang of Sui relied on his position, was arrogant and self-willed, so although he talked about the virtues of Yao and Shun, he did the deeds of Jie and Zhou. He had no self-knowledge and ended up in ruin." After listening, the emperor was deeply touched and said: "The lessons of the predecessors are not far away from us, we should learn from them."

instruction:
Please answer the following questions:
What is the human digestive system and what organs does it include? What are the functions of each organ?
output:
Answer:
The human digestive system is a system used to break down food, absorb nutrients, and eliminate waste. It includes organs such as the mouth, esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine, and anus.
The functions of each organ are as follows:
Mouth: responsible for chewing food and mixing food with saliva to begin digesting starch and protein.
Esophagus: Pushes the chewed food into the stomach through peristalsis.
Stomach: Secretes gastric acid and enzymes to further break down food into easily digestible forms.
Small intestine: Absorbs most nutrients, including protein, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, and minerals.
Large intestine: Absorbs water and electrolytes and converts undigested food residues into solid feces.
Anus: Excretes feces through the anus.

instruction: Why can it be sunny if fog appears in the morning?
output:
When there is a lot of water vapor in the atmosphere, in the second half of the night or in the morning, due to the drop in temperature, when the water vapor exceeds the saturation state, it will condense into small water droplets and form fog on the ground. This kind of fog is generally generated near high pressure, and there are often no rain clouds near high pressure.

In this way, the sun can shine directly on the fog. The warm sunlight evaporates the small water droplets in the fog, dispersing the fog, and the sky will clear up. This day is often sunny.

output: According to legend, in ancient China, there was a beautiful woman named Xu Niang. She was very good at singing and dancing and was loved by people. Once, Xu Niang crossed a deserted mountain to visit a sick friend. Long-term exposure to wind and sun caused her face to gradually age. However, even in her middle-aged state, her singing and dancing could still make people fall in love with her and admire her. Therefore, the idiom "Xu Niang half-old" is used to describe a woman who is not young anymore and looks a little old, but still retains some beauty and charm. This idiom is also often used to describe women who take good care of themselves to make themselves look younger than their actual age, or to describe women who still have a certain charm, especially after middle age.

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
The scholar He Yue, also known as Wei Zhai, once found more than 200 taels of silver while walking at night. He did not dare to tell his family about it, for fear that they would persuade him to keep the money. The next morning, he took it to the place where he found the silver. He saw a man who came and asked him the number of silver coins and found that they matched the seal, so he returned it. The man wanted to divide the silver coins as a thank you. Wei Zhai said, "I found gold coins but no one knows about them. They are all mine. Why would I need to count the silver coins?" The man thanked him and left. He once taught at the home of a eunuch. The eunuch went to Beijing for something and sent a box to Wei Zhai, which contained several hundred gold coins. He said, "Come and get it another day." After several years, there was no news from him. He heard that his nephew came to the south for other things, not to pick up the box. So he asked Wei Zhai to send it to him. Wei Zhai was a poor scholar. He returned the gold coins he found, which was acceptable for the time being. He was not tempted by the money he had sent for several years. This is far beyond ordinary people!
output: Scholar He Yue once found more than 200 taels of silver while walking at night. He did not dare to tell his family about it, fearing that his family would advise him to keep the silver. The next morning he returned to the place where he had found the silver and saw a man coming back to look for it. He Yue asked the man about the amount of the silver and the seal mark. The man answered that they all matched, so he returned the silver to him. The man wanted to give him some of the silver to thank him. He Yue said, "I found the silver and no one else knows about it. All the silver can become my property. Why should I covet the benefits of these few taels of silver?" The man thanked him and left. When He Yue was teaching in the family of an official, the official sometimes had to go to the capital and deposited a box with He Yue, which contained several hundred taels of silver. He told He Yue to come back and get it when he had the chance. He left for several years without any news. When He Yue heard that the official's nephew was going to the south for other business, he gave the box to the official's nephew and asked him to take it back to the official who was going to the capital. He Yue was a poor scholar. He returned the silver he found to others. It was encouraging not to be greedy in the short term, but the official kept the silver in his home for many years without being tempted. This noble quality far exceeds that of ordinary people!

instruction: Why do shrimps and crabs turn red after being cooked?
output:
This is related to chemistry. It turns out that there is a bright red pigment in the shells of cooked shrimps and crabs. If the red shells of shrimps and crabs are immersed in a chemical called acetone, this pigment will dye the acetone into a beautiful orange-red color, and the shell will fade and become lighter. Later, someone separated this pigment from lobster eggs and named it arttaxin.

Animals that contain arttaxin are not just shrimps and crabs, many crustaceans also use arttaxin to dress themselves up. Some small shellfish mainly contain encapsulant, and some crabs contain erythrin. These pigments, including arttaxin, have a similar structure to carotene, and they are widely distributed in nature in large quantities. The chemical name is ketocarotene, which is the main component of the pigment contained in animals such as "shrimp soldiers and crabs".

The body color of living crustaceans varies due to different species and different environments, but no matter what the body color of living "shrimp soldiers and crabs" is, as long as it is soaked in formaldehyde or heated, it will turn red. This is because the pigment protein in the organism denatures when heated, and the pigment originally combined with the protein "escaped" and revealed the red color.

In addition, the shell of dead shrimps and crabs will also turn red due to the denaturation of protein in the body and the escape of pigment.

instruction: What does the future of IAM look like?
output:
With remote work becoming the norm and mobile device usage at its peak, the identity and access management space has expanded significantly. Unsecured networks and unprecedented user expectations have led to a flood of new device connections, a constant stream of remote access requests for sensitive information, and the looming threat of phishing and other web-based attacks as users visit rogue websites.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) plays a major role in the future of IAM because of its ability to recognize patterns and expand knowledge exponentially at the same rate as risk.

With continuous authentication, the user's context is constantly evaluated at every interaction. AI is able to analyze micro-interactions while taking into account time, location, and even user movement, calculating the potential risk level at each point. Next-generation AV software, host-based firewalls, and/or endpoint detection and response (EDR) will continue to evolve and add more security within organizations.

instruction: Please introduce the white chicken
output:
Boiled chicken is a popular traditional Chinese dish, especially in Guangdong and Singapore. The characteristic of this dish is that its cooking method is simple, but it requires skills to make the meat tender and the skin smooth.

The method of boiling chicken is mainly to slowly cook the whole chicken in boiling water, and then rinse it with cold water to tighten the skin and form a smooth texture. During the cooking process, some seasonings such as ginger, scallions, and salt are generally added to increase the flavor of the chicken.

Boiled chicken is usually served with ginger garlic sauce or soy sauce as a dipping sauce. In Singapore and Malaysia, boiled chicken is often sold with chicken oil rice as "Hainanese chicken rice", which is a very popular street snack.

The key to boiled chicken is the selection of ingredients and the control of the heat. The selected chicken needs to be fresh, preferably free-range chicken or native chicken, and the heat must be just right to ensure that the chicken is cooked through but not overcooked, and the taste is delicate and tender.

instruction: Who is Cao Xueqin?
output: Cao Xueqin, whose real name was Zhan, whose courtesy name was Mengruan, and whose pseudonyms were Xueqin, Qinpu, and Qinxi, was a novelist, poet, and painter in the Qing Dynasty. He was the author of the Chinese classic Dream of the Red Chamber. He was born in Jiangning Prefecture of the Qing Dynasty, and his ancestral home was in Liaoyang. He was born into a family of bondservants of the Plain White Banner of the Imperial Household Department of the Qing Dynasty. Fudan University used DNA to prove that he was a descendant of Cao Cao, the prime minister of the Han Dynasty.

instruction: Why do Chinese people drive on the right?
output:
"Finding the Way in China" written by American He Wei is about to become a bestseller. The April edition I got is already the 4th edition. The total print run should be 40,000 copies.

　　There are some interesting things in it. For example, why do Chinese people drive on the right side?

　　In ancient times, Chinese people drove horse-drawn carriages and other things to the left, leaving their own right side and others' left side. The so-called "waiting for the left side". If China's traffic rules develop along this line of thought, Shanghai's rickshaw drivers will become Ford drivers and should gallop on the left side of the Huangpu River Bund Highway.

　　However, after 1945, the few Hummers and Ford cars in China all galloped on the right side of the road. Right-hand driving, this is how the Americans drove on the intercontinental highway in the Great Plains of the Central Plains. Why should we learn from the United States?

The story goes back to the Anti-Japanese War. During that war, the Chongqing government, which moved to the rear, received assistance from many American soldiers. The American transport team drove in Chongqing and went to the right, while the local Chinese mansion masters went to the left. "Bang bang", traffic accidents occurred frequently. At the strong request of the US military commander, Chiang Kai-shek ordered that the whole country go to the right. So, we went to the right. Just like the Americans.

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
The emperor went to Cuiwei Palace and asked his ministers, "Since ancient times, although the emperors pacified Zhongxia, they could not subdue Rong and Di. I am not as talented as the ancients, but my achievements are better than theirs. I will not explain the reason. Please speak your mind." The ministers all said, "Your Majesty's merits are like heaven and earth, and all things cannot be named." The emperor said, "No. The reason why I can achieve this is only due to five things. Since ancient times, emperors often hate those who are better than themselves. I see the good in others as if I have it myself. People's behavior and ability cannot be perfect at the same time. I always abandon their shortcomings and take their strengths. The ruler often promotes the virtuous and wants to put them in his care. , and when I dismiss the unworthy, I want to push them into the abyss. When I see a virtuous person, I respect him, and when I see an unworthy person, I pity him, and the virtuous and the unworthy are each in their proper place. Most rulers hate the upright, and punish them secretly or openly, without a single generation without this. Since I ascended the throne, upright people have been shoulder to shoulder in the court, and I have never dismissed or blamed a single one. Since ancient times, people have valued the Chinese and despised the barbarians and the Di people. I alone love them all equally, so their tribes all rely on me like their parents. These five are the reasons why I have achieved what I have today. ” He turned to Chu Suiliang and said, “You have been a historian. Is what I said true?” He replied, “Your Majesty’s great virtues are beyond description, and you only give yourself these five, which is probably a humble intention.”
output: Emperor Taizong of Tang asked his ministers in Cuiwei Hall: "Emperors since ancient times have pacified the Central Plains, but they could not make the ethnic minorities in the northwest submit. My talent is not greater than that of the ancient emperors, but my achievements are greater than theirs. I don't know why. Please speak frankly." The ministers all said: "Your Majesty's merits are as vast as the heaven and earth, and there is nothing to say about other things." Emperor Taizong of Tang said: "You can't say that. The reason why I have such merits is that I have achieved five things: First, since ancient times, emperors have been jealous of those who are better than themselves. When I see the advantages of others, I treat them as my own advantages, as if they were my own advantages. Second, everyone's behavioral ability cannot be perfect, so I abandon their shortcomings and take their strengths. Third, most monarchs, when they see good people, want to hold them in their arms; when they see bad people, want to push them into the abyss. But I respect talented people when I see them; when I see people who perform poorly, I educate them from the perspective of love. So that both the virtuous and the unvirtuous can be in their proper place. Fourth, most monarchs do not like people to criticize them in person, and secretly harm or openly attack those who speak out. There is no dynasty that is not like this. Since I took the throne, there have been many people who speak out, and no one has been dismissed because of this. Fifth, the tradition regards the Han people as noble and discriminates against ethnic minorities, but I am the only one who treats them equally and loves them, so ethnic minorities rely on me like they rely on their parents. The above five reasons are the reasons why I can achieve what I have today. "

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
Fang Zhongyong, a native of Jinxi, was a farmer for generations. Zhongyong was five years old and had never seen any writing tools. Suddenly, he cried and asked for one. His father was surprised and borrowed some from a neighbor. He then wrote four lines of poetry and signed them with his own name. His poems were about supporting his parents and raising his family. They were circulated in the whole village. He could write poems on the spot by pointing at objects, and his writing and logic were both impressive. The people in the town were surprised by this and gradually invited his father to visit him. Sometimes he gave him money. His father was pleased with this and took Zhongyong around to visit the people in the town every day, but did not let him study. I have heard of him for a long time. In the Mingdao period, I returned home from my ancestors and saw him at my uncle's house. He was twelve or thirteen years old. I asked him to write poems, but he could not match the previous reputation. Seven years later, he returned from Yangzhou and went to his uncle's house again. When I asked him about him, he said, "He is just like everyone else!"
output: Fang Zhongyong, a commoner in Jinxi, has been farming for generations. When Zhongyong was five years old, he had never known pen, ink, paper, or inkstone. One day, he suddenly cried and asked for these things. His father was surprised and borrowed them from a neighboring family. Zhongyong immediately wrote four lines of poetry and titled them with his own name. This poem is about supporting parents and uniting people of the same clan, and it was sent to the whole township for viewing. From then on, he was asked to write poems on designated items, and he could write them immediately. The literary talent and truth of the poems were worth seeing. People in the same county were surprised by him, and gradually treated his father as a guest. Some people even paid Zhongyong to write poems. His father thought it was profitable, so he took Zhongyong to visit people in the same county every day and didn't let him study. I heard about this for a long time. During the Mingdao period, I returned to my hometown with my father and met him at my uncle's house. He was already twelve or thirteen years old. He was asked to write poems, but the poems he wrote were not as good as his previous reputation. Seven years later, I came back from Yangzhou and once again visited my uncle's home and asked him about Fang Zhongyong's situation. He replied, "his talent has completely disappeared and he has become an ordinary person."

instruction: Why do I always lose when playing slot machines?
output:
I believe many people have had the experience of playing "slot machines". Some people gamble for fun and get out in time. These people are fortunate. However, there are also many people who are deeply trapped in it and cannot extricate themselves. In the end, they lose everything and owe huge high-interest loans. What's worse, some end up with their wives and children separated and their families broken up. Then we can't help but ask, why do we always lose when playing "slot machines"? Next, I will deeply analyze this problem through mathematics and human nature.

In theory, the machine program is designed, and the probability of winning and losing should be similar, but why do we always lose? I will use the more common odds of 6,6,8,8,8,8,12,12 as an example to explain. First, the odds are set fairly. We can easily verify that 1/6+1/6+1/8+1/8+1/8+1/8+1/12+1/12=1. Secondly, the program is also pre-set, that is, for a certain game, you bet 10 points and 1000 points. So, where is the problem?

First: We lost in common sense judgment. Although the program is designed, it is designed by someone after all, not randomly generated. We often encounter this kind of program, such as 6 times the rabbit, 4 or 5 times in a row, what is the concept? The probability of getting a rabbit is 1/6, and the theoretical probability of getting 5 consecutive draws is 1/7776. On average, one draw takes one minute, and there are 60 draws per hour in 24 hours a day. In other words, in theory, this situation will only occur once every 5.4 days on average, but in reality, we often encounter it 3 or 4 times a day. This is obviously unreasonable, and the reason lies in the human factors.

For example, if I bet on 12 times Eagle now, theoretically, it should come out once every 12 draws on average, but in reality, it is entirely possible that it will not come out for 32 consecutive draws (about half an hour). If I catch up with the extra 20 draws, I may lose all my capital, and naturally I will not be able to make up for it. Let's calculate again, what is the theoretical probability of not getting an eagle in 32 consecutive games? The probability of not getting an eagle in one game is 1-1/12=11/12, and the probability of not getting an eagle in 30 games is (11/12)^32, which is approximately equal to 6%. In mathematics, we call events with a probability less than 5% a small probability event, which means that it can be assumed that the event will not happen. His probability is already quite close, and in fact, this situation often happens.

Second: We lose because of our greed. Many people have this experience. When they first start playing, they encounter a good program and win quickly, but they are unwilling to leave after winning, and they still think that they have not won enough. So I continued to fight until I encountered the above program. I still didn't believe it and had to chase it. In the end, I lost everything with my capital and interest. Every time I lost, I told myself that I would only win as much as I could next time. A little bit of money can make a lot. This is indeed the truth, but how many people can really do it? If you bring 10,000 and win 1,000, it is still relatively easy. If you stick to it, your monthly income can still reach 30,000. But in fact, if you bring 10,000 and want to win 10,000, excessive greed will eventually lead to you losing everything.

So here I advise everyone to cherish life and stay away from electronic heroin. It's not too late to turn back now!

instruction: Why do snails leave a wet trail when they crawl?
output:
The body of a snail is very soft and is afraid of being worn by hard objects on the ground, so when crawling, it secretes a slippery mucus from its foot glands to reduce the friction between its feet and the ground. This is also conducive to the rapid movement of the feet.

Therefore, after a snail passes by, it always leaves a bright wet mark behind it.
