instruction: Question: What are the most common sports?
output: Answer: The most common exercises we do in daily life are: aerobic exercise, strength training and flexibility exercise. Aerobic exercise is mainly to improve and enhance the body's aerobic work capacity. Such exercises include walking (strolling, brisk walking, quantitative walking, walking with a cane and race walking), jogging (or fitness running), alternating walking and running, cycling, running on a treadmill, aerobic dance, aerobics and non-intense ball games. Strength training is an exercise that focuses on strengthening strength and bodybuilding. For example, strength exercises using weight-bearing or impedance methods such as dumbbells, barbells, springs and rubber bands can help prevent and treat osteoporosis. Flexibility exercises are exercises that stretch muscles and ligaments and are accompanied by adjusting breathing rhythms, such as yoga, medical gymnastics and various health-preserving qigong. Strength and flexibility exercises are indispensable in both warm-up activities before aerobic or strength exercises and finishing activities after the end.

instruction: Why do people hiccup?
output: There is a diaphragm in the human body, called the diaphragm. When you inhale, the diaphragm rises, and when you exhale, the diaphragm descends. instruction: Why can we see things in the dark using infrared?
output: Any hot object, as long as it is not at absolute zero, can radiate this invisible infrared light. The most obvious effect of infrared light hitting an object is to generate heat. In winter, when you warm yourself by a red-hot stove, you feel warm because a large amount of infrared light is shining from the stove onto your body. The wavelength of infrared light is longer than that of all visible light, so it seems to have a convenient leg. On the way forward, it can bypass almost all obstacles, even through heavy fog. When the enemy plane flew into our position, the infrared telescope had already received a large amount of infrared light radiated by its heat-generating part, the engine. The infrared light generated an electric current in the "photoelectric converter" of the telescope, and the electric current then generated visible light. Then the plane in the dark appeared in the mirror.

instruction: Why do earthquakes occur?
output:
Earthquakes are a very common natural phenomenon, just like wind and rain.

　　The vast majority of earthquakes are caused by the movement of the earth's crust. During the movement, the hard rocks are affected by forces, changing their shapes and sometimes cracking, which will cause earthquakes. Although scientists still have disputes about where the force that pushes the earth's crust to move comes from, and there are many speculations about what the fundamental cause of earthquakes is, there is no doubt that the direct cause of earthquakes is the cracks in the rocks there. The vast majority of earthquakes occur when new fractures occur in the underground rocks, or when existing fractures move again. Many strong earthquakes occur in places where fractures exist underground. When the underground rock is close to breaking due to the force, the gravitational force of the sun and the moon, the change of the pressure of the atmosphere or water (reservoir) on the ground can promote the occurrence of rupture, all of which may trigger earthquakes.

In addition, earthquakes are often the companion of volcanic eruptions. There are many volcanoes on the earth. Every time a volcano erupts, a large amount of hot magma erupts from the ground, the volume expands rapidly, and impacts the earth's crust, so it will inevitably cause earthquakes.

instruction:
Translate the following ancient text:
The emperor held a banquet in the Nangong of Luoyang, and the emperor said: "My lords and generals, do not dare to hide the truth from me, and tell me the truth: Why do I have the world? Why did Xiang lose the world?" Gao Qi and Wang Ling replied: "Your Majesty sent people to capture cities and territories, and then gave them to them, and shared the benefits with the world; Xiang Yu was not like that, he harmed those who had made contributions and doubted the wise, that's why he lost the world." The emperor said: "You know one thing, but not the other. In terms of making plans and winning battles thousands of miles away, I am not as good as Zifang (Zhang Liang's courtesy name is Zifang); in terms of stabilizing the country, comforting the people, providing military supplies, and not cutting off the food supply, I am not as good as Xiao He; in terms of leading millions of troops, winning every battle and taking every city, I am not as good as Han Xin. All three are outstanding people, and I was able to use them, that's why I conquered the world. Xiang Yu had Fan Zeng but did not use him, that's why I captured him."
output: Liu Bang held a banquet in the Nangong Palace in Luoyang and said, "My dear princes and generals, please do not hide anything from me. Tell me the truth: Why did I gain the world? Why did Xiang Yu lose the world?" Wang Ling stood up and replied, "Your Majesty allowed people to capture cities and obtain land, so you came to befriend them and shared the interests of the world. But you did not do so with others. You killed people with achievements and doubted people with talents. This is why you lost the world." Liu Bang said, "You only know one aspect, but not the other. For example, in terms of making plans in the big tent and deciding the outcome of a battle thousands of miles away, I am not as good as Zhang Liang; in terms of pacifying the country, comforting the people, providing military pay, and not cutting off the roads for transporting food, I am not as good as Xiao He; in terms of uniting a large number of soldiers, winning a battle, and conquering a place, I am not as good as Han Xin. These three people were all heroes, and I was able to use them. This is why I gained the world. Xiang Yu thought of Fan Zeng but did not use him. This is why I captured him."

instruction:

The family was rich with good horses, but his son liked to ride. He fell and broke his leg. Everyone came to offer condolences. His father said: How can this not be a blessing? After a year, the Hu people entered the frontier in large numbers. The young and strong drew their bows and fought. Nineteen people near the frontier died. This man was the only one who was lame, so his father and son protected him.
output: There was an old man living near the border. His horse ran to the residence of the Hu people for no reason. The neighbors came to comfort him. The old man said: How can this not turn into a good thing? After a few months, the horse came back with the good horses of the Hu people. The neighbors came to congratulate their family. The old man said: How can this not turn into a bad thing? His family had many good horses, and his son liked to ride horses. As a result, he fell off the horse and broke his thigh. People came to comfort their family. The old man said: How can this not turn into a good thing? After a year, the Hu people invaded the border area in large numbers, and the strong men took up bows and arrows to fight. Most of the people near the border died. Only this man was spared from the war because of his lame leg, and his father and son were able to save their lives. So blessings turn into disasters, and disasters turn into blessings. instruction: Why don't elephants choke when they suck water with their trunks?
output: Because the elephant's trachea and esophagus are connected, there is a piece of cartilage above the esophagus behind the nasal cavity. When water enters the nasal cavity, the muscles in the throat contract under the control of the central nervous system in the brain, prompting the cartilage above the esophagus to temporarily cover the tracheal opening, so that the water enters the esophagus from the nasal cavity instead of the trachea, so there is no spitting. When the water is spit out again, the cartilage will automatically open to keep breathing normal.

instruction: Why do you get diarrhea when you keep your body cool?
output: Cold is a strong stimulus to the human body. When the body is cold, especially the lower abdomen, the intestines will not shiver, but their peristalsis will increase. instruction: Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text: (Zhang) Pu was fond of learning when he was young. He would copy down the books he read by hand. After copying, he would read aloud and burn them. He would copy again and again, and repeat this process for six or seven times before he stopped. His right hand had calluses on the palm where he held the pen. In winter, his hands were chapped, so he would soak his hands in hot water several times a day. Later, he named his study "Qilu"... Pu was very quick in poetry and prose. He would not write when asked by people from all over the world, but he would write in a moment when meeting guests. Therefore, he was very famous at that time.
output: When Zhang Pu was young, he loved to study. He would copy the books he read by hand. After copying, he would recite them aloud and burn them. He would copy again six or seven times before stopping. Calluses appeared on his fingers and palm where he held the pen. In winter, his skin would crack due to the cold, so he would soak it in hot water several times a day. Later, he named his study "Qilu"... Zhang Pu was very fast at writing poems and articles. When people came to ask for them, he didn't need to draft them. He would just write in front of the guests and finish them immediately. Because of this, he was very famous at that time.

instruction: Why do washed eggs go bad easily?
output: When we observe eggs under a microscope, we will find that there are many small holes on the eggshell. The surface of the newly laid egg is coated with a layer of gelatinous substance, which blocks these small holes. This gelatinous substance can be dissolved in water. If you wash the eggs with water, they will be washed away. In this way, the holes are like broken glass windows, and bacteria will grow in and the eggs will soon go bad.

instruction: Why do wolves' eyes glow green at night?
output: The reason why the wolf's eyes emit green light at night is because of the special crystal points at the bottom of the wolf's eyes, which gather the weak and scattered light around, aggregate it into a beam, and then reflect it out in a concentrated way. So it is not actually the wolf's eyes that emit green light. This starts with the role of the pupil, which is located in front of the lens and controls the intensity of light entering the lens. Its size changes with the intensity of light from the outside world. At night, the cat's pupil becomes larger, trying to receive more faint light, but because of the convergence of the lens and ciliary body, which is a convex lens, the light converges in a small range. It is precisely because the pupil is larger and the photoreceptor cells of people in the dark are columnar cells, with enhanced sensitivity, that it is seen as bright! There are many special crystal points at the bottom of the wolf's eyes. These crystal points have a strong ability to reflect light, which can gather the weak and scattered light around, aggregate it into a beam, and reflect it out in a concentrated way, as if the wolf's eyes are glowing.

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
When Ren was fourteen years old, he had no permanent teacher and traveled far to various places. He always said, "If a person does not learn, how can he succeed?" Sometimes he lived under a tree, weaving thatch into a hut, cutting brambles into pens, and carving tree sap into ink. At night, he looked at the stars and the moon, and in the dark, he used hemp to illuminate himself. When he read books that he liked, he wrote on their clothes to record the events. His disciples were pleased with his diligence and replaced them with clean clothes. He would not read anything that was not said by a saint. Before his death, he warned, "A lady who loves learning will live on even after death; a lady who does not learn will live on even after death, but she is just a walking corpse!"
output: When Ren Mo was fourteen years old, he had no fixed teacher. He carried a book box on his back and was not afraid of long journeys, dangers and obstacles. He often said, "If people don't study, how can they succeed?" Sometimes he lived under a tree, weaving white grass into a small thatched house, cutting thorns to make pens, and carving tree sap as ink. At night, he read under the stars and the moon. If it was dark, he would tie hemp to light himself. If he read something that pleased him, he would write it on his clothes to remember it. His fellow students liked his diligence very much, so they exchanged his dirty clothes with clean clothes. He would not read anything that was not a saint. When he was about to die, he warned, "If a person likes to study, even if he dies, he seems to be alive; if a person does not study, even if he is alive, he is just a walking corpse."

instruction: What do the lines on a binary options chart mean?
output:
On a binary options chart, one or more line graphs are usually displayed. These line graphs are often used to represent the price trend of an asset and can be used to analyze market trends.

Specifically, each data point represents the price of an asset at a specific point in time. By connecting these data points, a line graph is formed. The slope of the line graph can be used to represent the trend of the asset price, that is, whether it is rising or falling.

In addition, line graphs are often used with other charting tools to enhance the analysis. For example, support/resistance levels or moving averages can be used to further understand market trends.

In summary, line graphs on binary options charts are used to represent the trend of asset prices and can be used to analyze market trends. However, using chart analysis is only part of asset trading and needs to be used in conjunction with other analytical tools to make effective trading decisions.

instruction: Why do tsunamis occur?
output:
The source of tsunamis is also earthquakes or volcanic eruptions, usually earthquakes, but they occur on the seabed. When an earthquake or volcanic eruption occurs on the seabed, the huge energy will cause the sea water to rise and fall violently, thus forming strong waves and pushing forward. This kind of wave is powerful far away from the coast, and it actually has no effect at all. Even ships sailing on the sea surface only feel slight fluctuations. However, once the tsunami enters the continental shelf, it can bring devastating disasters to the coastal areas.

In English, the word tsunami is called tsunami. In fact, this is a Japanese word, and the Chinese character is "津波", which means waves at the port in Japanese, which fully shows that Japan is a country that is often hit by tsunamis.

Although volcanic eruptions and other coastal landslides can also cause tsunamis, they are generally caused by submarine earthquakes with a magnitude of 6.5 or above and a focal point within 50 kilometers of the seafloor. After a strong earthquake, a circle of shock waves will appear on the sea surface. As the shock waves continue to expand, the circle will also continue to expand, just like the effect of throwing a stone into the water. Because the wavelength of a tsunami is greater than the maximum depth of the ocean, this shock wave can propagate to far away places.

The propagation speed of a tsunami is proportional to the depth of the water it moves. In the Pacific Ocean, this speed is generally between 200 and 300 kilometers per hour and more than 1,000 kilometers per hour. When a tsunami enters the coastal area, the depth of the sea suddenly becomes shallow, resulting in a sharp increase in wave height, and we can see a wall of water as high as 20 to 30 meters. When the wall of water comes down like a blanket, not to mention small lives, even houses and buildings will be swallowed up in an instant. Therefore, the disasters brought by tsunamis are often destructive. Many places hit by tsunamis usually have a lot of missing people, and most of them were actually swept away at that moment.

Before the tsunami comes, there is a rather strange phenomenon, that is, the tide will retreat all of a sudden, retreat to a place far away from the beach, and it will take some time for the sea water to rise again. What is the reason for this? It turns out that this sudden drop in the sea level is because the trough of the tsunami wave reaches this place. The so-called trough is the lowest part of the wave. When the trough arrives, the sea level must drop. At the same time, because the tsunami wave is different from ordinary waves, its wavelength is quite large. Therefore, after the trough lands, it takes a long time for the crest to arrive, and the water wall will only rush up at that time.

　　With such knowledge, people can completely escape danger before the tsunami arrives. During the tsunami attack in Indonesia, some people who lingered on the beach at that time saw the sudden drop in the tide and realized the possible danger and evacuated in time, thus saving their lives.

Just like earthquakes, people still have no control over tsunamis. They can only strengthen publicity and prevention in areas where tsunamis occur frequently to minimize unnecessary loss of life and property.

When Zhou Chu was young, he was fierce and chivalrous, and was a threat to the people in his village. There was a dragon in the water of Yixing, and a white-browed tiger in the mountain. Some said that Chu killed the tiger and the dragon, but he actually hoped that only one of the three evils would be left. Chu immediately stabbed the tiger to death, and then went into the water to kill the dragon. The dragon floated or sank, and traveled dozens of miles with Chu. After three days and three nights, the people in the village all thought it was dead, and they celebrated. Finally, he killed the dragon and got out. When he heard the people in the village celebrating, he realized that he was troubled by human nature and wanted to change himself. So he went from Wu to look for the two Lu. Pingyuan was not there, and he met Qinghe. He told them the truth and said that he wanted to change himself, but he had wasted years and would never achieve anything. Qinghe said: "The ancients valued hearing in the morning and dying in the evening. Besides, your future is still good. Besides, people worry about not being able to establish their ambitions, so why worry about not being famous?" Chu then changed his ways and became a loyal minister and filial son.
output: When Zhou Chu was young, he was a tyrannical and strong man who fought and quarreled with others, which was a great scourge for the local people. In addition, there was a dragon in the water of Yixing and a white-browed tiger on the mountain. They were a scourge to the people. So someone asked Zhou Chu: Since you are so capable, why don't you kill the tiger and the dragon to prove your strength? In fact, they hoped that the three evils would fight each other and only one would be left. After hearing this, Zhou Chu immediately went up the mountain to kill the tiger, and then jumped into the water to fight the dragon. The dragon floated or sank in the water and drifted dozens of miles away. After three days and three nights, the people thought that the dragon and Zhou Chu were dead together, and they came out to celebrate. As a result, Zhou Chu killed the dragon and climbed up from the shore with its head. Hearing that the villagers thought he was dead and expressed their congratulations, he realized that in fact everyone also regarded him as a great scourge, and he couldn't help but burst into tears and felt repentant. So he went to Wujun to find Lu Ji and Lu Yun, two famous scholars in Dongwu at that time. Lu Ji was not there, and only Lu Yun was there. Zhou Chu told him the whole situation and said, "I want to correct my mistakes, but I have wasted my time and I am afraid that I will not achieve anything in the end." instruction: What are the characteristics and functions of glass used as walls?
output:
Glass used for exterior walls is made by coating a very thin metal or metal oxide film on tempered glass. It can reflect light and also allow light to penetrate. The structure of these glasses is hollow, with mirrored glass on both sides, and the interlayer is filled with dry air, and the whole is assembled by a sealed frame. Insulating glass is divided into double-layer and triple-layer. Insulating glass can be soundproof, heat-insulating, moisture-proof, anti-frost, strong wind-resistant, and heat-insulating.

According to scientific measurements, when the outdoor temperature is minus 10℃, the indoor temperature of the room using three-layer insulating glass is 13℃, which shows its heat-insulating effect. In summer, it can block 90% of the sunlight, and the light passing through the glass will not feel hot, thus achieving a heat-insulating effect.

In addition, insulating glass also has the function of reducing the weight of the building.

instruction: What is "Qimin Yaoshu" about?
output: The Qi Min Yao Shu was written around the end of the Northern Wei Dynasty (533-544 AD). It is a comprehensive agricultural work written by Jia Sixie, an outstanding Chinese agronomist during the Northern Wei Dynasty and the Southern Song Dynasty to Liang Dynasty. It is also one of the earliest monographs in the history of agronomy in the world and the earliest complete agricultural book in China. The book has 10 volumes and 92 chapters. It systematically summarizes the agricultural and animal husbandry production experience, food processing and storage, use of wild plants, and methods of famine control of the Han working people in the middle and lower reaches of the Yellow River before the sixth century. It also introduces in detail the relationship between seasons, climate, and different soils and different crops. It is known as the "Encyclopedia of Ancient Chinese Agriculture".

instruction: What is the unit of current ratio?
output:
The current ratio is usually expressed as a unitless ratio because it is the ratio between current assets and current liabilities. The current ratio is usually calculated as follows:

Current Ratio = (Current Assets) / (Current Liabilities)

In this formula, both current assets and current liabilities are expressed in the same unit, such as US dollars. Therefore, the current ratio is expressed as a unitless ratio.

For example, if a company has $100,000 in current assets and $50,000 in current liabilities, then its current ratio is 2. This means that current assets are twice as large as current liabilities.

instruction: What are tonsils?
output:
Tonsils are located in the pharynx of the mouth, one on each side, and are shaped like flat peaches, hence the name. Whenever cells invade the body, the tonsils stand up and fight bravely to eliminate the bacteria. But the tonsils are not always victorious in the battle with bacteria. When the body's resistance is reduced, bacteria will prevail and cause tonsils to become inflamed. At this time, we will feel headaches, fever, sore throats, and fatigue. To restore health, we have to go to the hospital and ask a doctor for help.

How to treat tonsillitis? If the inflammation is not treated thoroughly and recurring, it will cause rheumatism or nephritis. At this time, you have to ask a doctor to remove it.

instruction: Why can disks store information?
output:
Computer disks can store information mainly because computers use magnetic recording technology and direct access methods. A very thin magnetic material is evenly applied to the disk and formatted as specified to make a disk that stores information. Magnetic materials applied to soft plastic films can make floppy disks, and applied to hard aluminum sheets (ceramic sheets or glass sheets) to make hard disks.

The surface of the disk can be a series of points, and the different polarities of the points after magnetization represent 0 or 1 respectively. Since the positioning of the points on the surface of the disk is usually inaccurate, formats such as sectors are also used to help find the location of the record. This is one of the reasons why the disk needs to be formatted before use. Since the head used to read and write information can quickly find any point on the disk, the access to information on the disk can be carried out directly.

instruction: Why does your stomach growl when you are hungry?
output:
The human body usually has some different reactions when it is hungry, such as the simplest "feeling" hungry, or "stomach growling with hunger", or even "dizzy with hunger".

　　Jorg Hassler, a scientist from the Potsdam Institute of Nutrition, believes that the "growing" is undoubtedly the most clear signal that you need to eat.

　　According to the German News Agency, Hassler's research found that when people say that their stomachs are empty and hungry, there is actually air and water in the stomach. In this case, the "pulling" movement of the stomach muscles will make the stomach form a "soft tube"-like state. "The air and water are squeezed in this hose, so they naturally make a gurgling sound," Hasler explained.

Scientists believe that the whole process is actually just a natural reaction in the human body. In addition, this reaction will be stimulated or strengthened by other reactions of the human body under certain conditions. For example, when some delicious food falls into your sight, causing your mouth to start to secrete saliva and your stomach to start to secrete gastric acid and other substances that help digestion, you will feel hungry, and your stomach will often start to "gurgle" in due time.

instruction: Why do they say the more you use your brain, the better it works?
output:
Scientists have shown that there are about 14 billion nerve cells in the human cerebral cortex, which are also called "neurons". Some people have calculated that people often use only more than 1 billion brain nerve cells, and 80% to 90% of brain nerve cells are not used. "Life lies in movement", this is a universal law in the biological world. People who use their brains frequently have their cerebral blood vessels often in a state of stretching, and their brain nerve cells will be well maintained, making the brain more developed and avoiding premature aging of the brain. On the contrary, people who are lazy to use their brains are prone to premature aging because their brains are less stimulated by information.

Scientists observed a certain number of people aged 20 to 70 and found that those who engaged in mental work for a long time could still maintain sharp thinking ability at the age of 60; while among those lazy people who did nothing all day and lived a life of mediocrity, the proportion of those with premature brain aging was much higher than the former.

instruction: Why do peacocks spread their tails?
output:
The peak period for peacocks to spread their tails is in March and April, which is the breeding season for peacocks. Spreading their tails is a sign of courtship for male peacocks. The male peacock with its tail spread out raises its golden tail, showing off, and walks with its head held high, as if showing its beauty to people.

In fact, this action is the result of the stimulation of sex hormones secreted by the gonads of animals. With the end of the breeding season, this phenomenon of spreading the tail will gradually disappear. In addition, female peacocks and peacocks also spread their tails to defend or warn against enemies. This is just like when chickens are attacked by eagles, the hen will raise her feathers and flap her wings in an attempt to protect the chicks.

As for the peacocks spreading their tails in front of the tourists in gorgeous clothes, it is not to compete with them for beauty, but the tourists' loud noises stimulate the peacocks and make them alert. This kind of spreading of tails is a reaction of demonstration and defense.

instruction: Why do you want to sleep after a full meal?
output: After a person has eaten a full meal, the food needs to be digested and absorbed in the gastrointestinal tract. To do this, a large amount of blood is needed to carry nutrients into the gastrointestinal tract to help digestion. As a result, the blood flow to other parts of the body is reduced. The brain is a very sensitive organ in the body. Once the blood flow is reduced, people become drowsy and want to sleep.

instruction: Why do dogs hide their noses when they sleep?
output:
The nose of a dog is much more complicated than that of other animals. In addition to the normal nasal cavity that has a sense of smell, there is also a hairless area on the outer surface of the tip of the nose, where there are countless small protrusions, and it is covered with a layer of mucous membrane tissue. On this layer of mucous membrane are "stationed" many special cells that are specifically responsible for the sense of smell.

　　For dogs, a keen sense of smell is really important. If the nose is injured, it will bring great inconvenience to the dog's life. Therefore, dogs are particularly careful about their noses. Therefore, when sleeping, they always hide their noses to prevent accidental injuries after falling asleep.

As AI systems become more advanced, ethical questions arise. For example, if AI makes a decision, who is responsible? The programmer, the user, or the machine? instruction: Can flea bites cause other problems?
output:
For humans, the risk of contracting other diseases from fleas is very small. However, bacteria can enter your body through flea bites and cause infection, especially if you scratch the bite. Infected bites will become red, warm, and may discharge pus.

Flea bites can also cause allergic reactions in people who are sensitive to them. Symptoms can range from bumps on the skin to difficulty breathing.

Flea bites can also cause complications in your pet, such as allergic reactions and even anemia from blood loss. This is why it is important to take your pet to a veterinarian if they have fleas.

instruction: Are people with big brains necessarily smart?
output:
In the animal world, great apes are among the most intelligent, but their brains are far less than humans. However, humans are not the best in terms of brain weight. The brains of whales and elephants are several times heavier than humans, but their intelligence is far inferior to that of humans. Former Soviet anthropologists used an index to indicate the degree of brain development: the larger the index, the more developed the brain. It has been determined that the index of humans is far higher than that of all animals. Of course, this does not mean that a big brain is necessarily smart.

In fact, there are many grooves in the human brain that increase the area of ​​the cerebral cortex and the number of cells in the cerebral cortex. Therefore, a small brain does not necessarily mean fewer brain cells, and a big brain does not necessarily mean more brain cells. Moreover, a person's intelligence depends to a large extent on the education and training he receives.

Thus suppressing the splash.

instruction:
Please give a simple translation of the following ancient Chinese text: 
(Tang) Emperor Taizong asked Wei Zheng: "Looking at the emperors of recent times, there are those who passed the throne to ten generations, some who passed it to one or two generations, and some who gained and lost their positions. I am always worried because I am afraid that I will not be able to raise the people properly, or I am afraid that I will become arrogant and excessively happy or angry. However, I am not aware of this. Can you tell me about it and use it as a model." Zheng replied: "Desires, happiness and anger are the same for both the wise and the foolish. The wise can control them and not let them go too far, while the foolish indulge them and often lose their positions. ... I hope that Your Majesty can always control himself to ensure a good end, so that you can rely on him forever."
output: Emperor Taizong of Tang asked Wei Zheng, "Looking at the emperors of recent and ancient times, some inherited the throne for ten generations, some inherited the throne for one or two generations, and some gained the world and lost it themselves. The reason why I am always worried is that I am afraid that I will not be able to find the right way to comfort and educate the people, or I am afraid that I will become proud and lazy, and my joy and anger will exceed the limit without knowing that I have exceeded the limit. Can you explain this to me? I should take your words as a guideline." Wei Zheng replied, "The emotions of love, desire, joy and anger are the same for sages and ordinary people. Sages can restrain them and not let them exceed the limit, while ordinary people indulge them and exceed the appropriate limit... I hope that Your Majesty can always restrain yourself to ensure the virtue of a good end, then the world will always rely on you."

Zengzi's wife went to the market, and her son followed her crying. His mother said: "Go back, I will kill a pig for you." instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
When Ren was fourteen years old, he had no permanent teacher and traveled far to various places. He always said, "If a person does not learn, how can he succeed?" Sometimes he lived under a tree, weaving thatch into a hut, cutting brambles into pens, and carving tree sap into ink. At night, he looked at the stars and the moon, and in the dark, he used hemp to illuminate himself. When he read books that he liked, he wrote on their clothes to record the events. His disciples were pleased with his diligence and replaced them with clean clothes. He would not read anything that was not said by a saint. Before his death, he warned, "A lady who loves learning will live on even after death; a lady who does not learn will live on even after death, but she is just a walking corpse!"
output: When Ren Mo was fourteen years old, he had no fixed teacher. He carried a book box on his back and was not afraid of long journeys, dangers and obstacles. He often said, "If people don't study, how can they succeed?" Sometimes he lived under a tree, weaving white grass into a small thatched house, cutting thorns to make pens, and carving tree sap as ink. At night, he read under the stars and the moon. If it was dark, he would tie hemp to light himself. If he read something that pleased him, he would write it on his clothes to remember it. His fellow students liked his diligence very much, so they exchanged his dirty clothes with clean clothes. He would not read anything that was not a saint. When he was about to die, he warned, "If a person likes to study, even if he dies, he seems to be alive; if a person does not study, even if he is alive, he is just a walking corpse."

Minehunters were born in the mid-1950s. At that time, minehunters were equipped with high-power sonars to detect mines, while minesweepers were still responsible for destroying mines. The new minehunters are different. They have two major tasks: mine detection and mine destruction. Minehunters can only destroy mines one by one, so they have limitations in use, but minehunters reduce the blindness of minesweeping operations and change the passive situation in anti-mine warfare. Minehunters need to make a careful search plan before hunting mines.

The operating speed should be able to ensure that the sonar has a good detection effect. After finding the underwater target, the identification sonar is used to identify it. After confirming that it is a mine, the mine destroyer is released and the explosive device is dropped to blow up the mine. Not counting the search process, it usually takes about half an hour from releasing the mine destroyer, destroying the mine to recovering the mine. When conducting formation mine hunting, a single horizontal team is usually used, and the search range of each ship's sonar should overlap to a certain extent to ensure that no mines are missed.

instruction: Does the size of your gallbladder have anything to do with your courage?
output:
The gallbladder is located under the liver. A normal gallbladder is about 8 to 12 cm long, 3 to 5 cm wide, and has a capacity of about 30 to 60 ml.

Some people say that the gallbladder is related to the amount of gallbladder, and that the gallbladder becomes smaller after gallbladder removal. This is completely unscientific. So, what is the function of the gallbladder?

First, it can store bile, which is stored in the gallbladder and discharged from the gallbladder when digestion is needed. In addition, the gallbladder can concentrate bile. Most of the water and electrolytes in the yellow alkaline liver bile are absorbed by the gallbladder mucosa and returned to the blood, leaving the effective ingredients in the bile stored in the gallbladder. Moreover, the gallbladder can secrete mucus to protect the gallbladder mucosa from being eroded and dissolved by concentrated bile. Most importantly, 3 to 5 hours after eating, food passes through the duodenum and stimulates the duodenal mucosa, producing a hormone called cholecystokinin, which can shrink the gallbladder and immediately discharge the bile in the gallbladder into the duodenum to help digestion and absorption of fat.

It can be seen that the most important task of the gallbladder is to help digestion, which has nothing to do with the size of the gallbladder.

instruction: Why do people shed tears?
output:
The cornea is rich in nerves, but has no blood vessels. Most of the nutrients it needs are provided by tears. On the outer upper part of the eyeball, there is an organ that is specifically responsible for "producing" tears - the tear gland, which keeps "producing" tears. Tears pass through the tear gland, enter the eyeball through the tear duct, and then enter the tear sac through the tear point, and are discharged into the nasal cavity through the nasolacrimal duct.

Tears can provide nutrition for the eyes. Every time you blink, the eyelids evenly spread the tears on the surface of the eyeball, making the eyes brighter. Tears can also wash away dust that enters the eye and kill bacteria. If the tears are less than usual due to illness, we will feel dry eyes and feel very uncomfortable.

What is the Prisoner's Dilemma?
output:
The Prisoner's Dilemma is a representative example of non-zero-sum games in game theory, reflecting that the best choice for an individual is not the best choice for the group. Although the dilemma itself is only a model, similar situations often occur in real-life price competition and environmental protection.

Although the prisoners cooperate with each other and keep silent, they can bring the best interests of all (acquittal), but in the case of unclear information, because betraying their accomplices can bring benefits to themselves (shortening their sentences), and because their accomplices can bring benefits to him by giving themselves away, so although betraying each other violates the best common interests, it is actually in their own best interests. In reality, however, it is impossible for law enforcement agencies to set up such a situation to induce all prisoners to confess, because prisoners must consider factors other than prison terms (such as retaliation for betraying their accomplices), and cannot fully consider the benefits (sentences) set by law enforcement officers.

When he met guests, he would write in a moment, and thus he was very famous.

instruction: What are the types of picture frame materials?
output:
The most common materials for picture frames are solid wood and PS foam. The main categories are as follows:

Solid wood. Solid wood photo frames are the most common, and they are versatile and very natural.

Cardboard. Cardboard is more delicate and smooth. It is a thick paper between paper and cardboard, and it is also very water-resistant.

Plastic. Plastic is lighter and not easily corroded, but it is more prone to aging, so it is not suitable for long-term decoration.

Acrylic. Acrylic is also known as plexiglass, with good hardness and transparency.

Resin. Basically the same as plastic.

Metal. Using metal to make a photo wall is very unique and has a very good glossiness. It is generally suitable for modern home styles.

Aluminum. Aluminum combines the advantages of plastic and metal, and is light and textured.

Glass. Glass photo frames are very beautiful. A photo wall with a set of glass photo frames at home also expresses the owner's taste, but the only disadvantage is that it is fragile.

Crystal. Crystal photo frames are a step up from glass photo frames, with a noble and elegant temperament.

Leather. Leather photo frames are very retro and can sometimes be combined with solid wood photo frames

Copper. Copper photo frames are also like leather, looking more retro and vicissitudes.

instruction:
Please give a simple translation of the following ancient Chinese text:
On Wu Zi day, the emperor said to his courtiers: "I have read the Collection of Emperor Yang of Sui, and I know that he is like Yao and Shun, not Jie and Zhou. However, why did he act in the opposite way?" Wei Zheng replied: "Although a monarch is a sage, he should be humble and open to others, so the wise offer their advice and the brave use their strength. Emperor Yang relied on his talent and was arrogant and self-righteous. Therefore, he recited the words of Yao and Shun but acted like Jie and Zhou. He was unaware of it and ended up falling." The emperor said: "The previous incident was not long ago, and it is a lesson for us!
output: On the day of Xu Zi, the emperor (Tang Taizong) said to the ministers standing beside him: "I read the book "Collected Works of Emperor Yang of Sui" and found that the words in the article are profound and profound. I also know that it affirms Yao and Shun and denies Jie and Zhou, but why does it do the opposite when doing things?" Minister Wei Zheng replied: "Although the monarchs of the people are all wise and sages, they should also humbly accept the advice of others, so that the wise can contribute their talents and the brave can do their best. Emperor Yang of Sui relied on his position, was arrogant and self-willed, so although he talked about the virtues of Yao and Shun, he did the deeds of Jie and Zhou. He had no self-knowledge and ended up in ruin." After listening, the emperor was deeply touched and said: "The lessons of the predecessors are not far away from us, we should learn from them."

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
(Tang) Emperor Dezong asked Lu Zhi about the most urgent task of the day. Zhi said that the chaos in the countryside was caused by the lack of communication between the upper and lower levels, and advised the emperor to accept the advice. He then submitted a memorial, which said in brief: "I believe that the most urgent task of the day is to carefully examine the public sentiment. If the public sentiment wants something, Your Majesty should do it first; if the public sentiment hates something, Your Majesty should get rid of it first. It has never happened since ancient times that the public sentiment does not follow the same desires and dislikes as the public. The root of the chaos lies in the people's hearts. What's more, when there is a change of circumstances and a time of danger and doubt, people will be rooted in where they are, and will be inclined to where they are. How can Your Majesty not carefully examine the public sentiment, share their desires and dislikes, and make millions of people follow the same interests to stabilize the country? This is truly the most urgent task of the day."
output: Emperor Dezong asked Lu Zhi about the most urgent matter of the day. Lu Zhi believed that the reason for the chaos in the past was the lack of communication between the upper and lower classes. He advised Emperor Dezong to get in touch with the people and listen to their advice. So he submitted a memorial, which roughly said: "I think the most urgent matter of the day is to carefully examine the will of the people. If it is something that the people like very much, then Your Majesty should implement it first; if it is something that the people hate very much, then Your Majesty should get rid of it first. Your Majesty's likes and dislikes are the same as those of the people in the world, but the people in the world are unwilling to turn to Your Majesty. This has never happened from ancient times to the present. Generally speaking, the root of order and chaos is closely related to the people's hearts. Moreover, when the changes happen and the people's hearts are shaken, it is a dangerous and doubtful moment when the people's hearts turn to it, everything will be prosperous; when the people's hearts are separated, everything will be in danger. How can Your Majesty not examine the will of the people, share their likes and dislikes, make the people yearn for it, and stabilize the country! This is the most urgent thing at the moment."

instruction: Why are river embankments wider at the bottom and narrower at the top?
output: The pressure of the river water on the bottom of the river bank is much greater than that on the top. Building the river bank wider at the bottom and narrower at the top is to adapt to the changes in the river water pressure and save materials. Since the gravity of the river bank is vertical, it will produce an oblique force with the horizontal thrust of the waves. If the total force exceeds the bottom of the river bank, the river bank will fall. If the river bank is built wider at the bottom and narrower at the top, the combined force will not exceed the bottom of the river bank, so the river bank can stand more stably. In addition, building the bank into a slope can also prevent the soil from collapsing. The volume is wide at the bottom and narrow at the top, so that the weight per unit area of ​​the foundation at the bottom of the river bank is relatively small, which reduces the burden on the bottom of the river bank and makes the river bank stand more firmly.

instruction: Why do damaged fruits turn black?
output:
This is caused by the rupture of the skin of the injured fruit and the film inside that acts as a "protective wall", allowing oxygen to enter the fruit. Oxygen reacts with some compounds in the fruit (usually embedding into these compounds) and oxidizes these compounds. Many compounds appear brown-black after being oxidized, so the injured part of the fruit also turns black.

　　To prevent the fruit from turning black, you can use citric acid. Because citric acid is very easy to oxidize, it can be used to remove oxygen and prevent the fruit from turning black. This is why if you dip apple slices in lemon juice, the apple slices will not turn black for a long time.

instruction: Why do my hands have so many wrinkles when I take a shower?
output:
First of all, this is of course a normal phenomenon. Water has the effect of relaxing and softening tissues.

Research shows that the skin on the palms and soles of the feet is the thickest, which has a protective effect on the hands and feet, which is why wrinkles are most likely to form. Our skin is actually covered with a thin layer of oil to prevent the skin from absorbing water directly from the outside. However, when we soak in warm or hot water for about half an hour, this layer of oil will be removed by the warm water, so the skin begins to absorb water. The surface of our skin is a layer of "epidermis", and below the epidermis is the "dermis"; the epidermis and the dermis are not completely "sticked" together. The epidermis is only tightly "bound" to the dermis by connective tissue in some areas, but not in some areas; therefore, when the epidermis absorbs water and "swells", the "bound" areas are confined and concave; from the outside, the surface of the skin has concave and convex, like wrinkles.

The epidermis is composed of tough dead cells. Under a microscope, some of these cells look like paving stones. Generally speaking, the epidermis is very thin, only about 0.01 mm, but the thickness of the epidermis on the palms and soles of the feet reaches or exceeds 0.5 mm, so the wrinkles are particularly obvious. In theory, swimming or bathing can also cause wrinkles on the skin of the chest and abdomen, but since these parts have almost no expandable stratum corneum, only some tiny wrinkles appear.

In the past, some women specialized in washing clothes for others. Their hands were soaked in water for a long time, and their fingers were often wrinkled, which became an occupational "disease" (or should it be a characteristic). In ancient times, laundry women were called "Piao Mu", so this finger phenomenon was also called "Piao Mu skin".

instruction: Why do we dream when we sleep?
output:
Late at night, people all fall into sweet dreams, some smile in their dreams, some babbling in their dreams. Why do people dream when they sleep? This is a question for each of our brains. There are many brain cells in each of our brains. Some of these brain cells control our speech, some control our sleep, some control our walking, etc. No matter what we do, we have to go through the brain. When we sleep at night, some brain cells rest like us, but some brain cells do not rest, so what we think or see during the day will reappear in our minds when we sleep, and this is a dream.

As the saying goes, "dreams are thoughts in the heart", this is what it means. We dream because some brain cells do not have enough rest.

instruction: Why does bleeding stop after an injury?
output: When the human body is injured, platelets flow out of the blood vessels and rupture immediately, gathering at the wound and releasing coagulation factors, which convert prothrombin in the blood into thrombin. Thrombin then converts profibrin in the blood into fibrin. Fibrin interweaves into a "net" to block the wound, and the blood coagulates.

instruction: Why should we protect historical relics?
output:
Cultural relics are the crystallization of our ancestors' labor, wisdom and revolutionary spirit, and have important historical, artistic and scientific values.

First, cultural relics are convincing physical teaching materials for educating the people on patriotism, revolutionary traditions and historical materialism. Through cultural relics, people can deeply understand history, the status of the motherland in world history, and the glorious deeds of countless ancestors who fought bravely to resist foreign invasion and overthrow the old system.

Second, cultural relics are witnesses of the historical development of the motherland and the most reliable historical materials, which can play a role in supplementing historical records. The history of our country before the Shang Dynasty was completely confirmed and restored by unearthed cultural relics.

Third, cultural relics are the symbol of our ancient civilization and the most important tourism resource of our country.

Fourthly, cultural relics can play the role of faithfully recording the geographical changes, hydrology and earthquake conditions in history, can provide rich nutrition for today's cultural and artistic creation, can provide indispensable reference for the development of modern science and technology, and can play a unique and important role in the current international political struggle.

In short, cultural relics play an extremely important role in the construction of our socialist material and spiritual civilization.

instruction: 参考下面的段落,然后以相同的语言回答后面的问题:  经文:术语"魔术"源于希腊语的mageia (μαγεία). 在古代,希腊人和波斯人已经交战了几个世纪, 波斯祭司在波斯语中被称为magosh, 后来在希腊语中被称为magoi. 波斯祭司的仪式行为被称为mageia,然后magika<unk>,这最终意味着任何外国,非正统,或非法的仪式实践. 在17世纪,许多书籍描述了魔术技巧. 在18世纪之前, 魔术表演是博览会上娱乐的常见来源. 现代娱乐魔术的创始人之一是让·尤金·罗伯特·胡丁,他在1845年在巴黎开设了一个魔术剧院. 约翰·亨利·安德森在1840年代在伦敦开创了同样的转型. 在19世纪末,在大型剧场上永久上演的大型魔术表演成为常态. 作为一种娱乐形式,魔术很容易从戏剧场变成电视上的魔术节目.  问题:魔术的源头是什么?
output: "mageia (μαγεία)" in Greek

instruction: Please introduce Moutai
output:
Moutai is one of the most famous Chinese liquor brands, known for its unique brewing process and premium taste. Its full name is Guizhou Moutai, which originates from the town of Moutai in Guizhou Province, China. Moutai is a high-proof liquor that usually contains 53% alcohol.

The history of Moutai can be traced back to 1350 BC, making it the oldest distilled liquor in China. The brewing process of Moutai is very unique, including multiple steps of steaming, fermentation, distillation, and aging. Each bottle of Moutai needs to go through an aging process of more than five years to achieve the best taste.

Moutai has a rich and multi-layered taste, with a unique aroma of wheat, fruit and flowers, a sweet and mellow taste, and a long aftertaste. It is known as the "national wine" and has a very high reputation in China. It is also the designated wine for the Chinese government to receive foreign guests on important occasions.

In addition to traditional Moutai, Moutai Company also produces various other types of liquor, such as Feitian Moutai, Five-Star Moutai, etc. Globally, Moutai is also widely regarded as an important symbol representing Chinese liquor culture.

instruction:
Please give a simple translation of the following ancient Chinese text:
Lü knew that Wu could not be threatened, so he informed the Chanyu. The Chanyu wanted to surrender more and more. So he imprisoned Wu and put him in a big cellar, and refused to give him food or drink. It snowed and rained. Wu lay down and gnawed the snow and swallowed it with felt hair. He survived for several days. The Xiongnu thought Wu was a god, so they moved Wu to an uninhabited place on the north sea and made him herd rams. He could only return home when the rams gave milk. They separated his officials such as Chang Hui and sent them to other places. When Wu arrived at the sea, he could not get food, so he dug up wild mice, removed the grass and seeds, and ate them. He herded sheep with the Han Dynasty staff, and when he lay down and stood up, the staff fell off.
output: Wei Lu knew that Su Wu could not be forced to surrender, so he reported it to the Chanyu. The Chanyu wanted to make him surrender even more, so he imprisoned Su Wu and put him in a large cellar, not giving him anything to eat or drink. When it snowed, Su Wu lay down and chewed the snow, swallowed it together with felt hair to satisfy his hunger, and survived for several days. The Xiongnu thought it was a miracle, so they moved Su Wu to an uninhabited place by the North Sea and asked him to herd rams, saying that he could only return to the Han Dynasty after the rams gave birth to lambs. At the same time, they settled his subordinates and his entourage, including Chang Hui, in other places. After Su Wu moved to the North Sea, food could not be transported, so he could only eat wild fruits stored by wild mice. He herded sheep with the Han court's talisman, holding it when he slept and got up, so that all the yak tail hair tied to the talisman fell off.

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
A gentleman's conduct is to cultivate oneself in tranquility and to cultivate virtue in frugality. Without being indifferent, one cannot clarify his ambition; without being tranquil, one cannot achieve far-reaching goals. Learning requires tranquility, and talent requires learning. Without learning, one cannot broaden his talent; without ambition, one cannot complete learning. If one is licentious, one cannot be diligent; if one is reckless, one cannot control his nature. As the years and time pass, one's will and energy fade away, and one becomes withered and old, and is no longer connected with the world. It is sad to stay in a poor house, and what can be done?
output: People with moral cultivation cultivate themselves in this way. They make themselves perfect through meditation and reflection, and cultivate their noble character through frugality and thrift. If you don't have a clear mind and few desires, you can't make your ambition clear and firm. If you are not calm and quiet, you can't realize your lofty ideals and study hard for a long time. To learn true knowledge, you must study and explore in peace. People's talents are accumulated through continuous learning; if you don't study hard, you can't increase and develop your talents; if you don't have an unswerving will, you can't succeed in your studies. Indulgence and negativity cannot encourage the mind and cheer up the spirit; adventurous rashness and impatience cannot cultivate the temperament and make the moral integrity noble. If the years and years are wasted, and the volunteer time is wasted, they will eventually age day by day like dead branches and fallen leaves. Such people will not be used by society and benefit society. They can only be sadly trapped in their own poor homes, and it will be too late to regret then.

instruction: Why do dogs often tuck their tails?
output: In fact, this should be considered as the influence of wolves before evolution. In the wolf family, the leader is determined by fighting between male wolves. The loser, or the weak one, will tuck his tail when he sees the leader, so as not to let the leader mistakenly think that he is provoking him. Dogs do this because they are afraid that someone will think that he is provoking him and will hurt him.

instruction: Why is it so difficult to remember dreams?
output:
Researchers don't know why dreams are so easy to forget. Perhaps we are designed to forget them, because if we remembered all of them, we might not be able to distinguish between dreams and real memories.

In addition, remembering dreams may be more difficult because during REM sleep, our bodies may shut down the memory-creating systems in our brains. We may only remember those dreams that occurred before we woke up, when some brain activity starts again.

Some say it's not that our brains forget dreams, but that we don't know how to access them. Dreams may be stored in our memories, waiting for us to wake up. This may explain why you suddenly remember a dream later in the day: perhaps something happened to trigger the memory.

instruction: How did the spider build a rope bridge across the river?
output: Spiders spin silk in a similar way to silkworms. What they spin out is mucus, which immediately turns into silk. The spider builds a bridge by spinning out long enough silk and letting the wind blow it to the tree on the other side. The spider uses its feet to test it. If it finds that it can't pull it, it means that the silk has been hung on the other side. As long as there is a strand of silk hanging, the spider can climb up and run back and forth to spin silk, pull out the main trunk silk, and then form a web.

instruction: What is a nightmare?
output:
A nightmare is a bad dream. It is common in both children and adults. Nightmares often occur because of

stress, conflict and fear, trauma, emotional problems, medication or drug use, and illness.

If you have a recurring nightmare, your subconscious may be trying to tell you something. Listen to it. If you don't understand why you have a nightmare, talk to a mental health provider. They may be able to help you figure out the cause of your nightmare and give you some suggestions to put you at ease.

Remember, no matter how scary a nightmare may be, it is not real and it probably won't happen in real life.

instruction: Translate the following ancient text: Zhao Guang, a native of Hefei. This is a short history of Li Boshi's family. Boshi made him a painter and always asked him to serve by his side. After a long time, he became good at painting. He was especially good at painting horses. His paintings were almost lifelike. During the Jianyan period, the bandits heard that he was good at painting and asked him to draw a captured woman. Guang resolutely refused, saying that he could not paint. The bandits threatened him with a knife. When he refused, the thumb of his right hand was cut off and he was sent away. Guang used his left hand all his life. After the rebellion was settled, he only painted Guanyin Bodhisattva. After a few years, he died. Today, most of the Guanyin Bodhisattvas of Boshi collected by scholars and officials are painted by Guang.
output: Zhao Guang was from Hefei. He was originally a book boy in Li Boshi's family. He served Li Boshi when he was painting. Over time, he became good at painting, especially good at painting horses, which were almost the same as Li Boshi's. During the Jianyan period, he fell into the hands of Jin soldiers. When the Jin soldiers heard that he was good at painting, they asked him to paint the captured women. Zhao Guang resolutely refused to paint. The Jin soldiers threatened him with knives, and when they failed, they cut off his right thumb. Zhao Guang actually painted with his left hand. After the situation was settled, Zhao Guang only painted Guanyin Bodhisattva. A few years later, Zhao Guang died. Nowadays, most of Li Boshi's Guanyin paintings collected by influential intellectuals are Zhao Guang's works.

instruction:
Translate the following ancient Chinese into modern Chinese characters:
(Tang) Emperor Taizong said to Fang Xuanling: "To be a man, one must learn. In the past, when the evil was not settled, I fought in the east and west, and was personally involved in military affairs, so I had no time to read. Recently, the world is quiet, and I am in the palace, so I can't hold a book and let others read it. The way of monarch and minister, father and son, politics and education are all in books. The ancients said: "If you don't learn, you will be a wall, and you will be troubled by things." It's not just talk. When I think about my behavior when I was young, I realize that it was wrong."
output: Emperor Taizong of Tang said to Fang Xuanling, "It is very important to learn and seek knowledge. In the past, I had no time to read because I had many fierce enemies to pacify and I was personally involved in military affairs. Recently, everything is quiet (no chaos), and I cannot hold books in the palace, so I order others to read to me. The principles of being a monarch, a minister, a father and a son, and the principles of government orders and education are all in books. The ancients said: 'If you don't learn, you will know nothing, and you will only have troubles in handling things.' I am not just talking. Looking back on my behavior when I was young, I feel that it was wrong."

instruction: What are some ways to stabilize your emotions?
output:
Language control method: When you are emotional, you should quietly or gently warn yourself: "calm down", "don't be angry", "pay attention to your identity and influence" and other phrases that suppress emotions; you can also target your weaknesses. Write banners in advance, such as "control anger" and "lower", and put them on the table or hang them on the wall.

What are the ways to stabilize emotions?

If you want to regulate your emotions, you can improve them through: exercise regulation, reading regulation, diet regulation, color regulation, etc.

1. Exercise regulation: During exercise, the human body will speed up the heart rate, promote blood circulation, and increase the body's oxygen respiration. In this state, the brain will be excited, so that the mood will improve.

2. Reading regulation: Reading can effectively improve attention. When the attention is highly concentrated, the mood will settle down and forget the troubles.

You should go back to the onion shop as soon as possible." Lü Sengzhen's hometown is in the north of the city. There is an office of the Inspector in front of it. instruction: Why does it rain heavily during the Qingming Festival?
output:
Why is it rainy during the Qingming Festival? Because Qingming Festival is the time when the cold winter is over and spring is coming.

In winter, the cold air from Siberia dominates the south of the Yangtze River, and there is less rain. When spring comes, the warm and humid air from the southeast ocean begins to become active. When the warm air and the cold air meet, a conflict occurs. The warm and cold air happen to be very busy coming and going over the south of the Yangtze River, so there is often drizzling weather.

instruction: What are some ways to identify directions in life?
output:
1.

Use trees to identify directions

Distinguish the north and south directions based on the lushness of trees. As the saying goes, "everything grows with the sun." After mastering this characteristic of plants, you can observe the growth of plants even on cloudy days to determine the direction. If a tree can absorb enough sunlight, it will be lush and the direction where the plants are lush is the south.

2.

Distinguish by tree rings

Many trees in northern my country have clear annual rings on their trunk sections. The annual rings on the south side are sparser, while the annual rings on the north side are generally denser. The annual ring patterns on the trunk section are generally larger on the south side and smaller on the north side.

3.

Identify by moss on rocks or tree roots

Moss likes to grow in humid places. This characteristic can be used to find the shady side and then identify the sunny south.

4.

Identify the direction by the sun.

The direction where the sun rises is the east. Facing the sun, the front is the east, the back is the west, the left is the north, and the right is the south.

instruction:
Translate the following article into modern Chinese characters:
When Zhou Chu was young, he was fierce and chivalrous, and was a problem for the villagers. There was a dragon in the water of Yixing, and a white-browed tiger in the mountain, both of which violently attacked the people. The people of Yixing called them the three evils, and Chu was the worst. Some said that Chu killed the tiger and the dragon, but he actually hoped that only one of the three evils would be left. Chu immediately stabbed the tiger to death, and then went into the water to kill the dragon. The dragon floated or sank, and traveled dozens of miles with Chu. After three days and three nights, the villagers all thought it was dead, and they celebrated. Finally, he killed the dragon and got out. When he heard the villagers celebrating, he realized that he was troubled by human nature and wanted to change himself. So he went from Wu to look for the two Lu. Pingyuan was not there, and he met Qinghe, who told him the truth and said that he wanted to change himself but had wasted years and would never achieve anything. Qinghe said: "The ancients valued hearing in the morning and dying in the evening, and you still have a good future. Besides, people worry about not being able to establish their ambitions, so why worry about not being famous?" Chu then changed his mind and became a loyal minister and filial son.
output: When Zhou Chu was young, he was a tyrannical and strong man who fought and quarreled with others, which was a great scourge for the local people. In addition, there was a dragon in the water of Yixing and a white-browed tiger on the mountain. They were a scourge to the people. The people called them the "three evils", and Zhou Chu was the most powerful among the three evils. So someone asked Zhou Chu: Since you are so capable, why don't you kill the tiger and the dragon to prove your strength? In fact, they hoped that the three evils would fight each other and only one would be left. After hearing this, Zhou Chu immediately went up the mountain to kill the tiger, and then jumped into the water to fight the dragon. The dragon floated or sank in the water and drifted dozens of miles away. After three days and three nights, the people thought that the dragon and Zhou Chu were dead together, and they came out to celebrate. As a result, Zhou Chu killed the dragon and climbed up from the shore with its head. Hearing that the villagers thought he was dead and expressed their congratulations, he realized that in fact everyone also regarded him as a great scourge, and he couldn't help but burst into tears and felt repentant. So he went to Wujun to find Lu Ji and Lu Yun, two famous scholars in Dongwu at that time. Lu Ji was not there, and only Lu Yun was there. Zhou Chu told him the whole situation and said, "I want to correct my mistakes, but I have wasted my time and I am afraid that I will not achieve anything in the end." Lu Yun said, "The ancients cherished morality and believed that "even if I understand the truth in the morning, I will be willing to die in the evening." Besides, your future is still promising. Besides, people are afraid of not being able to set their ambitions. As long as you can set your ambitions and work hard to achieve them, why worry about not spreading your good reputation?" After hearing this, Zhou Chu decided to reform himself and eventually became a loyal minister and filial son.

instruction: What is the current ratio?
output:
The current ratio is a measure of the ratio between a company's current assets (such as cash, inventory, and accounts receivable) and current liabilities (such as short-term loans and accounts payable). Generally, a higher current ratio means that the company is more able to meet its short-term liabilities, and therefore has stronger liquidity and solvency. The current ratio is usually calculated as follows:

Current ratio = (Current assets) / (Current liabilities)

Different companies may have different current ratio targets, so the current ratio itself does not mean good or bad. However, generally, the higher the current ratio, the better, because it means that the company is more able to meet its short-term liabilities. However, a current ratio that is too high may mean that the company is not fully utilizing its assets, and therefore may miss investment opportunities.

instruction: Why can polar bears resist the cold?
output:
Using a scanning electron microscope to observe the hair of a polar bear, the white hair looks like a hollow tube, without any pigment in it. The reason why it looks white is because the inner surface of the hair tube is relatively rough, just like transparent snowflakes appear white when they fall on the ground.

The hair tube of a polar bear allows ultraviolet rays to pass through the core, just like unobstructed ultraviolet tubes. This means that the polar bear can absorb almost all the light, including ultraviolet rays, that shines on it to increase its body temperature, so it is not afraid of the severe cold in the Arctic region.

instruction: Why does the moon follow us?
output:
It turns out that when night falls, all the scenery becomes dark, and only the moonlight is clearly visible. Therefore, when you walk in the darkness, the light becomes the thing that stays in your field of vision the longest, so you will feel that the moon is always following you.

In fact, the moon does not follow people. We have this feeling for two reasons: First, because the moon is a huge celestial body, far away from us, and there is nothing around us that can block its brilliance. It is not that it follows us, but that we cannot walk out of its range no matter where we go. Second, it is an illusion caused by relative motion. For example, when sitting on a moving train, you will feel that the trees and fields on both sides are moving, but in fact, it is only the train that is moving. The same is true when the moon follows people. It is not the moon that is walking, but we are walking. It is just that the distance we walk is too small compared to the earth and the moon. At the same time, the distance between the moon and the earth is 380,000 kilometers.

When people look up at the bright moon in the sky, it is in a certain position. When people walk, they move a distance, but this distance is completely negligible for the earth, and the change in viewing angle for the moon is also completely negligible. This means that walking will hardly change the relative position between you and the moon. It looks like the moon is following people.

instruction: What does Forex Binary Options mean?
output:
A Forex binary option is a financial instrument that allows an investor to own or sell a specific Forex quote at a certain future point in time. The outcome of this instrument is binary, meaning there are only two possible outcomes: the investor can earn a fixed gain, or lose the money they invested.

For example, suppose you have a Forex binary option that contains a EUR/USD Forex quote. At the expiration of the option, if the EUR/USD Forex quote appreciates in value, you will earn a fixed gain; conversely, if the quote depreciates, you will lose the money you invested.

Forex binary options are a high-risk investment instrument, as their value is subject to market fluctuations, and it is possible to lose all your investment. Before considering using Forex binary options, be sure to carefully understand the risks of this instrument and ensure that you have sufficient funds to cover possible losses.

When he grew up, he knew about his family, and wept for his mother, and went to the southern capital to study. He studied hard day and night, and never took off his clothes to sleep for five years. Sometimes he felt drowsy at night, so he would pour water on his face. He often did not have enough porridge, and only ate at sunset. He then mastered the meaning of the Six Classics and had a great ambition to contribute to the world. He often recited to himself: "I should worry about the world before I worry about myself, and be happy after I am happy about myself."
output: When Fan Zhongyan was two years old, his father died. His mother was poor and helpless, so she married a man named Zhu from Changshan. When Fan Zhongyan grew up and learned about his life experience, he said goodbye to his mother in tears and left to study at the Nandu Academy in Yingtian Prefecture. He studied hard during the day and late at night. For five years, he hardly undressed when sleeping, and sometimes when he was tired at night, he washed his face with cold water. He often studied hard during the day and ate nothing until the sun was setting. In this way, he mastered the main points of the Six Classics and later set his ambition to benefit the world. He often chanted to himself: "We should be sad before the people of the world are sad, and enjoy after the people of the world are enjoying."

instruction: Who is Su Shi?
output: Su Shi (January 8, 1037 - August 24, 1101), known as Su Dongpo and Su Xian, was a famous writer, calligrapher, painter and historical water conservancy expert in the Northern Song Dynasty. He was a leader in the literary world in the middle period of the Northern Song Dynasty and achieved great success in poetry, lyrics, prose, calligraphy and painting. His writings were unrestrained and unrestrained; his poems were broad in subject matter, fresh and vigorous, and he was good at using exaggerated metaphors and had a unique style. He was called "Su Huang" together with Huang Tingjian; he was also a bold and unrestrained poet, and he was a representative of the bold and unrestrained school together with Xin Qiji, and they were called "Su Xin"; his prose writings were rich and bold, and he was called "Ou Su" together with Ouyang Xiu, and he was also one of the "Eight Great Masters of Tang and Song Dynasties". Su Shi was good at literati painting, especially ink bamboo, strange rocks, dead wood, etc. He was called "Four Great Masters of Articles Through the Ages" together with Han Yu, Liu Zongyuan and Ouyang Xiu. Su Shi's works include "Seven Collections of Dongpo", "Dongpo Yi Zhuan", "Dongpo Yuefu", "Xiaoxiang Bamboo and Rock Scroll", "Ancient Trees and Strange Rocks Scroll", etc.

instruction:

Duke Ping of Jin asked Shi Kuang, "I am seventy years old and want to learn, but I am afraid it is too late." Shi Kuang said, "Why not light a candle?" Duke Ping said, "How can a minister tease his king?" Shi Kuang said, "How dare a blind minister tease the king? I have heard that when you are young and love to learn, it is like the sun rising; when you are strong and love to learn, it is like the sun at noon; when you are old and love to learn, it is like the brightness of a bright candle. How can the brightness of a bright candle be compared to walking blindly?" Duke Ping said, "Good!"

Duke Ping of Jin said, "How can a minister mock his king?" Shi Kuang said, "How dare I, a blind man, mock the king? I heard that when you are young, you like to learn, just like the sunlight of the rising sun; when you are in your prime, you like to learn, just like the sunlight of the day; when you are old, you like to learn, just like the light of a lit candle. instruction: Why is there more ice in Antarctica than in the Arctic?
output:
There is a large landmass in the Antarctic region, known as the world's "seventh largest continent", with an area of ​​about 14 million square meters. The heat storage capacity of the land is not strong, and the heat obtained in summer is quickly radiated, so there is a lot of ice.

　　The continental glaciers also formed many ice barriers and icebergs.

　　The Arctic Ocean in the Arctic region occupies a large area, about 1,310 square kilometers. The water has a large heat capacity and can absorb more heat and then slowly dissipate it, so there is less ice than in Antarctica.

instruction:
Please give a simple translation of the following article:

(Wei) Lu knew that (Su) Wu could not be threatened, so he reported it to the Chanyu. The Chanyu wanted to surrender more and more. So he imprisoned Wu and put him in a big cellar, and refused to eat or drink. It snowed. Wu lay down and gnawed the snow and swallowed it with felt hair. He survived for several days. The Xiongnu thought he was a god, so they moved Wu to an uninhabited place on the north sea and made him herd rams. He could only return home after the rams gave milk. They separated his officials such as Chang Hui and sent them to other places. When Wu arrived at the sea, he could not get food, so he dug wild mice and ate them without grass or seeds. He herded sheep with the Han Dynasty staff, and when he lay down and stood up, the staff fell off.
output: Wei Lu knew that Su Wu could not be forced to surrender, so he reported it to the Chanyu. The Chanyu wanted to make him surrender even more, so he imprisoned Su Wu and put him in a large cellar, not giving him anything to eat or drink. When it snowed, Su Wu lay down and chewed the snow, swallowed it together with felt hair to satisfy his hunger, and survived for several days. The Xiongnu thought it was a miracle, so they moved Su Wu to an uninhabited place by the North Sea and asked him to herd rams, saying that he could only return to the Han Dynasty after the rams gave birth to lambs. At the same time, they settled his subordinates and his entourage, including Chang Hui, in other places. After Su Wu moved to the North Sea, food could not be transported, so he could only eat wild fruits stored by wild mice.
