instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
(Tang) Emperor Dezong asked Lu Zhi about the current urgent matters. Zhi said that the chaos in the country was caused by the lack of communication between the upper and lower levels, and advised the emperor to accept the advice. He then submitted a memorial, which briefly said: "I believe that the current urgent matter is to carefully examine the public sentiment. If the public sentiment wants something, Your Majesty should do it first; if the public sentiment hates something, Your Majesty should get rid of it first. It has never happened since ancient times that the public sentiment does not follow the same desires and dislikes as the public. The root of the chaos lies in the people's hearts. What's more, when there is a change of circumstances and a time of danger and doubt, people will be rooted in where they are, and will be inclined to where they are. Your Majesty, how can you not carefully examine the public sentiment, share their desires and dislikes, and make millions of people follow the same interests to stabilize the country! This is truly the current urgent matter."
output: Emperor Dezong asked Lu Zhi about the most urgent matter of the day. Lu Zhi believed that the reason for the chaos in the past was the lack of communication between the upper and lower classes. He advised Emperor Dezong to get in touch with the people and listen to their advice. So he submitted a memorial, which roughly said: "I think the most urgent matter of the day is to carefully examine the will of the people. If it is something that the people like very much, then Your Majesty should implement it first; if it is something that the people hate very much, then Your Majesty should get rid of it first. Your Majesty's likes and dislikes are the same as those of the people in the world, but the people in the world are unwilling to turn to Your Majesty. This has never happened from ancient times to the present. Generally speaking, the root of order and chaos is closely related to the people's hearts. Moreover, when the changes happen and the people's hearts are shaken, it is a dangerous and doubtful moment when the people's hearts turn to it, everything will be prosperous; when the people's hearts are separated, everything will be in danger. How can Your Majesty not examine the will of the people, share their likes and dislikes, make the people yearn for it, and stabilize the country! This is the most urgent thing at the moment."

instruction: Will artificial satellites fall?
output:
All artificial satellites in the sky, whether they have malfunctions or not, cannot orbit the earth forever. Because there is still a thin atmosphere in the high altitude, there is also a certain resistance for high-speed satellites. Its operating altitude will gradually decrease. When it drops to a certain height, it will fall down and burn up due to intense friction with the air.

The length of time an artificial satellite stays in the sky is related to the altitude of the satellite. The higher the satellite is, the thinner the air there is, and the longer the satellite stays in the sky.

instruction:

(Chen) Shi was a fair and just man in his village. Whenever there was a dispute, he would always seek justice, explain the difference between right and wrong, and no one would complain. He sighed and said, "I would rather be punished than be shortchanged by Mr. Chen." At that time, the people were frugal. A thief broke into his house at night and hid on the beam. Shi saw him secretly, so he stood up, combed his clothes, called his children and grandchildren, and taught him with a serious face, "Lady, you must encourage yourself. People who are not good are not necessarily evil by nature. They are conditioned by their nature and end up like this. The gentleman on the beam is such a person!" instruction: Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text: Pei Ji often said: When he was young, his aunt was an official in the court, and he had a good reputation. When Ji went to his aunt's house to see her, he saw her leaving the court and sighed deeply, "Who is Cui Zhao? He is praised by everyone. He must be a briber. How can there not be chaos!" Before he finished speaking, the gatekeeper reported that Cui Shijun of Shouzhou was waiting for him. The aunt angrily scolded the gatekeeper and was about to whip him. After a long time, he tied his belt and forced out. After a while, he ordered tea very quickly, and also ordered wine and food, and also ordered the horses and servants to be fed. The aunt said, "Why were you so arrogant before and why are you so respectful now?" When she entered the door, she looked pleased and bowed to Ji, saying, "Rest in the academy." Before Ji went down the stairs, he took out a piece of paper from his arms, and Zhao gave him a thousand pieces of official silk.
output: Pei Ji, a man from the Tang Dynasty, once told such a story: When Pei Ji was a child, his uncle was an official in the court. He had a good reputation and was considered an honest official. Once, Pei Ji went to his uncle's house and happened to catch up with his uncle returning from the court. He sighed deeply and said to himself: "Who is Cui Zhao? Everyone says he is good. This reputation must be obtained by bribery. If this goes on, how can the country not be in chaos?" Before Pei Ji's uncle finished speaking, the gatekeeper came in and reported: "Shouzhou Governor Cui requests to see the master." Pei Ji's uncle was very angry after hearing this, and scolded the gatekeeper and asked the gatekeeper to use a whip to drive Governor Cui out of the mansion. After a long time, Governor Cui straightened his belt and forced to see Pei Ji's uncle. After a while, Pei Ji's uncle hurriedly ordered his family to give Cui Governor tea. After a while, he ordered to prepare a banquet. After a while, he ordered to give his horse grass and his servants food. After seeing off Governor Cui, Pei Ji's aunt asked his uncle, "Why were you so arrogant at first and so humble later?" Pei Ji's uncle walked into the house with a look of gratitude on his face, waved his hand to let Pei Ji leave, and said, "Go, go to the school to have a rest." Pei Ji had not yet walked down the steps in front of the door when he looked back and saw his uncle taking out a piece of paper from his arms, on which was written: A gift of one thousand pieces of coarse official silk.

instruction: Why don’t my ears swell when I take the MRT?
output:
When a train enters a tunnel, people's ears often swell, which is similar to the feeling when taking a cable car or bus to a mountain, or taking off and landing on an airplane.

People have this feeling because of the rapid increase or decrease in air pressure.

When a high-speed train enters a tunnel, the air in the tunnel is squeezed, the air pressure will increase, and then it will compress the eardrum in the ear, making people feel the ears swell.

In the MRT, because the human body is always under a certain air pressure, even if the train is speeding, it is not enough to cause a change in air pressure, so the ears don't feel much.

Nevertheless, if you pay a little attention, you will find that your ears will also feel swollen when the subway train brakes suddenly. You can try it to see if your ears feel swollen.

instruction: Why do wolves' eyes glow green at night?
output:
The reason why the wolf's eyes emit green light at night is because of the special crystal points at the bottom of the wolf's eyes, which gather the weak scattered light around, gather it into a beam and then reflect it out, so it is not actually the wolf's eyes that emit green light.

This starts with the role of the pupil. It is located in front of the lens and controls the intensity of light entering the lens. Its size changes with the intensity of light from the outside world. At night, the cat's pupil becomes larger and tries to receive more faint light. However, because of the convergence of the lens and ciliary body, it is a convex lens, and the light converges in a small range. It is precisely because the pupil is larger and the photoreceptor cells of people in the dark are columnar cells, with enhanced sensitivity, that it is seen as bright! There are many special crystal points at the bottom of the wolf's eyes.

These crystal points have a strong ability to reflect light. They can gather the weak and scattered light around them, gather them into beams, and reflect them out in a concentrated way, as if the wolf's eyes are glowing.

instruction: Refer to the following paragraph, then answer the following questions in the same language: Transition: As of 2015, there were an estimated 392 million people with type 2 diabetes worldwide, accounting for about 90% of diabetes cases. This is equivalent to 6% of the world's population. Diabetes is common in both developed and developing countries. However, it remains uncommon in the least developed countries. Women appear to be more susceptible to the disease, as are certain ethnic groups, such as South Asians, Pacific Islanders, Latinos, and Native Americans. This may be due to the increased susceptibility of certain ethnic groups to Western lifestyles. Traditionally considered a disease of adults, children are increasingly being diagnosed with type 2 diabetes as obesity rates rise. Type 2 diabetes is diagnosed as often in adolescents in the United States as type 1 diabetes. The number of people with diabetes was estimated at 30 million in 1985, increasing to 135 million in 1995 and 217 million in 2005. This increase is primarily attributed to the aging of the global population, declining physical activity, and rising obesity rates. As of 2000, The five countries with the highest number of diabetes patients are India with 3.17 million, China with 20.8 million, the United States with 17.7 million, Indonesia with 8.4 million, and Japan with 680,000. The World Health Organization has deemed it a global epidemic. Question: How many people worldwide have type 2 diabetes?
output: As of 2015, there are an estimated 392 million people with type 2 diabetes worldwide.

Inside my room, books are placed on the casket, laid out in front of me, or placed on the bed. Books are everywhere. instruction:

The emperor wanted to use Anshi, but Tang Jie said that Anshi was not suitable for a big job. The emperor asked: "Is it that a man of literature cannot be appointed? Is it that a man of classics cannot be appointed? Is it that a man of government affairs cannot be appointed?" Jie replied: "Anshi likes to study but is stuck in the past, so his opinions are pedantic. If he were appointed to govern, he would definitely make many changes." The emperor disagreed and appointed Anshi as a minister of government affairs, saying to him: "No one can understand you, because you only know classics and don't understand worldly affairs." Anshi replied: "The classics are the way to govern worldly affairs." The emperor asked: "Then what should you do first?" Anshi replied: "Changing customs and making laws are what are urgent at the moment." The emperor accepted his advice.
output: The emperor (Song Renzong) wanted to appoint Wang Anshi, but Tang Jie said, "Anshi is not capable of taking on such a big responsibility." The emperor said, "Is he unreliable in literature? Is he unreliable in classics? Is he unreliable in government affairs?" Tang Jie replied, "Anshi is studious but has old-fashioned ideas. In previous discussions, his thoughts and actions were unrealistic. If he became an official, his policies would definitely change frequently." The emperor did not think so, and eventually appointed Wang Anshi as the vice-chancellor and said to him, "Others don't understand you and think you only know Confucian classics and are not clear about worldly affairs." Wang Anshi replied, "Confucian classics are used to plan and deal with worldly affairs." The emperor said, "What policy do you think should be implemented first?" Wang Anshi said, "We need to change the current customs, etiquette, and habits and promulgate new laws. This is exactly what needs to be done now." The emperor believed in and adopted (his opinion).

instruction: Why can't we sometimes use water to put out a fire?
output:
Generally, fires are put out with water, but sometimes comprehensive considerations are needed to minimize losses.

　　If water is used to extinguish a fire in an energized appliance, it may cause an internal short circuit and burn the appliance. In addition, when water is poured on it, the heat expansion and contraction may damage the precision parts inside the appliance and make it unusable. Also, if a water gun is used to spray, it may cause electric shock to people.

　　After comprehensive consideration, using water is the worst option. If there is a risk of life if the fire is not extinguished, then those factors do not need to be considered, and water should be used directly.

instruction:
Translate the following ancient Chinese into modern Chinese characters:
Fang Zhongyong, a native of Jinxi, was a farmer for generations. When Zhongyong was five years old, he had never seen a writing tool, but suddenly cried and asked for one. His father was surprised and borrowed a book from a neighbor. He wrote four lines of poetry and signed it himself. His poems were about supporting his parents and raising a clan, and were circulated throughout the village. He could write poems by pointing at objects, and his writing and logic were both impressive. The people of the town were surprised by this, and gradually invited his father to visit him, or gave him money. His father was pleased with this, so he took Zhongyong around to visit the people of the town every day, but did not let him study. I have heard of him for a long time. In the Mingdao period, I returned home from my ancestors and saw him at my uncle's house. He was twelve or thirteen years old. I asked him to write a poem, but it was not as good as before. Seven years later, he returned from Yangzhou and went to his uncle's house again. When I asked him about him, he said, "He is just like everyone else!"
output: Fang Zhongyong, a commoner in Jinxi, has been farming for generations. When Zhongyong was five years old, he had never known pen, ink, paper, or inkstone. One day, he suddenly cried and asked for these things. His father was surprised and borrowed them from a neighboring family. Zhongyong immediately wrote four lines of poetry and titled them with his own name. This poem is about supporting parents and uniting people of the same clan, and it was sent to the whole township for viewing. From then on, he was asked to write poems on designated items, and he could write them immediately. The literary talent and truth of the poems were worth seeing. People in the same county were surprised by him, and gradually treated his father as a guest. Some people even paid Zhongyong to write poems. His father thought it was profitable, so he took Zhongyong to visit people in the same county every day and didn't let him study. I heard about this for a long time. During the Mingdao period, I returned to my hometown with my father and met him at my uncle's house. He was already twelve or thirteen years old. He was asked to write poems, but the poems he wrote were not as good as his previous reputation. Seven years later, I came back from Yangzhou and once again visited my uncle's home and asked him about Fang Zhongyong's situation. He replied, "his talent has completely disappeared and he has become an ordinary person."

instruction:
Translate the following classical Chinese text:
(Han) Xin talked with Xiao He several times, and He was surprised. When they arrived in Nanzheng, dozens of generals fled on the road. Xin estimated that He had reported to the emperor several times, but the emperor did not use him and fled. When He heard that Xin had fled, he did not report it in time, so he chased him himself. Someone told the emperor, "Prime Minister He is gone." The emperor was furious, as if he had lost his left and right hands. After a day or two, He came to visit the emperor. The emperor was angry and happy, and scolded He, "If he fled, why?" He said, "I dare not flee, I will chase the fleeing." The emperor asked, "Who are you chasing?" He said, "Han Xin." The emperor scolded him back, "More than a dozen generals have fled, and you have no one to chase; chasing Xin is a trick." He said, "The generals are easy to get. As for Xin, he is a peerless national talent. If the king wants to rule Hanzhong, he has no place to go. If he wants to fight for the world, there is no one to discuss matters with except Xin. I think the king will decide."
output: Han Xin talked with Xiao He many times, and Xiao He also admired him. (Most of the Han King's subordinates were from the East, and they all wanted to return to their hometowns.) Therefore, when the team arrived in Nanzheng, dozens of officers ran away on the way. Han Xin thought that Xiao He and others had recommended him to the Han King many times, but the Han King never valued him, so he ran away. When Xiao He heard that Han Xin had escaped, he chased him without reporting the matter to the Han King. Someone who didn't know the details reported to the Han King, "Prime Minister Xiao He ran away." The Han King was very angry, as if he had lost his left and right hands. A day or two later, Xiao He came back to see the King of Han. The King was both angry and pleased, and scolded him, "Why did you run away?" Xiao He replied, "I didn't dare to run away, I was chasing the runaways." "Who did you chase back?" Xiao He said, "Han Xin." The King of Han scolded him again, "Dozens of officers ran away, but you didn't chase any of them. Instead, you chased Han Xin, which was a lie." Xiao He said, "Those officers are easy to get, but as for a talent like Han Xin, there is no other one in the world. If the king only wants to be the King of Hanzhong, of course he can't be used; if you want to fight for the world, there is no one else you can discuss big plans with except Han Xin. It all depends on what the king plans."

instruction: Why do children get paralysis?
output:
Many parents of children with facial paralysis have said that their children have always been healthy, so how come they suddenly have facial paralysis? In fact, the triggering factors of facial paralysis are often invisible, not the tangible factors such as trauma that we understand. Viral infection is the most common cause of facial paralysis in children, followed by cold, which means that facial paralysis often occurs without signs.

First, common causes
There are many reasons for children's facial paralysis, including viral infection and cold, among which viral infection is the main triggering factor. Most children with facial paralysis have a history of viral infection such as colds and pharyngitis before the onset of the disease. Some children are caused by inflammation of the periosteum of the mastoid foramen behind the ear, which compresses the facial nerves and causes functional disorders caused by insufficient blood supply. Therefore, parents and friends should pay attention to keeping their children warm.

Second, improper treatment

In fact, improper treatment is also the cause of facial paralysis in children. This reason is not the inducing reason, but the contributing reason. After many children have facial paralysis, their parents do not discover it in time, or they are superstitious about some folk remedies and do not seek timely diagnosis and treatment, which delays the best treatment time and leaves permanent regrets for their children. Early treatment of facial paralysis is relatively simple, so parents should discover and treat their children's facial paralysis early.

Third, standardized treatment

The treatment of facial paralysis often requires a relatively long process. Generally, it takes one or two months of treatment for the child to gradually recover. During treatment, parents should take their children to regular hospitals for standardized treatment. Under the guidance of a neurologist, they can use drugs and injections, and can also receive acupuncture and moxibustion therapy. Whether the diagnosis is timely is directly related to the prognosis of recovery, so parents should pay attention to it.

After understanding the causes of facial paralysis in children, parents also need to understand the hazards of facial paralysis and related treatment methods. If facial paralysis is not treated correctly, it is easy to cause sequelae and affect the child's future life and work.

instruction: Why do buildings use glass as walls?
output:
Glass used for exterior walls is made by coating a very thin metal or metal oxide film on tempered glass. It can reflect light as well as transmit light. The structure of these glasses is hollow, with mirrored glass on both sides, the interlayer is filled with dry air, and the whole is assembled by a sealed frame. Insulating glass has double and triple layers. Insulating glass can be soundproof, heat-insulating, moisture-proof, frost-proof, wind-resistant, and heat-insulating.

　　According to scientific measurements, when the outdoor temperature is minus 10℃, the indoor temperature using triple-layer insulating glass is 13℃. In summer, hollow glass can block 90% of sunlight, and the light passing through the glass will not feel hot. In addition, insulating glass can also reduce the weight of the building.

instruction: How is snow formed?
output:
Ice clouds are composed of tiny ice crystals. When these small ice crystals collide with each other, the surface of the ice crystals will heat up and melt a little, and they will stick to each other and freeze again. This is repeated many times, and the ice crystals will grow larger. In addition, there is water vapor in the cloud, so the ice crystals can continue to grow by condensation. However, ice clouds are generally very high and not thick. There is not much water vapor there, condensation grows very slowly, and there are not many opportunities for collision with each other, so they cannot grow very large to form precipitation. Even if precipitation is caused, it is often evaporated on the way down and rarely falls to the ground.

　　Mixed clouds are most conducive to the growth of cloud droplets. Mixed clouds are composed of small ice crystals and supercooled water droplets. When a mass of air has reached saturation for ice crystals, it has not yet reached saturation for water droplets. At this time, the water vapor in the cloud condenses on the surface of the ice crystal, while the supercooled water droplets evaporate, and the ice crystals "absorb" the water vapor from the supercooled water droplets. In this case, the ice crystals grow very fast. In addition, supercooled water is very unstable. Once it is touched, it will freeze. Therefore, in the mixed cloud, when the supercooled water droplets collide with the ice crystals, they will freeze and adhere to the surface of the ice crystals, causing them to grow rapidly. When the small ice crystals grow to a size that can overcome the resistance and buoyancy of the air, they fall to the ground, and this is a snowflake.

instruction: Why do birds fly?
output:
The wings of birds are the primary condition for them to have the unique skill of flying. Under the condition of having wings, some birds can fly very high, very fast, and very far; while some birds can only hover, glide, or even cannot fly at all. It can be seen that there is a lot to learn about wings alone.

The complexity of the structure of bird wings is no less complex than the complexity of the birds themselves. If the feather structure of bird wings can cleverly apply the principles of aerodynamics, when they flap up and down or lift up and down, they can push the air and fly forward using the reaction principle; if the feather structure is reasonable, it can effectively reduce the air resistance encountered during flight, and some can also play the role of eliminating vibration and noise. There are great differences in the wings of various bird species, so the difference in wings alone makes for many excellent and average pilots.

instruction: Why are wheat fields not afraid of being trampled in winter?
output:
In winter, we sometimes see some farmers walking around in the wheat fields without any care, not caring at all about trampling the wheat seedlings they have worked so hard to plant, and some even use stone rollers to crush the wheat fields. Why is this?

This is because winter is the season when wheat seedlings grow roots and the roots close to the ground form branches. Damage to wheat leaves will allow more nutrients to grow roots, and this is also conducive to heat preservation, windproof, and frostproof, allowing wheat seedlings to grow better. But after the beginning of spring, wheat begins to grow and head. If you trample the wheat at this time, it will be crushed to death.

instruction: Why don't ants die when they fall from a height?
output:
When an object moves in the air, it will be subject to air resistance, and the magnitude of the resistance is related to the size of the surface area of ​​the object in contact with the air. The smaller the object, the greater the ratio of its surface area to gravity, that is, the easier it is for the resistance to balance with gravity, so that the speed of descent will not increase. In other words, tiny objects can fall in the air at a very low speed, so the speed of ants when they land is very small and they will not fall to death.

　　We can conceive of a way to make ants fall to death: put ants in a long vacuum glass tube. When ants fall in such a tube, because there is no air resistance, if the tube is long enough, they may fall to death.

instruction: Why is it not cold when it snows but cold when it melts?
output:
In winter, all parts of my country are often attacked by cold waves. A cold wave is a strong, cold and dry air flowing from the north to the south. When its front edge comes into contact with the warm and humid air in the south, because the cold air is heavier than the warm air, it will lift the warm and humid air to the high altitude, causing the water vapor in the warm air to quickly condense into ice crystals, which gradually grow and fall down as snowflakes.

Before the arrival of a cold wave, the warm and humid air flow in the south is generally very active, so the weather will warm up a little. And the condensation of water vapor into snowflakes also releases a certain amount of heat, which makes the weather before and during the snow not very cold.

After the center of the cold wave passes, the clouds disappear and the snow stops, and the weather immediately becomes clear. Because the sky loses the barrier of clouds, the ground begins to release a large amount of heat outward, and the temperature drops very low at this time. In addition, snow melts under sunlight, absorbing a large amount of heat. According to experiments, 1 gram of 0℃ ice melts into 0℃ water, absorbing 334.4 joules (80 calories) of heat. Therefore, when a large piece of snow melts, the amount of heat absorbed is considerable, so people feel that the weather is colder.

instruction: How to write an elegant prompt?
output:
CRISPE Prompt Framework, CRISPE is an acronym, which stands for the following meanings:
CR: Capacity and Role. What role do you want ChatGPT to play.
I: Insight, background information and context.
S: Statement, what do you want ChatGPT to do.
P: Personality, what style or way do you want ChatGPT to answer you.
E: Experiment, ask ChatGPT to provide you with multiple answers. Here is an example of the big boss's prompt.
As a software development expert and professional blogger on the topic of machine learning frameworks, the audience of this blog is technical professionals who are interested in the latest machine learning advances. Provide a comprehensive overview of the most popular machine learning frameworks, including their pros and cons. Through real examples and case studies, illustrate the successful application of these frameworks in various industries. When answering questions, please combine the writing style of Andrej Karpathy, Francois Chollet, Jeremy Howard, and Yann LeCun. Please give me more different examples
There are actually many examples like this. The prompt roles on github are basically all CRISPE frameworks.

Emperor Dezong asked Lu Zhi about the most urgent task of the day. He then submitted a memorial, which briefly said: "I believe that the most urgent task of the day is to carefully examine the public sentiment. If the public sentiment wants something, Your Majesty should do it first; if the public sentiment hates something, Your Majesty should get rid of it first. It has never happened since ancient times that the public sentiment does not follow the same desires and dislikes as the public. The root of the chaos lies in the people's hearts. What's more, when there is a change of circumstances and a time of danger and doubt, people will be rooted in where they are, and will be inclined to where they are. How can Your Majesty not carefully examine the public sentiment, share their desires and dislikes, and make millions of people follow their interests to stabilize the country? This is truly the most urgent task of the day."

Lu Zhi believed that the reason for the chaos in the past was the lack of communication between the upper and lower classes. He advised Emperor Dezong to get in touch with the people and listen to their advice. So he submitted a memorial, which roughly said: "I think the most urgent matter of the day is to carefully examine the will of the people. If it is something that the people like very much, then Your Majesty should implement it first; if it is something that the people hate very much, then Your Majesty should get rid of it first. Your Majesty's likes and dislikes are the same as those of the people in the world, but the people in the world are unwilling to turn to Your Majesty. Moreover, when the changes happen and the people's hearts are shaken, it is a dangerous and doubtful moment when the people's hearts turn to it, everything will be prosperous; when the people's hearts are separated, everything will be in danger. instruction: Why do Westerners hate the number 13?
output:
In the Bible, there is a story: Jesus and his twelve disciples had a Passover gathering. During dinner, Jesus said, "One of you is going to betray me." Sure enough, Judas, one of the disciples, reported Jesus to the ruler, and Jesus was crucified. There were exactly thirteen people at the dinner table at that time, and people thought that this "13" brought misfortune.

There is also a story in Norse mythology: One day, at a banquet in heaven, twelve gods sat down to eat. Suddenly, the fierce god Loki broke into the banquet, making the number of people at the banquet "13". Because of Loki's conspiracy, the son of the highest god Odin, Balder, who represented "goodness", was shot to death. People believe that this is also a disaster brought by "13". Therefore, people in European and American countries are very taboo about the number "13".

In the cinemas of these countries, there is no seat numbered "13". In some residential areas, there is no house number 13, and the numbers jump from 12 to 14, or are represented by 12A and 12B.

instruction: Why Don't Woodpeckers Suffer Concussions?
output:
According to scientists, when a woodpecker is pecking, its head swings at a speed equivalent to 2,092 kilometers per hour, 37 times faster than a car traveling at 55 kilometers per hour. It pecking wood 15-16 times per second. Due to the high speed of pecking, the impact on the woodpecker's head when pecking wood is equivalent to 1,000 times the gravity it is subjected to, which is equivalent to 250 times the pressure an astronaut experiences when taking off on a rocket. The impact that a woodpecker is subjected to when pecking wood is so great, so why doesn't it suffer a concussion?

It turns out that the woodpecker's skull is very strong. There is a layer of spongy bones around its brain, which contains fluid and can buffer and absorb external forces. Its brain case is also covered with shock-absorbing muscles, which can keep the tip of its beak and head in a straight line at all times, so that its head moves strictly in a straight line when pecking. If the woodpecker's head tilts slightly while pecking, the twisting motion plus the impact of pecking will damage its brain. Because the tip of the woodpecker's beak and head are always in a straight line, even though it pecks at the wood more than 1.02 million times a day, it can withstand strong vibrations all year round.

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:

On the south side of Mount Tai, the Wen River flows westward; on the south side, the Ji River flows eastward. All valleys on the south side flow into the Wen River, and all valleys on the south side flow into the Ji River. The ancient Great Wall is where the mountains divide north and south. Riguan Peak is fifteen miles south of the Great Wall.

In December of the thirty-ninth year of Qianlong's reign, I left the capital in the snow and wind, passed through Qihe and Changqing, crossed the northwest valley of Mount Tai, crossed the Great Wall, and arrived at Tai'an. On the 25th day of that month, I climbed from the south foot with the prefect Zhu Xiaochun's son Ying. Forty-five miles, the road was all paved with stone steps, with more than seven thousand steps. There are three valleys on the south side of Mount Tai. The middle valley goes around the city of Tai'an, which is what Li Daoyuan called the ring water. I started to enter through it, and after walking less than half of the way, I crossed the middle ridge and followed the west valley again, and finally reached the top. In ancient times, when climbing mountains, people entered through the east valley, and there was a Tianmen on the road. The east valley was called Tianmen Creek in ancient times, which I have never been to. The cliffs blocking the way in the middle ridge and the top of the mountain we are passing now are called Tianmen Clouds by the world. The road is foggy and slippery, and the steps are almost impossible to climb. When we get to the top, the Cangshan Mountain is covered with snow, shining brightly in the south sky. The setting sun shines on the city walls, the Wenshui River and Culai are like a painting, and the fog in the middle of the mountain is like a belt.

　　On the fifth drum of the Wushen night, I sat in the Sun Viewing Pavilion with Ziying, waiting for the sunrise. The strong wind blew the accumulated snow and hit our faces. The east of the pavilion was covered with clouds from the feet. I saw a few white clouds in the clouds, which looked like dozens of puddings. They were mountains. There was a line of clouds in the sky with different colors, and in a moment it became five colors. When the sun rose, it was red like cinnabar, and there was a red light shaking below it. Some people said that this was the East China Sea. Looking back at the peaks west of the Sun Viewing Pavilion, some were in the sun and some were not, and the colors were crimson and white, and they all looked hunched.

　　To the west of the pavilion is the Dai Temple, and there is also the Bixia Yuanjun Temple. The emperor's palace is to the east of the Bixia Yuanjun Temple. The stone carvings on the way to Riguan have been there since the Tang Xianqing period; the ancient carvings have all been lost. Those that are remote and not on the road are not visited.

　　The mountain has more stones and less soil. The stones are dark blue, mostly square, less round. There are few miscellaneous trees, but many pines, growing in the cracks of the rocks, all with flat tops. There is ice and snow, no waterfalls, no sounds of birds or animals. There are no trees within a few miles of Riguan, and the snow is knee-high.

　　Recorded by Yao Nai of Tongcheng.
output:
To the south of Mount Tai, the Wenshui River flows westward; to the north, the Jishui River flows eastward. The water in the southern valleys flows into the Wenshui River, and the water in the northern valleys flows into the Jishui River. At the boundary between the southern and northern valleys is the ancient Great Wall. The Riguan Peak is located fifteen miles south of the ancient Great Wall.

In December of the thirty-ninth year of the Qianlong reign, I set out from the capital in the snow and wind, passed through Qihe and Changqing counties, crossed the valley northwest of Mount Tai, crossed the wall of the Great Wall, and arrived at Tai'an. On the Dingwei day of this month, I went up the mountain from the south foot of the mountain with the prefect Zhu Xiaochun, whose courtesy name was Ziying. The 45-mile-long road was all stone steps, with more than 7,000 steps. There are three valleys to the south of Mount Tai. The water in the middle valley surrounds the city of Tai'an, which is what Li Daoyuan called the Huanshui in his book. I first entered the mountain along the middle valley, walked a short distance, crossed the middle ridge, and walked along the valley to the west, and reached the top of the mountain. In ancient times, when climbing Mount Tai, you went in along the valley on the east side. There was a gate on the road. This valley on the east side was called "Tianmen Creek" in ancient times. I have never been there. Now, the cliffs on the middle ridge and the top of the mountain that I passed by are like thresholds across the road. People call it the gate of heaven. The road was foggy and slippery, and the stone steps were almost impossible to climb. When I reached the top of the mountain, I saw the green mountains covered with white snow, and the light of the snow illuminated the sky in the south. Looking at the sunset shining on Tai'an City from afar, Wenshui River and Culai Mountain were like a beautiful landscape painting, and the clouds and mists that stayed on the hillside were like a dancing ribbon.

The day of Wushen was the end of the month. At five o'clock in the morning, Ziying and I sat in the Sun Viewing Pavilion, waiting for the sunrise. At this time, the snow blown up by the strong wind hit us in the face. To the east of the Sun Viewing Pavilion, from the bottom of the feet to the bottom, there was a cloud of mist, and dozens of white dice-like things could be vaguely seen in the clouds. That was the peak. The clouds on the horizon formed a line with strange colors, and then turned into colorful ones. The sun rose, red like cinnabar, and there was a red light shaking and swaying below to support it. Some people said that this was the East China Sea. Looking back at the peaks west of Riguan Peak, some were illuminated by the sun, some were not, some were red or white, with mixed colors, all of them looked like they were bending their backs and bowing to pay tribute.

　　To the west of Riguan Pavilion is the Dai Temple and the Bixia Yuanjun Temple; the emperor's palace is to the east of the Bixia Yuanjun Temple. On this day, (also) watched the stone carvings on the road, all of which were from the Xianqing period of the Tang Dynasty. Those older stone tablets have been blurred or missing. Those stone carvings that are remote and not facing the road were not seen in time.

　　There are many stones on the mountain and little soil. The rocks are all blue-black, mostly flat and square, and rarely round. There are few miscellaneous trees, mostly pine trees, which grow in the cracks of the stones and have flat treetops. It was a land of ice and snow, with no waterfalls, no sounds or traces of birds or animals. There were no trees within a few miles of Riguan Peak, and the snow was as thick as a person's knees.

Recorded by Yao Nai of Tongcheng.

instruction:
Give a translation for the following original text:
People's talents and conducts are rarely complete since ancient times. If they have strengths, they must have weaknesses. If we record the strengths and make up for the weaknesses, there will be no useless people in the world; if we blame the weaknesses and abandon the strengths, there will be no abandoned people in the world. In addition, people have different likes and dislikes, and different interests. Even if there are saints like Yi and Zhou, and virtuous people like Mo and Yang, who can avoid being criticized and disliked by others? In the past, Zigong asked Confucius, "If all the villagers like it, what should I do?" Confucius said, "Not yet." "If all the villagers hate it, what should I do?" Confucius said, "Not yet. It's better for the good villagers to like it and the bad to hate it." The intentions of gentlemen and villains must be opposite. The villain's hatred of gentlemen is the same as the gentleman's hatred of villains. You should observe their feelings and listen carefully. If you listen to gentlemen, the villain's way will be abandoned, and if you listen to villains, the gentleman's way will disappear.
output: From ancient times to now, few people have all the talents and virtues. If we use the strengths and make up for the shortcomings, then there will be no one who cannot be employed in the world. If we only see the shortcomings and abandon the strengths, then there will be no one who can be employed in the world. In addition, there are love and hate emotions, and different interests. If the wise are like Yi Yin and Zhou Gong, and the virtuous are like Mo Di and Yang Zhu, who can avoid being ridiculed? Zigong once asked Confucius: "If everyone in the village likes me, what should I do?" Confucius said: "I can't be sure." "If everyone in the village hates me, what should I do?" "I can't be sure. I can't think that he is good just because the villagers like him, and I can't think that he is hateful just because he doesn't like him." That's because good people and bad people must act differently, just as villains hate gentlemen and good people hate bad people. We must seriously investigate the facts. instruction: How does IAM interact with other aspects of security?
output:
IAM and AI
Artificial intelligence (AI) is playing an increasingly transformative role in identity and access management, enabling organizations to take a more granular and adaptive approach to authentication and access management. AI is also essential for user and entity behavior analytics (UEBA) to identify suspicious activity. Indicators such as malicious logins, a large number of login attempts in a short period of time, unknown locations, unrecognized devices, and whether the user is on the company's virtual private network (VPN) can all indicate malicious activity. AI can flag these indicators for real-time or near-real-time investigation to stop hackers.

IAM, Cloud, and IDaaS

IAM from the Cloud: Identity as a Service (IDaaS) and Managed Identity Services.
An increasing number of vendors are offering identity and access management services delivered from the cloud. One approach is called identity as a service (IDaaS), which can be a standalone solution or a complement to an existing on-premises IAM system. With managed identity services, as with other managed security service solutions, the security provider will monitor and manage the enterprise IAM solution running in the cloud or on-premises.

IAM for the Cloud.
Today’s enterprises have applications and data on-premises, in legacy systems and private clouds, and in one or more public cloud environments. The challenge is to manage user access to resources as seamlessly as possible, regardless of where those resources reside. The ideal identity and access management system should support SSO and MFA across hybrid multi-cloud environments.

IAM and BYOD
In today’s mobile world, employees want the freedom to work from anywhere using their own phones, tablets, laptops or wearables, and organizations are adopting BYOD (bring your own device) programs to enable it. IAM combined with a unified endpoint management platform can help organizations embrace mobility and securely adopt BYOD. 

IAM and IoT
It’s a well-known story. A hacker hacked into an aquarium smart thermometer, gained access to the company network and stole customer data. So did connected CCTV cameras. The lesson is that nearly any Internet of Things (IoT) device can be hacked, and without access management, the network is open to hackers. Today’s IAM solutions treat IoT devices as entities that need to be identified and authorized before network access.

instruction: Can you provide some history of cryptocurrency?
output:
In 1983, American cryptographer David Chaum conceived of an encrypted electronic currency called e-money. Later, in 1995, he implemented an early form of this encrypted electronic payment through Digicash. Digicash requires user software to extract paper money from the bank and specify a specific encryption key before sending it to the recipient. This makes the digital currency untraceable by third parties.

In 1996, the National Security Agency published a paper titled "How to Make a Mint: Cryptography for Anonymous Electronic Cash" describing a cryptocurrency system. The paper was first published on the MIT mailing list and published in the American Law Review in late 1997.

In 1998, Wei Dai described "b-money", an anonymous distributed electronic cash system. Shortly afterwards, Nick Szabo described bit gold. Like Bitcoin and other subsequent cryptocurrencies, bit gold was described as an electronic currency system that required users to complete a proof-of-work function, the solution of which was cryptographically combined and published.

In January 2009, Bitcoin was created by the pseudonymous developer Satoshi Nakamoto. It used SHA-256, a cryptographic hashing function, in its proof-of-work scheme. In April 2011, Namecoin was created in an attempt to form a decentralized DNS. In October 2011, Litecoin was launched, which used scrypt instead of SHA-256 as its hashing function. Peercoin was created in August 2012 and uses a mix of proof of work and proof of stake.

Cryptocurrencies have gone through several periods of growth and contraction, including multiple bubbles and market crashes, such as in 2011, 2013-2014-15, 2017-2018, and 2021-2023.

On August 6, 2014, the United Kingdom announced that its Treasury had commissioned a study into cryptocurrencies and what role, if any, they might play in the UK economy. The study was also supposed to report on whether regulation should be considered. Its final report was published in 2018, and a consultation on crypto assets and stablecoins was released in January 2021.

In June 2021, El Salvador became the first country to recognize Bitcoin as legal tender, after the Legislative Assembly passed a bill submitted by President Nayib Bukele by a vote of 62-22.

In August 2021, Cuba also issued Resolution No. 215, recognizing and regulating cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin.

In September 2021, the Chinese government, the world's largest cryptocurrency market, declared all cryptocurrency transactions illegal. This completed a crackdown on intermediaries and miners that were previously banned from operating in China.

On September 15, 2022, Ethereum, then the world's second-largest cryptocurrency, completed the upgrade of its consensus mechanism from proof of work (PoW) to proof of stake (PoS), a process known as "merger". According to Ethereum's founder, the upgrade could reduce Ethereum's energy consumption and carbon dioxide emissions by 99.9%.

On November 11, 2022, cryptocurrency exchange FTX Trading Ltd., which also operates a crypto hedge fund and is valued at $18 billion, filed for bankruptcy. The financial impact of the collapse went beyond the FTX customer base, as reported by Reuters, while at a conference, financial industry executives said "regulators must step in to protect cryptocurrency investors." instruction:
Please answer the following questions:

Question:
What is the skeletal system and what are its components and functions?
output:
Answer:
The skeletal system is the body's internal support and protection system. It includes bones, joints, and ligaments.

Skeleton: Made up of multiple bones, it forms the body's framework and support structure. Bones provide strength and support, protect internal organs, and are involved in the production of blood cells.

Joints: Connections between bones that allow movement between bones. Types of joints include ball-and-socket joints (such as the shoulder), sliding joints (such as the wrist), and hinge joints (such as the knee).

Ligaments: Connections between bones, providing stability and limiting the range of motion of joints.

Functions of the skeletal system include supporting the body, protecting internal organs, providing support and stability for movement, and storing calcium and minerals.

instruction: What items can easily be hidden as new drugs? How should we identify drugs?
output:
The forms and types of new drugs are very diverse, and it is difficult to list all drugs that may be hidden as objects. However, some common new drugs include:

Capsules: Some drugs can be made into small capsules and hidden in medicines or health products. These capsules usually have no labels or no obvious smell and taste.

Powders: Some drugs can be made into powders and hidden in foods such as spices or flour. These powders usually have no obvious smell and taste.

Crystals: Some drugs can be made into crystals and hidden in items such as candy, ice cubes or gems. These crystals usually have obvious smells and tastes.

Tablets: Some drugs can be made into tablets and hidden in medicines or health products. These tablets usually have no obvious smell and taste.

To identify drugs, you can start from the following aspects:

Observe the appearance: Observe whether the appearance of the drug is abnormal, such as color, shape, texture, etc. If the appearance is abnormal, it may be a new drug.

Smell the smell: Drugs usually have a specific smell, such as the smell of chemicals, fragrance, etc. If the smell is abnormal, it may be a new drug.

Taste: If you can taste the drugs, you may find that they taste unusual, such as bitterness, astringency, etc. If the taste is unusual, it may be a new type of drug.

Detection tools: Use detection tools, such as drug detection strips, detectors, etc., to quickly detect the presence of drugs.

In short, be alert to all possible ways of hiding drugs, do not easily accept food or medicines given by strangers, report suspicious items or people to the police in time, and jointly resist drug abuse.

instruction: What is the quick ratio?
output:
The quick ratio is a measure of a company's short-term current assets (such as cash, inventory, and accounts receivable) compared to its short-term current liabilities (such as accounts payable). A high quick ratio means that the company is better able to meet its short-term liabilities. Generally, a higher quick ratio is better because it means that the company is better able to meet its short-term liabilities. The quick ratio is usually calculated as follows:

Quick ratio = (Cash and equivalents + Accounts receivable + Inventory) / (Short-term current liabilities)

Compared to the current ratio, the quick ratio places more emphasis on a company's short-term liquidity and solvency. A low quick ratio may mean that the company does not have enough current assets to meet its short-term liabilities, which may lead to funding shortages and solvency issues.

Users can use Alipay for various transactions such as online shopping, transfers, payments, investments, etc. At the same time, Alipay also provides a way for merchants to collect payments, which can help merchants improve transaction efficiency and reduce operating costs.

In addition to basic payment functions, Alipay has also launched a series of financial services, such as Yu'ebao, Ant Huabei, Ant Jiebei, etc., providing users with convenient financial management and credit services.

The security of Alipay has been widely recognized. It uses multiple encryption technologies and real-name authentication to effectively prevent fraud and theft.

With the development of mobile Internet, Alipay has become an indispensable part of Chinese people's lives. Whether online or offline, Alipay plays an important role in various scenarios.

instruction:
Translate the following classical Chinese text:
Fang Zhongyong, a native of Jinxi, was a farmer for generations. When Zhongyong was five years old, he had never seen any writing tools, but suddenly cried and asked for one. His father was surprised and borrowed some from a neighbor. He then wrote four lines of poetry and signed his name. His poems were about supporting his parents and raising a clan, and he passed them to a local scholar to read. He could write poems on the spot by pointing at objects, and his writing and logic were both impressive. The people of the town were surprised by this, and gradually invited his father to stay with them, or begged him for money. His father took advantage of this, and took Zhongyong around to visit the people of the town every day, but did not let him study. I have heard about him for a long time. In the Mingdao period, I returned home from my ancestors and saw him at my uncle's house. He was twelve or thirteen years old. He asked him to write a poem, but it was not as good as before. Seven years later, he returned from Yangzhou and went to his uncle's house to ask about him. He said, "He is just like everyone else."
output: Fang Zhongyong, a commoner in Jinxi, has been farming for generations. When Zhongyong was five years old, he had never known writing tools. One day he suddenly cried for these things. His father was surprised and borrowed a neighbor's to give him. He immediately wrote four poems and wrote his name on them. This poem is about supporting parents and uniting people of the same clan, and it was sent to the whole township for scholars to watch. From then on, he could write poems on designated objects immediately, and his poems were worthy of praise for their literary talent and reasoning. The people in the same township were surprised by this and gradually invited his father to visit them. Some people even paid for Zhongyong to write poems. My father saw this as profitable and took Zhongyong to visit people in the same township every day, not letting him study. I have heard about this for a long time. During the Mingdao period, I followed my father back to my hometown and met Zhongyong at my uncle's house. He was twelve or thirteen years old at the time. He asked him to write poems, but the poems he wrote could not match his previous reputation. Seven years later, I came back from Yangzhou and went to my uncle's house to ask about Zhongyong's situation. The uncle replied: "He has become an ordinary person."

instruction: Why do whales spray water?
output:
Whales are not actually fish, they are mammals that live in the ocean. Although they live in water, they still breathe with lungs.

Its lungs are large and can hold more than 15,000 liters of air, so they can stay in the water for a long time, but they still have to float to the surface when they breathe. The nostrils of whales are located between the two eyes on the top of their heads. When they float to the surface to exhale, they will spray seawater into the air, and a fountain will appear on the sea surface.

instruction:
Please answer the following questions:

Question:
What is the human digestive system, what organs does it include and what are its functions?
output:
Answer:
The human digestive system is a system used to break down food, absorb nutrients, and eliminate waste. It includes organs such as the mouth, esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine, and anus.

Mouth: Responsible for chewing food and mixing food with saliva to begin digesting starch and protein.
Esophagus: Pushes the chewed food into the stomach through peristalsis.
Stomach: Secretes gastric acid and enzymes to further break down food into easily digestible forms.
Small intestine: Absorbs most nutrients, including protein, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, and minerals.
Large intestine: Absorbs water and electrolytes and converts undigested food residues into solid feces.
Anus: Excretes feces through the anus.

instruction: Why aren't penguins afraid of the cold?
output:
Penguins live in Antarctica, the coldest place on earth, where the lowest temperature is close to minus 100 degrees Celsius.

　　Why can penguins survive in such a cold environment? This is because penguins are covered with dense, fine and soft feathers that even water cannot penetrate. Under the feathers, there is dense down that tightly wraps the body, just like wearing a cashmere jacket and down coat, so it is not afraid of water or cold.

　　In addition, there is a thick layer of fat under the skin of penguins, which also plays a particularly good role in heat preservation, so penguins can survive in the cold Antarctic.

instruction: Why does the space shuttle take off vertically?
output:
Every time the space shuttle goes to space to perform a mission, it always gives people the impression of "starting strong but ending weak". You see, it rises into the sky with a deafening roar, surrounded by thick smoke and flames. When it returns to the ground, it lands silently like a glider, not as lively as a large passenger plane landing!

Please pay attention to the space shuttle during launch: it is "tied" to an external fuel tank that is larger than itself, and there are two booster rockets. With the help of these "good external helpers", the space shuttle first rises to an altitude of tens of kilometers and drops two fuel-depleted booster rockets (they are recovered by parachutes and reused). When it rises to an altitude of more than 100 kilometers, it discards the huge external fuel tank. Only then can the space shuttle's own engine be enough to send it to an orbit hundreds of kilometers high.

　　With so many "cans and jars" hanging on it, the space shuttle certainly cannot take off horizontally like an airplane, and the air resistance it encounters is far greater than that of a large airplane. Besides, rocket engines are impatient and can only work for a short time. Therefore, the space shuttle must rise vertically in the first one or two minutes and rush out of the dense lower atmosphere as quickly as possible. When it returns, it has already gotten rid of the cumbersome external hangings and can land like a glider.

　　Using a reusable space shuttle to launch satellites is cheaper than using a traditional launch vehicle that is scrapped after one use. However, the space shuttle can only be launched from an expensive launch pad and needs to be reassembled after each flight, so it cannot be reused in the short term. Therefore, by the 21st century, it will be replaced by a more advanced aerospace plane.

instruction: Please briefly introduce the poet Bai Juyi.
output: Bai Juyi (772-846), also known as Mr. Zuiyin, was born in Xinzheng, Henan. His ancestral home was Taiyuan. His great-grandfather moved to Xiagui. He was born in Xinzheng, Henan. He was a great realist poet in the Tang Dynasty and one of the three great poets in the Tang Dynasty. Bai Juyi and Yuan Zhen jointly advocated the New Yuefu Movement, and were known as "Yuan Bai". Together with Liu Yuxi, they were also known as "Liu Bai". Bai Juyi's poems cover a wide range of topics, are diverse in form, and are written in plain and popular language. He is known as the "Poetry Demon" and the "Poetry King". In 846 AD, Bai Juyi died in Luoyang and was buried in Xiangshan. He has handed down "Baishi Changqing Collection", and his representative poems include "Song of Everlasting Regret", "The Charcoal Seller", "Pipa Song", etc.

output:
If it is a male betta, then one fish tank is generally suitable for raising only one betta. This is because bettas are ferocious and violent by nature. If you raise multiple bettas together, they are likely to fight and cause harm to your pet.
If it is a female betta, you can choose to raise it alone or in a group (betta sorority). Raising female bettas in a group is not easy. You need to do more research and choose the right betta (usually female bettas from the same ovary) to increase the success rate.

instruction:
Please answer the following questions:

Question:
What is sustainable development and why is it important for the future?
output:
Answer:
Sustainable development means meeting the needs of the present generation without compromising the ability to meet the needs of future generations. It emphasizes balanced development of the economy, society and environment to ensure sustainable use of resources and health of ecosystems.

Sustainable development is crucial for the future for the following reasons:
1) Resource conservation: Sustainable development ensures the rational use and conservation of resources to meet the needs of future generations. This includes sustainable management and protection of natural resources such as water, energy, and forests.
2) Environmental protection: Sustainable development strives to reduce environmental pollution and ecological damage and maintain the integrity and health of ecosystems. This is essential for protecting biodiversity, addressing climate change and ensuring ecological balance.
3) Social equity: Sustainable development pursues social equity and inclusion to ensure that everyone has basic rights and opportunities, reduce poverty and inequality, and promote social stability and harmony.
4) Economic stability: Sustainable development promotes long-term economic stability and sustainable growth, and achieves economic prosperity and social progress by promoting innovation, sustainable industrial development and job creation.
5) International cooperation: Sustainable development requires cooperation and coordination among countries to jointly respond to global challenges. International cooperation is essential to achieving sustainable development goals, including cooperation in resource sharing, knowledge exchange and technology transfer.

In short, sustainable development is not only about the interests of the current generation, but also about protecting the earth and creating better living conditions for future generations. Only through sustainable development can we achieve a balance between economic prosperity, social progress and environmental protection and ensure the sustainable development of mankind.

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:

King Jing asked Yan Zi, "What is the trouble with the country?" Yan Zi replied, "It's the rats on the altar." The king asked, "What do you mean?" He replied, "The altar is made of wood tied together and covered with a road. Rats go there to take shelter. If you smoke it, you may burn the wood. If you water it, you may ruin the road. The reason why rats cannot be killed is because of the altar. The country also has altar rats, which are on the left and right of the ruler. They conceal good and evil from the ruler internally and sell power to the people externally. If they are not killed, there will be chaos. If they are killed, they will be used as evidence by the ruler and they will keep it in their stomachs. They are also the altar rats of the country."
output: Duke Jing of Qi (surname Jiang, name Chujiu) asked Yan Zi, "What should we fear when governing a country?" Yan Zi replied, "I should fear the rats in the altar." Duke Jing asked, "What do you mean?" Yan Zi replied, "Speaking of the altar, wood is lined up together (束: gather, here means standing side by side), and they are coated with mud, and rats will go and live there. If you use smoke or fire to fumigate them, you are afraid of burning the wood, and if you use water to pour it, you are afraid of damaging the mud. The reason why these rats cannot be killed is because of the altar. The country also has them. The favorites around the monarch are the altar rats. In the court, they deceive the monarch about good and evil, and outside the court, they show off their power to the people. If they are not punished, they will do whatever they want and endanger the country; if they are to be punished, they are protected by the monarch, and the monarch shelters them and forgives them, so it is really difficult to punish them." These are the altar rats of the country.

Zhao Guang was from Hefei. This is a short history of Li Boshi's family. Boshi was a painter and always asked him to serve by his side. During the Jianyan period, the bandits heard that he was good at painting. They asked him to paint the captured women. Guang resolutely refused, saying that he could not paint. instruction: Why is it usually sunny when there is dew?
output: When the atmosphere is relatively stable, the wind is light, and the sky is clear and cloudless, the heat on the ground dissipates quickly, the temperature drops, and when water vapor encounters the colder ground or objects, dew forms. On cloudy nights, heat generally goes up into the air, and when it hits the clouds, part of it is reflected back to the ground, and the other part is absorbed by the clouds. In this way, on a night with clouds, the temperature near the ground is not easy to drop, and dew is difficult to form. If there is wind at night, it will cause convection between the upper and lower air, increase the temperature of the air near the ground, and diffuse the water vapor, so it is also difficult to form dew.

instruction: Does woman mean unmarried or married?
output: Niangmen is a local dialect. Niangmen is mostly used to derogatory terms for adult women. It carries strong emotional color, mostly expressing dislike, contempt, disgust, etc. However, if this word is used for middle-aged women, it is generally a neutral word. Because some people will use this word to call their wives in front of others to express her ownership. So in this respect it is not completely a derogatory word. Niangmen can also be used to satirize men who are indecisive, narrow-minded or cowardly, or like women, and have too many worries. It is generally used to insult others, which can be said to be a kind of dirty words. This word is mostly derogatory when used on men, which is the same as satire. Or some men with weak bodies or even some men with feminine looks will also be called this way. In the Middle Ages, some men called prostitutes and slutty women, etc. In some rural areas of my country, the name for middle-aged women is a neutral word, generally a verbal name for married women with children, and the written name is women. Generally speaking, in these areas, unmarried women are called "daughters", newly married women are called "daughters-in-law", middle-aged women are called "mothers", and old women are called "laobaoer".

instruction:
Translate the following ancient text:
When Zhou Chu was young, he was fierce and chivalrous, and was a threat to the people in his village. There was a dragon in the water of Yixing, and a white-browed tiger in the mountain. They were violent and violent to the people. The people of Yixing called them the three evils, and Chu was the worst. Some said that Chu killed the tiger and the dragon, but he actually hoped that only one of the three evils would be left. Chu immediately stabbed the tiger to death, and then went into the water to kill the dragon. The dragon floated or sank, and traveled dozens of miles with Chu. After three days and three nights, the people in the village all thought it was dead, and they celebrated. Finally, he killed the dragon and got out. When he heard the people in the village celebrating, he realized that he was troubled by human nature and wanted to change himself. So he went from Wu to look for the two Lu. Pingyuan was not there, and he met Qinghe. He told them the truth and said that he wanted to change himself, but he had wasted years and would never achieve anything. Qinghe said: "The ancients valued hearing in the morning and dying in the evening. Besides, your future is still good. Besides, people worry about not being able to establish their ambitions, so why worry about not being famous?" Chu then changed his ways and became a loyal minister and filial son.
output: When Zhou Chu was young, he was a tyrannical and strong man who fought and quarreled with others, which was a great scourge for the local people. In addition, there was a dragon in the water of Yixing and a white-browed tiger on the mountain. They were a scourge to the people. The people called them the "three evils", and Zhou Chu was the most powerful among the three evils. So someone asked Zhou Chu: Since you are so capable, why don't you kill the tiger and the dragon to prove your strength? In fact, they hoped that the three evils would fight each other and only one would be left. After hearing this, Zhou Chu immediately went up the mountain to kill the tiger, and then jumped into the water to fight the dragon. The dragon floated or sank in the water and drifted dozens of miles away. After three days and three nights, the people thought that the dragon and Zhou Chu were dead together, and they came out to celebrate. As a result, Zhou Chu killed the dragon and climbed up from the shore with its head. Hearing that the villagers thought he was dead and expressed their congratulations, he realized that in fact everyone also regarded him as a great scourge, and he couldn't help but burst into tears and felt repentant. So he went to Wujun to find Lu Ji and Lu Yun, two famous scholars in Dongwu at that time. Lu Ji was not there, and only Lu Yun was there. Zhou Chu told him the whole situation and said, "I want to correct my mistakes, but I have wasted my time and I am afraid that I will not achieve anything in the end." Lu Yun said, "The ancients cherished morality and believed that 'even if I understand the truth in the morning, I will be willing to die in the evening.' Besides, your future is still promising. Besides, people are afraid of not being able to set their goals. As long as you can set your goals and work hard to achieve them, why worry about not spreading your good reputation?" After hearing this, Zhou Chu decided to reform himself and eventually became a loyal minister and filial son.

instruction: Why do officers and soldiers on aircraft carriers wear colorful uniforms?
output:
The personnel on the surface ships all wear uniforms, but the personnel on the aircraft carriers wear military uniforms of red, yellow, blue, white, green, purple, etc. Why are the uniforms of the personnel on the aircraft carriers differentiated by color?

It turns out that this is related to the special working environment of the aircraft carrier. Because the aircraft carrier is different from the ground airport, and its flight deck area is quite limited, and various types of personnel are quite concentrated. In order to maintain a good working order and facilitate recognition and unified command and management, people with different tasks must wear military uniforms of different colors. Those wearing yellow uniforms are usually shipboard observers, responsible for the takeoff and landing of carrier aircraft and the safety of people around them; those wearing blue uniforms are usually responsible for aircraft wheel stops and aircraft air intake plugs; those wearing red uniforms are only responsible for lifesaving, salvaging and firefighting; those wearing green uniforms are only responsible for aircraft takeoff and ejection and landing blocking; those wearing purple uniforms are mainly responsible for aircraft fuel filling; those wearing white uniforms are all maintenance personnel, mainly responsible for aircraft inspection, maintenance and repair; those wearing white uniforms with red crosses are mainly shipboard medical personnel.

Therefore, the uniforms of various personnel in Yuanwang are clearly marked, the colors are also very eye-catching, the division of labor is clear, and each performs their duties, which not only improves work efficiency but also reduces the occurrence of accidents.

instruction: Why can't computers generate truly random numbers?

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
People's talents and conducts are rarely complete since ancient times. If they have strengths, they must have weaknesses. If we record strengths and make up for weaknesses, there will be no useless people in the world; if we blame weaknesses and abandon strengths, there will be no abandoned people in the world. In addition, people have different likes and dislikes, and different interests. Even if saints are like Yi and Zhou, and virtuous people are like Mo and Yang, who can avoid being criticized and blamed? In the past, Zigong asked Confucius, "If all the villagers like it, what should I do?" Confucius said, "Not yet." "If all the villagers hate it, what should I do?" Confucius said, "Not yet. It's better for the good villagers to like it and the bad to hate it." The intentions of gentlemen and villains must be opposite. The villain's hatred of gentlemen is the same as the gentleman's hatred of villains. You should observe their feelings and listen carefully. If you listen to gentlemen, the villain's way will be abandoned, and if you listen to villains, the gentleman's way will disappear.
output: From ancient times to now, few people have all the talents and virtues. If we use the strengths and make up for the shortcomings, then there will be no one who cannot be hired in the world. If we only see the shortcomings and abandon the strengths, then there will be no one who can be hired in the world. In addition, there are love and hate emotions, and different interests. If the wise are like Yi Yin and Zhou Gong, and the virtuous are like Mo Di and Yang Zhu, who can avoid being ridiculed? Zigong once asked Confucius: "If everyone in a village likes me, what should I do?" Confucius said: "I can't be sure." "If everyone in a village hates me, what should I do?" "I can't be sure. I can't think that he is good just because the villagers like him, and I can't think that he is hateful just because he doesn't like him." That's because good people and bad people must act differently, just as villains hate gentlemen and good people hate bad people. We must seriously investigate the facts. If we listen to the words of gentlemen, the villain's way will be abolished, and if we listen to the words of villains, the gentleman's way will disappear.

instruction: Why can leeks continue to grow after being cut?
output: Leek is an evergreen plant, a perennial herb. Generally, the old plants need to be dug up and replanted after 3 to 4 years. The leeks we eat are cut at the ground level. Why can leeks continue to grow after being cut? This is because it has many scales growing underground, and the scales store a lot of nutrients for the growth of leek leaves. Leek leaves grow very fast, because the leaves do not grow from the tip of the leaf, but grow upward from the center of the scales, so after cutting off the upper leek leaves, the lower ones will grow again. Generally, from spring to autumn, leeks can be cut once every 40 days. If there is enough fertilizer, it can be harvested 5 to 6 times a year.

instruction: Translate the following ancient text: Fan Shi, courtesy name Juqing, went to the Imperial College when he was young and became a student. He was friends with Zhang Shao from Runan. Shao's courtesy name was Yuanbo. The two of them said goodbye and returned to their hometown. Shi said to Yuanbo: "I will come back in two years. I will go to visit my parents and meet my son." So they set a date. When he arrived later, Yuanbo told his mother and asked her to prepare food to welcome him. His mother said: "We have been separated for two years and we have made a promise thousands of miles apart. How can you trust it?" He replied: "Juqing is a trustworthy man and will not disobey." His mother said: "If so, I will brew some wine for you." On the day, Juqing arrived, went up to the hall to pay respects and drink, and left happily.
output: Fan Shi, courtesy name Juqing, was from Jinzhang, Shanyang (now Jinshan County, Shandong). When he was young, he studied at the Imperial College and became one of the many students. He was a classmate and friend of Zhang Shao from Runan, whose courtesy name was Yuanbo. They both left the Imperial College and returned home at the same time. Fan Shi said to Zhang Shao, "I will come to your house to visit your parents and see your children in two years." So they agreed on a date. Later, when the agreed date was approaching, Zhang Shao told his mother about it and asked his mother to prepare wine and food to entertain Fan Shi. His mother asked: "It has been two years since you separated, and you are thousands of miles apart. Do you really trust him so seriously?" Zhang Shao replied: "Fan Shi is a trustworthy person, and he will definitely not break his promise." His mother said, "If this is really the case, then I will make wine for you." On the appointed day, Fan Shi really came. Everyone drank together and said goodbye happily.

instruction: Why can a sore throat cause a person to die in a short period of time? Is this a sign of sudden death?
output:
A sore throat itself will not cause a person to die in a short period of time, but it may be a sign or symptom that the patient may have a more serious disease. For example, respiratory infections such as tonsillitis or pharyngitis may cause a sore throat, and these problems may lead to more serious complications such as pneumonia or myocarditis.

In addition, some diseases may have some precursors or warning signs before the onset of the disease, which may be the body's last reminder to us. For example, heart diseases such as angina pectoris or myocardial infarction may cause chest pain, shortness of breath, nausea, dizziness, sweating and other symptoms. If these symptoms occur and are ignored, they may lead to sudden death.

Therefore, if you feel unwell or symptoms, you should seek medical attention in time and seek help from a professional doctor. Do not rely on the Internet or self-diagnosis to treat diseases, as this may lead to serious consequences.
