instruction: Why can washing machines wash clothes cleanly?
output:
The washing machine was invented in the 19th century. Washing machines are generally divided into agitator washing machines, pulsator washing machines and drum washing machines. Agitator washing machines are the origin of modern laundry technology. It is the first real revolution in laundry technology, which has liberated human hands.

　　Agitator washing machines apply the principle of agitation to clean clothes through chemical and mechanical actions. Pulsator washing machines have a simpler structure and are divided into two types: double-cylinder semi-automatic and fully automatic pulsators. The strong water flow generated by the rapid rotation of the bottom pulsator is used as the power, and the mutual friction between clothes, water flow and drum wall is used to remove dirt.

　　Currently, drum washing machines are popular all over the world. After more than 80 years of technological development, they represent mature modern laundry technology. The washing principle is to lift and drop clothes and water by rotating the inner drum clockwise and counterclockwise, so that the detergent can fully penetrate into the clothes, and the clothes are cleaned by squeezing, beating and spraying water from above. The drum washing machine not only leads another new revolution in washing technology, but also with the development of intelligence, the technology will be improved day by day.

　　The washing machine without washing powder is a new type of ultrasonic washing machine, which does not need to add any substances. Its working principle is that the high-frequency oscillation signal emitted by the ultrasonic generator is converted into high-frequency oscillation through the transducer and transmitted to the water, causing the water flow to generate tens of thousands of small bubbles. The instantaneous high pressure causes the bubbles to produce a series of small "explosions", which continuously impact the surface of the clothes, causing the dirt on the surface of the clothes and in the gaps of the clothes to fall off quickly.

instruction: What are the three cosmic velocities?
output:
According to scientific calculations, as long as an object reaches a speed of 7.9 meters per second and is thrown horizontally, it can orbit the earth. This speed is called the first cosmic speed. If an object reaches a speed of 11.2 kilometers per second, it can overcome the earth's gravity and fly to other planets in the solar system. This speed is called the second cosmic speed.

If the speed of an object reaches a speed of 16.7 kilometers per second, it can fly out of the solar system and go to other star worlds. This speed is called the third cosmic speed.

instruction:
Please answer this question: 
How do fish breathe?
output: Answer: The gills of fish are located on both sides of the head. When a fish breathes, it opens its mouth and swallows water into the oropharynx, then closes its mouth and allows water to flow through the gills. The oxygen dissolved in the water will penetrate into the gills and flow back to the heart through the blood vessels and then be transported throughout the body. The carbon dioxide in the blood will also be discharged into the water through the gill capillaries to complete the gas exchange. At this time, the fish will open the gill cover and discharge the water out of the body through the gill fissures.

instruction: Why do wolves love to howl at night?
output:
All kinds of animals in the world have their own living habits. Wolves are carnivorous beasts that specialize in hunting rabbits, pheasants, voles, fawns, lambs, etc. They eat carrion and corpses and even kill each other. Wolves sometimes hurt people. Wolves have a large appetite and can eat dozens of kilograms of meat at a time. Wolves are also very tolerant of hunger. They can go without eating for months without losing their ferocity.

Wolves are used to going out at night. After dusk, hungry wolves often go out in groups to forage. They howl softly while walking. The calls of animals are communication signals for mutual contact. Different calls are made in different situations, and the calls are also closely related to reproductive habits.

Wolves howl at night to gather together. For example, female wolves often call their young, and male wolves call their females. After gathering in a group, they go out to hunt. During the breeding season, wolves also often howl to find mates. When hungry, young wolves will make sharp calls.

Wolves seriously endanger poultry, livestock and various wild animals. Therefore, they are a pest. They should be hunted in a limited manner.

instruction: Why is the air pressure higher in winter than in summer?
output: When the air is heated and expands, the density decreases, and the weight of the air column per unit area decreases, so the air pressure decreases and the air pressure increases. Therefore, the air pressure in winter is higher than in summer. You may ask: In summer, the air expands everywhere, so where does the extra air go? It turns out that the seasons in the northern and southern hemispheres of the earth are opposite. So the air that expands in the summer hemisphere just goes to the winter hemisphere to replenish it.

instruction: Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text: (Chen) Shi was a fair and just man in his village. Whenever there was a dispute, he would always seek justice, explain the difference between right and wrong, and no one would complain. He sighed and said, "I would rather be punished than be shortchanged by Mr. Chen." At that time, the people were frugal. A thief broke into his house at night and hid on the beam. Shi saw him secretly, so he stood up, combed his clothes, called his children and grandchildren, and taught him with a serious face, "Lady, you must encourage yourself. People who are not good are not necessarily bad by nature. They become bad by habit and end up like this. The gentleman on the beam is such a person!" The thief was so frightened that he threw himself to the ground and bowed his head to confess his crime. Shi slowly compared him to him and said, "Looking at your appearance, you don't look like a bad person. You should be more self-disciplined and become good. But this is probably because of poverty." He ordered him to leave two pieces of silk. Since then, there has been no more theft in the county.
output: Chen Shi treated things with a peaceful heart in the countryside. When there were disputes among the people, Chen Shi made fair judgments and told the people the right and wrong of the truth. The people did not complain after returning home. Everyone sighed and said, "I would rather be punished than criticized by Chen Shi." At that time, the harvest was bad and the people had no harvest. A thief broke into Chen Shi's house at night and hid on the beam. Chen Shi secretly discovered it, so he got up and straightened his clothes, asked his children and grandchildren to gather around, and sternly admonished them, saying, "People must encourage themselves. Unkind people are not necessarily bad by nature. (Bad) habits are often formed by (not paying attention to) character cultivation, so they come to this point. The gentleman on the beam is such a person." The thief was shocked and jumped from the beam to the ground, knelt on the ground, and sincerely confessed his guilt. Chen Shi slowly told him: "Looking at your appearance, you don't look like a bad person. You should restrain yourself and return to the right path. However, your behavior is probably caused by poverty." In the end, he gave the thief two pieces of silk. From then on, there was no more theft in the county.

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:

Zu Ti of Fanyang had great ambitions when he was young. He and Liu Kun were both the chief clerks of Sizhou and slept together. In the middle of the night, he heard the cock crowing and kicked Kun awake, saying, "This is not a bad sound!" Then he started to dance. When crossing the Yangtze River, the left prime minister Rui appointed him as the military advisor. Ti lived in Jingkou and gathered brave men. He said to Rui, "The chaos of the Jin Dynasty was not caused by the lack of justice of the emperor and the resentment of the people. It was caused by the struggle for power among the royal family and the mutual destruction of each other, which allowed the Rongdi to take advantage of the opportunity and poison the Central Plains. Now that the remaining people have suffered from cruelty and robbery, people want to fight for themselves. If the king can really order a general to go out and let someone like Ti lead them to recover the Central Plains, the heroes of the counties and states will surely respond to the call." Rui had no ambition to fight in the north, so he appointed Ti as the general of fighting for power and the governor of Yuzhou, and gave him food for a thousand people and three thousand pieces of cloth, but no armor and weapons, so that he could recruit himself. Ti led more than a hundred of his followers across the river. When they were in the middle of the river, they struck the oars and swore, "If Zu Ti cannot clear the Central Plains and restore the river, he will be as bad as the Yangtze River!" Then he stationed in Huaiyin, started smelting and casting soldiers, and recruited more than 2,000 people before advancing.
output: Zu Ti, a native of Fanyang, had great ambitions to recover the Central Plains when he was young. He once served as the chief clerk of Sizhou with Liu Kun. When he and Liu Kun were sleeping in the same bedroom, he heard the crowing of a cock in the middle of the night. He kicked Liu Kun awake and said, "This is not a disgusting sound (or an ominous sign)." Then he got up and danced with a sword. After crossing the Yangtze River, the left prime minister Sima Rui made him the chief military priest. Zu Ti lived in Jingkou and gathered a group of brave and strong soldiers. He said to Sima Rui: "The turmoil in the Jin Dynasty was not caused by the monarch's unjust behavior, which made the ministers resentful and rebellious, but rather the struggle for power among the royal relatives and the killing of each other. This allowed the Rongdi people to take advantage of the opportunity and spread the scourge throughout the Central Plains. Now that the remnants of the Jin Dynasty have been devastated and harmed, everyone wants to strengthen themselves. If you can send generals to lead the troops and send people like me to lead the army to recover the Central Plains, there will definitely be heroes from all over the country who will be infected by the environment and respond positively!" Sima Rui never had the ambition to march north. After listening to Zu Ti's words, he appointed Zu Ti as General Fenwei and Governor of Yuzhou, and only allocated him food for a thousand people and three thousand pieces of cloth. He did not provide him with armor and weapons, and let Zu Ti find a way to recruit them himself. Zu Ti led his private army of more than one hundred households across the Yangtze River. While beating the oars in the river, he said, "If Zu Ti cannot bring peace to the Central Plains and succeed in the restoration, he will be like the great river, going there without return!" So he stationed in Huaiyin, built a furnace to smelt and cast weapons, recruited more than 2,000 people, and then continued to move forward.

instruction:

Chancellor Qin, in his later years, had great power. He often had several soldiers in black clothes holding sticks standing outside the government gate. The prime minister said in panic, "I only recited the merits of the Grand Tutor, which were unparalleled in the world. I left after finishing my speech. I really had nothing else to say." Duke Qin laughed and said, "Thank you very much!" He had already instigated the officials who spoke out to submit a memorial. As soon as the prime minister returned, a copy of the cabinet's memorial had arrived. He was so vicious.
output: Qin Hui became more powerful later. Usually, there were several soldiers wearing black clothes and holding sticks standing at the gate of Qin's mansion. Passers-by who looked into the door would be scolded. Once he was sick and took a leave of absence for one or two days. Another minister answered the emperor alone in the court. The minister did not dare to say anything to him, but just kept praising him in front of the emperor. The next day, Qin Hui came to the morning court and suddenly asked the minister: "I heard that you spoke for a long time in front of the emperor yesterday?" The minister said in fear: "I just praised your unparalleled merits and virtues, and I left after speaking. I really didn't say anything else." Qin Hui said with a smile: "Thank you very much!" It turned out that he had instigated officials to report. As soon as the minister returned home, the cabinet's copy of the impeachment against him had been sent to his home. Qin Hui's cruelty was so cruel.

instruction:
Translate the following ancient text:
An Shiyi was a tall and strong man with a voice like a bell. When he was first appointed as a censor, he went to his mother and said, "The court did not think An Shiyi was unworthy and appointed him to the position of a speaker. If you hold this position, you must be open and responsible. If you offend the emperor, you will be punished immediately. The emperor is ruling the world with filial piety. If you resign for the sake of your old mother, you can avoid it." His mother said, "No, I heard that the censor is the emperor's loyal minister. Your father wanted to be one all his life but failed. You are lucky to be here, so you should sacrifice yourself to repay the country. If you are exiled, no matter how far you go, I will follow you." So he accepted the order. He served for many years, stood upright in the court, and supported justice. He argued in front of the court. If the emperor was furious, he would stand back with a letter, wait until the anger subsided, and then go forward to argue. The attendants watching from a distance shrank in fear and sweated, calling him "the tiger in the palace", and everyone was in awe.
output: Anshi was a man of great stature, dignified appearance, and a voice like a bell. He was initially appointed as a censor, but before he accepted the position, he returned home and said to his mother: "The court did not appoint me as a censor because I am not virtuous. If I take this position, I must be courageous and dare to uphold justice without fear, and take responsibility with my life. If I offend the emperor, disaster and demotion will come immediately. The emperor is governing the country with filial piety. If I use my mother's old age as an excuse, I should be able to avoid this position." His mother said: "That's not right. I heard that the censor is an important official who dares to speak out and make honest remonstrations in front of the emperor. Your father wanted to be such an official all his life but failed. You are lucky enough to take this position, and you should sacrifice your life to repay the great kindness of the country. Even if I am punished and exiled, no matter how far or near, I will definitely follow you." (Anshi) So he accepted the position. He served for many years, standing in the court with a solemn look, presiding over justice. He criticized in person and argued in the court. Sometimes when the emperor was furious, he would stand back with his hand in his hand, waiting for the emperor to calm down before going forward to argue. The attendants watching from afar, shrinking their heads and sweating in fear, called him "the tiger in the palace". For a time, everyone admired him.

instruction: Why can radar measure wind and rain?
output: The radar used to measure wind and rain is called a meteorological radar. When measuring wind, meteorologists first release a hydrogen balloon with a metal reflector target. The radar then emits radio waves to the metal reflector target. The intensity of the reflection varies, and the brightness of the echo displayed on the radar screen varies. The brighter the echo, the larger the diameter of the water droplets in the cloud. This way, it can be judged whether it will rain in this cloud.

instruction: Why does my stomach growl?

If we have not eaten yet, the gas in the stomach and intestines will make a sound due to this movement, which tells us that it is time to eat.

instruction: Why is Confucius called a saint?
output:
Confucius had a far-reaching influence on later generations. Although he "narrated but did not create", he was already known as "the sage of heaven", "the wooden bell of heaven", "the sage of the ages" during his lifetime, and was one of the most learned people in society at that time.

Later generations also revered him as "the most holy" (the sage among sages) and "the model for all ages". They believed that he had revised "Book of Songs" and "Book of Documents", established "Rites" and "Music", prefaced "Book of Changes" (called "Book of Changes" Ten Wings, or "Book of Changes"), and wrote "Spring and Autumn Annals". "The Analects" is one of the classic works of the Confucian school, compiled by Confucius' disciples and their disciples. It is mainly in the form of quotations and dialogues, recording the words and deeds of Confucius and his disciples, and focusing on Confucius' political propositions, ethical thoughts, moral concepts and educational principles. Together with "The Great Learning", "The Doctrine of the Mean" and "Mencius", it is called the "Four Books". The popular version of "The Analects" has a total of 20 chapters. The language of The Analects is concise and refined, and its meaning is profound. Many of the statements in it are still regarded as the truth by people today.

instruction: Why do table tennis rackets have rubber surfaces on both sides?
output:
For table tennis players who are good at close-range fast attack, it is most suitable to use a sponge racket with positive rubber. The rubber particles of the rubber face outwards, the contact area between the rubber and the table tennis ball is small, the ball stays on the rubber particle surface for a short time, and the rebound speed is fast, which is conducive to speeding up the attack speed. Players who are good at looping and slicing balls all choose reverse-stick rackets. Because the racket with the rubber particles facing inwards has an extra layer of rubber particles between the rubber and the sponge, and there are gaps between the rubber particles. When the racket contacts the ball, the rubber surface will be concave inward, and the contact area with the ball will increase the friction.

Athletes rely on the "stickiness" and greater friction of the racket surface to make the upper loop and the lower slice spin more powerful.

instruction: When making a movie, the term "Sha Qing" is often used to indicate the completion of filming. What did "Sha Qing" originally mean?
output:
The term "killing green" originated from the pre-Qin period.
At that time, books were mostly made of bamboo slips (called "jian") and wooden slips (called "du"). First, characters were engraved on the slips and then holes were punched on one side of them. Then, they were woven together with silk ropes or cowhide belts to form a book shaped like the word "ce". Because there was a layer of bamboo green on the surface of the bamboo pole, which contained oil and water components, it was not easy to engrave characters, and bamboo was easily eaten by insects, so the ancients came up with a method of roasting bamboo slips on fire. Bamboo slips that have been roasted are easy to engrave characters and are resistant to insects, so roasting is an important process in the production of bamboo slips.
At that time, people called this process "killing green", also called "hanqing" and "hanjian". This is how the term "killing green" came about. In the Qin Dynasty, pens were available, so the characters on the slips could be written with pens instead of knives. At that time, people often used brushes to write the first draft on bamboo green because the bamboo green was smooth and they only needed to wipe it off to make revisions. After the first draft was revised, the bamboo green was scraped off and the final draft was written on bamboo white. This procedure was also called "killing the green".

instruction:
Translate the following ancient text:
Fan Zhongyan was orphaned at the age of two. His mother was poor and had no one to rely on. He married Zhu from Changshan. When he grew up, he knew about his family background. He wept and said goodbye to his mother. He went to the southern capital to study. He studied hard day and night. He never took off his clothes to sleep for five years. Sometimes he felt lazy at night and always poured water on his face. He often had no porridge and only ate at sunset. He then mastered the meaning of the Six Classics and had a great ambition to contribute to the world. He often recited to himself: I should worry about the world before I worry about myself, and be happy after the world is happy.
output: When Fan Zhongyan was two years old, his father died. His mother was very poor and had no one to rely on. So she remarried to the Zhu family in Changshan. When Fan Zhongyan grew up, he knew his origins. He said goodbye to his mother with tears in his eyes and left to study at the Nandu Academy in Yingtian Prefecture. He studied hard during the day and late at night. In five years, he never took off his clothes to go to bed. Sometimes he felt drowsy at night and often poured water on his face. Fan Zhongyan often studied hard during the day and ate nothing until the sun was setting. In this way, he understood the main purpose of the Six Classics, and later set up the ambition to benefit the world. He often said to himself: "You should worry about the worries of the world first, and be happy after the happiness of the world."

instruction:

Zilu met Confucius, and Confucius asked, "What do you like to do?" He replied, "I like long swords." Confucius said, "That's not what I'm asking. It's just that if you add knowledge to what you can do, how can you reach it?"...Zilu said, "There are bamboos in the south mountain. They are straight without being rubbed. If you cut them and shoot them, they will penetrate rhinoceros leather. In this sense, what is the point of learning?" Confucius said, "If you feather them and sharpen them, won't they penetrate deeper?" Zilu bowed and said, "I respectfully accept your teaching."
output: Zilu went to see Confucius, who asked him, "What do you like?" Zilu replied, "I like long swords." Confucius said, "I'm not asking about that. I'm just saying that with your talent and the addition of learning, how can anyone catch up with you?" ... Zilu said, "There is a kind of bamboo in the South Mountain that is very straight without kneading or roasting. After being sharpened and shot, it can penetrate the thick skin of a rhinoceros. So why do we need to go through the process of learning?" Confucius said, "If you put feathers on the tail of the arrow and sharpen the tip of the arrow, won't the arrow be able to shoot deeper and farther?" After hearing this, Zilu thanked him and said, "I have benefited a lot."

instruction: Why are fire trucks painted red?
output:
Most of the fire trucks we see are red. Why are fire trucks painted red? There is a certain scientific reason.

Sunlight is composed of seven colors: red, orange, yellow, green, cyan, blue, and purple, and their wavelengths and deflection angles are different. When sunlight shines on objects, various objects have different absorption and reflection abilities for light of different wavelengths, thus forming various colors. In short, if an object can reflect one or several types of light in the sunlight and absorb the rest of the light, then the object will present the color of the reflected single or complex light. Among visible light, red light has the longest light wave and the smallest deflection angle, and it is easy to pass through water layers, raindrops, dust and fog. Orange and yellow light are not afraid of obstacles and can penetrate the above objects. So the fire truck is painted red so that people can see it from a distance in foggy weather, dusty environment, or in heavy rain and storms, and make way for it so that it can complete its fire-fighting and rescue mission as quickly as possible.

instruction: Why do leopards drag their prey up trees to eat it?

instruction:
Translate the following ancient Chinese into modern Chinese characters:
King Jing asked Yan Zi, "What is the trouble with the country?" Yan Zi replied, "It's the rats on the altar." The king asked, "What do you mean?" Yan Zi replied, "The altar is made of wood tied together and covered with a road. Rats go there to take shelter. If you smoke it, you may burn the wood. If you water it, you may ruin the road. The reason why rats cannot be killed is because of the altar. The country also has altar rats, which are on the left and right of the ruler. They hide good and evil from the ruler internally and sell power to the people externally. If they are not killed, there will be chaos. If they are killed, they will be used as evidence by the ruler and they will keep it in their stomachs. They are also the altar rats of the country."
output: Duke Jing of Qi (surname Jiang, name Chujiu) asked Yan Zi, "What should we fear when governing a country?" Yan Zi replied, "I should fear the rats in the altar." Duke Jing asked, "What do you mean?" Yan Zi replied, "Speaking of the altar, wood is lined up together (束: gather, here means standing side by side), and they are coated with mud, so rats will go and live there. If you use smoke or fire, you are afraid of burning the wood, and if you use water, you are afraid of damaging the mud. The reason why these rats cannot be killed is because of the altar. The country also has them. The favorites around the monarch are the altar rats. In the court, they deceive the monarch about good and evil, and outside the court, they show off their power to the people. If they are not killed, they will do whatever they want and endanger the country; if they are to be killed, they are protected by the monarch, and the monarch shelters them and forgives them, so it is really difficult to punish them." These are the altar rats of the country.

Duke Ping of Jin said, "How can a minister mock his king?" Shi Kuang said, "How dare I, a blind man, mock the king? The burning of coal, oil and natural gas in industrial production produces a large amount of pollutants such as sulfur dioxide, nitrogen oxides and suspended particles. Traffic pollution is mainly caused by exhaust emissions from cars and motorcycles, including carbon dioxide, carbon monoxide and nitrogen oxides. Coal burning is China's main source of energy, and burning coal releases a large amount of pollutants such as carbon dioxide, sulfur dioxide and suspended particles. Biomass burning usually occurs in rural areas, such as the burning of crop straw and firewood, which produces smoke and pollutants. The Chinese government is working to reduce these pollution sources to improve air quality and protect people's health.

instruction: Refer to the following paragraph, then answer the following questions in the same language: Through: People at all levels of the organization participate in kaizen, from the CEO to the cleaning staff, and external stakeholders when applicable. Kaizen is most often associated with manufacturing, such as Toyota, but has also been used in non-manufacturing settings. Exploitation can take the form of an individual, a suggestion system, a small group, or a large group. At Toyota, this is usually a local improvement in a certain workstation or area, and involves a small group improving their own work environment and productivity. This group of people is usually guided by a front-line supervisor in the exploratory effort; sometimes this is also a key role for the line supervisor. Productivity is improved through the use of machines and computing power, total quality management is achieved, and human labor is freed up. While kaizen (at Toyota) typically results in small improvements, the culture of constantly adjusting small improvements and standardization produces large results in overall productivity improvements. This philosophy is different from the "command and control" improvement programs (e.g., business process improvement) of the mid-20th century. The kaizen approach involves making changes, monitoring results, and then adjusting. Large-scale up-front planning and extensive project scheduling are replaced by smaller experiments that can be adapted quickly as new improvements are suggested. They are limited in scope, and the questions that arise from them are often used in later lightning events. Those who have made significant contributions to the successful implementation of Kaizen during the Kaizen event are awarded the title of "Kaizen". As a way to help clients restructure and reposition their business processes, in the 21st century, business consultants in various countries began to widely adopt and share the Kaizen framework. Q: How do Toyota employees improve productivity?
output: Improve productivity through the use of machines and computing power, achieve total quality management, and free up human resources

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
(Han) Xin talked with Xiao He several times, and He was surprised. When they arrived in Nanzheng, dozens of generals fled on the road. Xin estimated that He had reported to the emperor several times, but the emperor did not use him and fled. He heard that Xin had fled, but he did not report it in time, so he chased him himself. Someone said to the emperor, "Prime Minister He is missing." The emperor was furious, as if he had lost his left and right hands. After a day or two, He came to visit the emperor. The emperor was angry and happy, and scolded He, "If he is missing, why?" He said, "I dare not flee, I will chase the fleeing." The emperor asked, "Who are you chasing?" He said, "Han Xin." The emperor scolded again, "More than a dozen generals have fled, and you have no one to chase; chasing Xin is a trick." He said, "The generals are easy to get. As for Xin, he is a peerless national talent. If the king wants to rule Hanzhong, he has no place to go. If he wants to fight for the world, there is no one to discuss matters with except Xin. I think the king will decide."
output: Han Xin talked with Xiao He many times, and Xiao He admired him very much. (Most of the Han King's subordinates were from the East, and they all wanted to return to their hometowns.) Therefore, when the team arrived in Nanzheng, dozens of officers ran away on the way. Han Xin thought that Xiao He and others had recommended him to the Han King many times, but the Han King never valued him, so he ran away. When Xiao He heard that Han Xin had escaped, he didn't have time to report the matter to the Han King, so he went to chase him. Someone who didn't know the details reported to the Han King, "Prime Minister Xiao He ran away." The Han King was very angry, as if he had lost his left and right hands. After a day or two, Xiao He came back to see the Han King. The Han King was angry and happy, and scolded: "Why did you run away?" Xiao He replied: "I didn't dare to run away, I was chasing the runaways. "Who did you chase back?" Xiao He said: "Han Xin." The Han King scolded again: "There were dozens of officers who ran away, and you didn't chase them; instead, you chased Han Xin, which is a lie. "Xiao He said: "Those officers are easy to get, but as for a talent like Han Xin, there is no other one in the world. If the king only wants to be the King of Hanzhong, of course he has no use for him; if he wants to fight for the world, there is no one else to discuss major plans with except Han Xin. It all depends on what the king plans to do."

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
The emperor went to Cuiwei Palace and asked his ministers, "Since ancient times, although the emperors pacified Zhongxia, they could not subdue Rong and Di. I am not as talented as the ancients, but my achievements are better than theirs. I will not explain the reason. Please speak your mind." The ministers all said, "Your Majesty's merits are like heaven and earth, and all things cannot be named." The emperor said, "No. The reason why I can achieve this is only due to five things. Since ancient times, emperors often hate those who are better than themselves. I see the good in others as if I have it myself. People's behavior and ability cannot be perfect at the same time. I always abandon their shortcomings and take their strengths. The ruler often promotes the virtuous and wants to put them in his care. , and when I dismiss the unworthy, I want to push them into the abyss. When I see a virtuous person, I respect him, and when I see an unworthy person, I pity him, and the virtuous and the unworthy are each in their proper place. Most rulers hate the upright, and punish them secretly or openly, without a single generation without this. Since I ascended the throne, upright people have been shoulder to shoulder in the court, and I have never dismissed or blamed a single one. Since ancient times, people have valued the Chinese and despised the barbarians and the Di people. I alone love them all equally, so their tribes all rely on me like their parents. These five are the reasons why I have achieved what I have today. ” He turned to Chu Suiliang and said, “You have been a historian. Is what I said true?” He replied, “Your Majesty’s great virtues are beyond description, and you only give yourself these five, which is probably a humble intention.”
output: Emperor Taizong of Tang asked his ministers in Cuiwei Hall: "Emperors since ancient times have pacified the Central Plains, but they could not make the ethnic minorities in the northwest submit. My talent is not greater than that of the ancient emperors, but my achievements are greater than theirs. I don't know why. Please speak frankly." The ministers all said: "Your Majesty's merits are as vast as the heaven and earth, and there is nothing to say about other things." Emperor Taizong of Tang said: "You can't say that. The reason why I have such merits is that I have achieved five things: First, since ancient times, emperors have been jealous of those who are better than themselves. When I see the advantages of others, I treat them as my own advantages, as if they were my own advantages. Second, everyone's behavioral ability cannot be perfect, so I abandon their shortcomings and take their strengths. Third, most monarchs, when they see good people, want to hold them in their arms; when they see bad people, want to push them into the abyss. But I respect talented people when I see them; when I see people who perform poorly, I educate them from the perspective of love. So that both the virtuous and the unvirtuous can be in their proper place. Fourth, most monarchs do not like people to criticize them in person, and secretly harm or openly attack those who speak out. There is no dynasty that is not like this. Since I took the throne, there have been many people who speak out, and no one has been dismissed because of this. Fifth, the tradition regards the Han people as noble and discriminates against ethnic minorities, but I am the only one who treats them equally and loves them, so ethnic minorities rely on me like they rely on their parents. The above five reasons are the reasons why I can achieve what I have today. "

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
(Tang Dynasty) Taizong asked Wei Zheng: "Looking at the emperors in recent history, there are those who passed the throne to ten generations, some who passed it to one or two generations, and some who gained and lost their positions. I am always worried, either because I am afraid that I will not be able to raise the people properly, or because I am afraid that they will become arrogant and excessive in joy and anger, but they are not aware of it. Can you tell me about it and use it as a model." Zheng replied: "Desire, joy and anger are the same for both the wise and the foolish. The wise can control them and not let them go too far, while the foolish indulge them and often lose their positions. ... I hope that Your Majesty can always control himself to ensure a good end, so that the generations will benefit from it forever."
output: Emperor Taizong of Tang asked Wei Zheng, "Looking at the emperors of recent and ancient times, some inherited the throne for ten generations, some inherited the throne for one or two generations, and some gained the world and lost it themselves. The reasons why I am always worried are that I am afraid that there is no good way to comfort and educate the people, and that I am afraid that I will become proud and lazy, and be happy and angry beyond the limit without knowing it. You can explain this to me, and I should take your words as a guideline." Wei Zheng replied, "The emotions of love, desire, happiness and anger are the same for saints and ordinary people. Saints can restrain them and not let them exceed the limit, while ordinary people indulge them and mostly lose their sense of proportion... I hope Your Majesty can always restrain yourself to ensure the virtue of a good end, then I will always rely on you for thousands of years."

instruction: What is the climate like in Italy?
output: Italy's climate varies widely, and some areas may be quite different from the Mediterranean climate. Northern Italy has a continental humid subtropical climate (according to the Köppen climate classification), such as Turin, Milan and Bologna. The coastal areas of Liguria and most of the Italian peninsula south of Florence have a Mediterranean climate. The climate of the coastal areas of the peninsula varies greatly with altitude and terrain. High altitude areas have cold, wet and snowy climates in winter. Coastal areas have mild winters and are generally quite dry in summer, while the lower valleys are quite hot in summer.

instruction:
Translate the following ancient Chinese into modern Chinese characters:
Wang Mian was from Zhuji. When he was seven or eight years old, his father ordered him to herd cattle on the ridge. He secretly went to school and listened to the students reciting books. He would memorize them silently. When he returned home at night, he forgot his cattle. His father was angry and beat him. After a while, he returned to the same state. His mother said, "You are so stupid, why don't you just listen to what you do?" Mian left and lived in a Buddhist temple. He sneaked out at night, sat on the Buddha's knee, and read with a long-burning lamp in his hand, aloud until dawn. The Buddha statues were mostly clay dolls, ferocious and scary; Mian, a little boy, acted as if he didn't see them. Han Xing of Kuaiji heard about him and was surprised. He accepted him as a disciple and became a scholar.
output: Wang Mian was from Zhuji County. When he was seven or eight years old, his father asked him to herd cattle on the ridge of the field. He sneaked into the school to listen to the students reading. After listening, he always remembered silently. When he returned home in the evening, he had forgotten about herding cattle. Wang Mian's father was furious and beat Wang Mian. After that, he was still like this. His mother said: "This child is so obsessed with reading, why not let him do it?" From then on, Wang Mian left home and lived in a temple. At night, he would secretly walk out, sit on the knees of the Buddha statue, hold a book in his hand and read by the light of the long-burning lamp in front of the Buddha statue, and read aloud until dawn. Most of the Buddha statues were made of clay, and each one had a ferocious and ferocious face, which was scary. Although Wang Mian was a child, he looked calm, as if he had not seen it. Han Xing of Anyang heard about it and felt that he was different from others, so he accepted him as a student. (Wang Mian) thus became a learned and versatile Confucian scholar.

instruction: Why can't we see any dead sea turtles?
output:
Whether on the seashore or on the seabed, few people have found the bodies of sea turtles. Is it because they are immortal? No, it is said that sea turtles, like elephants on land, can know in advance when they will die, so they look for their own cemeteries. They find a cave, crawl into the cave entrance, pass through a long passage, and reach the spacious cave, where they lie quietly and motionless until they die.

A Japanese photographer and three divers found a sea turtle cemetery in a 25-meter-deep underwater cave on the Malaysian island of Batan, with about 30 sea turtle shells scattered inside.

instruction: Why do moths fly into fire?
output:
The eyes of moths cannot be stimulated by light. When its eyes are exposed to light, the nerves will be disturbed, and the nerves in this area will affect the muscles of the wings close to the light.

As a result, the power of the wings on both sides is unbalanced, one side has more power and the other side has less power, so it cannot fly straight forward and can only fly around the light. If it is a light with flame, the circle it flies around will become smaller and smaller, and finally it will fly into the flame and be burned to death.

instruction: Where do fleas bite dogs?
output:
Flea bites on dogs look very similar to bites on human skin. They form small red papules that sometimes have red circles around them.

It may be more difficult to spot these bites under your pet's dense coat. A telltale sign that your dog has been bitten is frequent scratching. You may also see areas of hair loss or red spots on the animal's skin.

Use a flea comb to search your dog's coat for these tiny creatures. You're most likely to find them on your pet's neck, belly, lower back, and base of the tail.

If you don't see actual fleas, you may find their feces, or "dust ants." They look like tiny black peppers on your dog's skin.

instruction: Why is there a little tongue in the throat?
output:
There is a small tongue at the junction of the nose and mouth, called the uvula. When we eat, the uvula will rise up to block the passage between the mouth and nose, so that food will not rush into the nose.

When seeing a doctor, doctors often ask patients to open their mouths wide and shout "ah" to see if the uvula is red and swollen, to help diagnose whether the patient's throat is inflamed.

instruction:
Please give the translation of the following classical Chinese text:
Min Zhongshu of Taiyuan was known as a righteous man in the world. Although Zhou Dang was clean and honest, he thought he was not as good as him. Dang saw him eating beans and drinking water, and gave him raw garlic, but he accepted it but did not eat it. In the Jianwu period, he responded to the appointment of Si Tu Hou Ba. When he arrived, Ba did not do anything about government affairs, and he worked hard in vain. Zhongshu said in anger: "At first, I was honored with a good appointment, and I was happy and afraid. Now that I see you, I am happy and afraid and leave. Do you think Zhongshu is not worth asking, and should not be appointed? Appointing without asking is a mistake." Then he resigned and left.
output: There was a man named Min Zhongshu in Taiyuan. People said he was a man of integrity. Even Zhou Dang, who was honest and upright, thought he was not as good as Min Zhongshu. Zhou Dang saw Min Zhongshu drinking water with beans in his mouth, so he gave him raw garlic. Min Zhongshu accepted it but did not eat it. In the Jianwu year, Min Zhongshu was summoned by Situ Houba to be an official. When he took office, Situ Houba did not talk about state affairs, but just asked about his well-being. Zhongshu said regretfully: "When I was first appointed by you, I was happy and scared. Now that I have met you, I am neither excited nor scared. If you think Zhongshu is not smart enough to talk about politics, you should not have summoned me to be an official. Since you summoned me but did not use me, you did not know me well." So he resigned from his official position, threw down a letter of complaint and left.

instruction: Why do Chinese people celebrate the Lantern Festival?
output: The fifteenth day of the first lunar month every year is the Lantern Festival. According to records, the Lantern Festival originated in the Han Dynasty. After the death of Emperor Gaozu of the Han Dynasty, Empress Lü usurped power and the Lü clan controlled the government. Later, Zhou Bo, Chen Ping and others worked together to eliminate Empress Lü's power and supported Liu Heng as Emperor Wen of the Han Dynasty. Since the night of the elimination of the Lü clan happened to be the fifteenth day of the first lunar month, after Emperor Wen ascended the throne, he would go out of the palace in plain clothes on the fifteenth night of the first lunar month every year to celebrate with the people to commemorate the occasion. Gradually, a folk festival was formed - the Lantern Festival.

instruction: Why is hibiscus also called hibiscus?
output:
In ancient times, hibiscus was another name for lotus. Now it has become a special term for shrubs or small trees of the family Malvaceae in the plant kingdom. In order to distinguish it from the ancient name, people called it wood hibiscus, so there are the sayings of wood hibiscus and water hibiscus. The tree of wood hibiscus is 2-5 meters high, with clumps of branches and trunks, soft hairs on the stems, alternate leaves, and single flowers at the ends of the branches. The most famous hibiscus is the "Three Drunk Hibiscus", which got its name because it blooms white in the morning, turns peach at noon, and turns purple in the evening.

There is also a kind of heterochromatic hibiscus that is more peculiar than the "Three Drunk Hibiscus". Its flowers bloom for several days and change color day by day. It is white on the first day, yellow on the second day, red on the third day, purple on the fourth day, and turns brown when the flowers fade.

Hibiscus is widely planted in my country. In late autumn every year, tens of thousands of hibiscus flowers bloom in the streets of Chengdu, Sichuan, making the city look like a picturesque painting, hence the name "Chengdu".

instruction: Why should you drink more water when you have a fever?

For the human body, water is the most important substance and is closely related to human life. When you have a high fever, a large amount of water in the body will seep out from the respiratory tract and skin and evaporate. Therefore, when you have a fever, you must drink more boiled water to replenish the deficiency, otherwise you will become dehydrated and the disease will be aggravated.

In addition, water has the function of regulating body temperature. Drinking more water can lower body temperature through the evaporation of sweat or the excretion of urine to dissipate heat. In addition, some diseases are caused by the invasion of pathogenic bacteria. Drinking more water, water is absorbed by the gastrointestinal tract and enters the blood, which can dilute the toxins produced by bacteria in the blood and excrete them with urine. When you have a high fever, your body's metabolism is often disrupted, and products that are harmful to the body appear in your blood. Similarly, drinking more water can dilute and carry away these harmful substances, reducing their adverse effects on the body.

instruction: What is bamboo?
output:
Bamboo is a perennial herbaceous plant of the Poaceae family and the genus Bambusa. The name of bamboo comes from its ancient character, which looks like drooping bamboo leaves, and later evolved into the current Chinese character bamboo.
Bamboo is native to China and is abundant in tropical, subtropical and temperate regions. It is widely cultivated in China, mainly in Sichuan, Chongqing, Zhejiang and other places. It is also distributed in some countries in Asia, Africa and America worldwide. Bamboo likes warm and humid climates, has high requirements for water and heat conditions, and likes fertile soil, good drainage, and slightly acidic soil rich in organic matter and mineral elements.

instruction: In Canada, before you decide to make a U-turn or not, what should you check first?
output:
Before you decide to make a U-turn in Canada, you should first check the following points:

1. **Traffic signs and signals**: Check if there are any signs or signals prohibiting U-turns. In some areas, U-turns may only be allowed at certain times or under certain conditions.

2. **Road markings**: Observe the markings on the road to make sure that U-turns are allowed. Continuous double yellow lines usually mean that U-turns are not allowed.

3. **Traffic conditions**: Check the traffic flow in front of you, behind you, and across from you to make sure that you will not hinder or endanger other vehicles or pedestrians when making a U-turn.

4. **Visibility**: Make sure you have enough sight to make a U-turn safely, which means you need to be able to see far enough away to ensure that other drivers have time to see you and react.

In any case, you should be cautious when making a U-turn and make sure that this maneuver will not cause a traffic accident or violate traffic laws. If you are not sure whether you can make a U-turn safely, it is best to choose another place or method to change direction. Before making a U-turn, it is best to slow down and use your turn signal to notify other drivers of your intention.

instruction: Why is human blood red?

The relationship between blood and the human body is like the relationship between gasoline and a machine. The human body cannot function without blood.

instruction: Why do flat-screen TVs of the same size appear to be different sizes?
output:
Case content: Xiaohan encountered a puzzling problem when she recently bought an LCD TV. Although she had done her homework before buying the TV, when she compared the two products she liked in the store, she found that the screen of one of the two products with the same 32-inch mark seemed to be a little smaller than the other. It stands to reason that the screen, which is a component that meets the standardized production, should not be so different. Could it be that her vision is wrong? But Xiaohan firmly believes that only 100 degrees of myopia is not enough to cause such a misunderstanding. So what is going on? How is the screen size calculated? Is it true that the screens of different products of the same size are different sizes?

Expert interpretation: Screen size is actually the first thing consumers consider when buying a machine, but it is also the first thing they ignore. For most consumers, 32 inches or 42 inches are just concepts, with only a difference in size, but no actual visual comparison. In fact, the screen size of an LCD TV is measured by the length of the diagonal of the TV screen, and the unit is usually inches (1 inch is equivalent to 2.538 cm).

　　Due to the screen characteristics of LCD screens, they will not be obscured by frame lines, so generally speaking, the screen size of LCD TVs will not vary, and because LCD screens are cut according to the full size, there is usually no phenomenon of missing an inch or half an inch. However, this is only a common situation. There are also a few manufacturers in the market who use non-A-grade screens or screens with substandard craftsmanship to reduce their production costs, resulting in a screen size that is 1 to 2 cm smaller than the standard size, which seems a little smaller. Another situation is that some manufacturers have to sacrifice the size of the screen slightly in order to adjust the physical resolution of the screen. In view of this, when consumers buy LCD TVs, it is best to choose a big brand to avoid the phenomenon of "short weight" of the screen.

instruction:
Translate the following ancient text:
The emperor wanted to use Anshi, but Tang Jie said that Anshi was not suitable for a big job. The emperor asked: "Is it that a person who is good at literature cannot be appointed? Is it that a person who is good at classics cannot be appointed? Is it that a person who is good at civil service cannot be appointed?" Jie replied: "Anshi likes to study but is stuck in the past, so his opinions are pedantic. If he is appointed to govern, he will definitely make many changes." The emperor disagreed and appointed Anshi as a minister of state affairs, saying to him: "No one can understand you, because you only know classics and don't know worldly affairs." Anshi replied: "The classics are the way to govern worldly affairs." The emperor asked: "Then what should you do first?" Anshi replied: "Changing customs and making laws are what we need most now." The emperor accepted his advice.
output: The emperor (Song Renzong) wanted to appoint Wang Anshi, but Tang Jie said, "Anshi is not capable of taking on such a big responsibility." The emperor said, "Is he unreliable in literature? Is he unreliable in classics? Is he unreliable in government affairs?" Tang Jie replied, "Anshi is studious but has old-fashioned ideas. In previous discussions, his thoughts and actions were not practical. If he became an official, his policies would definitely change frequently." The emperor did not think so, and eventually appointed Wang Anshi as the vice-chancellor and said to him, "Others don't understand you and think you only know Confucian classics and are not clear about worldly affairs." Wang Anshi replied, "Confucian classics are used to plan and deal with worldly affairs." The emperor said, "What policy do you think should be implemented first?" Wang Anshi said, "We need to change the current customs, etiquette, and habits and promulgate new laws. This is exactly what we urgently need to do now." The emperor believed in and adopted (his opinion).

instruction: Why do tornadoes occur?
output:
Tornadoes are very powerful. The wind speed inside them is often as high as tens of meters to more than 100 meters per second. Tornadoes are vortices in the air. In a strongly developed cumulonimbus cloud, the air disturbance is very strong, and the temperature, humidity, wind direction and wind speed inside vary greatly.

For example, the wind speed of the descending airflow often reaches more than level 8, while the rising wind speed is generally only level 3 to 4, which makes the air disturbance inside the cumulonimbus cloud violent, resulting in vortex effect. When the vortex effect increases to a certain extent, a tornado is formed.

In addition, the temperature difference between the upper and lower layers is large, the cold air drops rapidly, and the hot air rises violently. The upper and lower layers of air are alternately disturbed, forming many small vortices. These small vortices gradually expand, surging up and down more and more violently, and finally form large vortices, which can also form tornadoes.

instruction: Q: What is the function of the brain?
output:
A: The brain is one of the most important organs in the human body, responsible for controlling a person's consciousness, emotions, perception, and movement. The functions of the brain include:
Consciousness: The brain is responsible for generating consciousness, allowing people to perceive the world around them.
Emotion: The brain is responsible for processing emotions, allowing people to experience joy, anger, sorrow, and happiness.
Perception: The brain is responsible for receiving sensory information from the outside world, such as vision, hearing, taste, smell, and touch.
Movement: The brain is responsible for controlling the movement of the body, allowing people to act.
Memory: The brain is responsible for storing and calling up memories, allowing people to learn and think.
Language: The brain is responsible for processing language information, allowing people to understand and use language.

instruction: What is the XLSX file format?
output:
Files with the XLSX extension are Microsoft Excel Open XML Format Spreadsheet files. They are ZIP compressed files created by Microsoft Excel 2007 and above based on XML.

XLSX files store the edited data of cells in a worksheet, and worksheets are stored in spreadsheets (files contain multiple worksheets). Cells in a spreadsheet are located in rows and columns and can contain styles, formats, mathematical functions, etc.

Earlier versions of Excel spreadsheet files are saved in XLS format, while XLSM files are Excel template files that support macro commands.

instruction: Please complete the following paragraph - November 21, 1894, Port Arthur fell
output: , the Beiyang Fleet only had Weihaiwei as its last base in the Bohai Sea area. The Japanese army immediately launched a siege on Weihaiwei. On January 30, 1895, at 08:30, the Japanese army occupied the Motianling Fort. The Qing army's land forts immediately concentrated on attacking the Motianling Fort. Admiral Ding Ruchang of the Navy also led Dingyuan, Jingyuan, Laiyuan, Guangping, and several mosquito boats to approach the Nanbang Fort for auxiliary shooting. The Japanese army that captured the Motianling Fort took the opportunity to capture the weakly guarded Longmiaozui Fort and used it to attack the Beiyang Fleet in front of them. The sudden bombardment caught the Beiyang Fleet off guard. One of the shells hit the observation port of the Guangping command tower, and the assistant first mate Huang Zulian was killed in the battle. On February 1, the Beibang Fort was lost, and all land transportation in Weihaiwei was cut off. Dai Zongqian, the commander of the Sui Army defending Weihai, committed suicide. The Japanese army then used light ships to attack the Beiyang Fleet's berth several times. After 04:00 on the 6th, the Japanese torpedo boat team launched a fourth attack, and at the same time, the army artillery bombarded the north bank of Weihai. The four ships Jingyuan, Jiyuan, Pingyuan, and Guangping bombarded the north bank, and the rest of the ships bombarded the torpedo boat team. The Beiyang Fleet was under heavy siege and lacked assistance. After many days of fighting, only Pingyuan, Jiyuan, and Guangping were still able to fight in the port, and the large-caliber artillery shells in each ship had long been exhausted. Seeing that there was no hope of breaking out and rescue was delayed, Ding Ruchang ordered the sinking of all damaged ships to avoid aiding the enemy. On the 9th, Guangping sank the stranded Jingyuan with a torpedo, and then approached Dingyuan and placed 350 pounds of explosives in the middle of the ship. At 15:15, the explosives exploded, destroying the engine room of Dingyuan, and the two chimneys of Dingyuan also fell to one side. On the 11th, Ding Ruchang committed suicide by taking poison. In the following days, the captain of Guangping, Cheng Biguang, and the director of Weihaiwei Camp Affairs Office, Niu Changying, went in and out of Songdao many times to discuss surrender. At 08:30 on the 17th, the combined fleet entered Weihaiwei Port. The remaining ten ships of the Beiyang Fleet, including Guangping, lowered the Qing Dynasty flag and raised the Japanese flag.

instruction: Why can thousands of people talk on the same optical fiber at the same time?
output:
In order for optical fiber to complete communication, voice and image signals must first be converted into optical signals suitable for optical fiber transmission. This work is called "modulation" in communication technology and is completed by a "modulator". The "modulator" can modulate different voice and image signals into optical signals with different frequency bands. Since the frequency band of light waves is very wide, there is a lot of room for selection, which can meet the needs of a large number of different telephone frequency bands.

　　Theoretically, on such a wide frequency band of optical fiber, it is not a problem for 100 million people to talk at the same time. However, due to the limitations of the optoelectronic conversion equipment itself, this capacity cannot be achieved in practice, but it is not a problem to allow thousands of telephones to communicate unimpeded at the same time! In actual use, tens of thousands of phone calls or thousands of TV programs can be transmitted simultaneously on an optical fiber thinner than a hair.

If dozens of optical fibers are combined into one optical cable, its capacity can be imagined.

The population density of the district is 285 people per square kilometer. In the decade 2001-2011, the population growth rate was 27.97%. The sex ratio of Poonchi is 890 females per 1000 males and the literacy rate is 68.69%. 90.45% of the population of the district are Muslims. The ethnic groups of residents include Gujjars, Bakerwals, Paharis, Punjabis, Kashmiris and Rajputs. The Gujjars mainly live on the hillsides. The residents usually cultivate small plots of land and own some cattle. Apart from the Kashmiris, the rest of the population speaks Pahari-Potwari (Poonchi) and only a very small number of the population may speak Dogri. Despite their different beliefs, the widespread use of Pahari helps to connect the people with a common morality. Q: What was the population of Poonch, India in 2011?
output: 476,820 people

What is "language contact" in linguistics?
output: Answer: Language contact refers to the mutual influence and communication between different languages ​​and language users. It involves phenomena such as language loanwords, language transfer and language variants between different languages, as well as language contact and language change between language communities.
